To Amend Section 77-3-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Amount Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Assessment Shall Not Exceed The Total Legislative Appropriation And That The Proceeds Of Such Assessment Shall Be Deposited Into The State Treasury For The Credit Of The General Fund; To Amend Section 93-21-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Domestic Violence Division Of The Office Of Attorney General Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 97-3-54.8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Relief For Victims Of Human Trafficking Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 97-33-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Charitable Bingo Fund Shall Be Diverted Into The State General Fund And The Charitable Bingo Law Shall Be Administered By Appropriation From The State General Fund; To Amend Section 97-45-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Attorney General's Cyber Crime Central Special Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 99-41-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Crime Victims Compensation Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; And For Related Purposes.

887.title: Highway 315; reconstruct a portion of.
887.description: An Act To Direct The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Construct, Reconstruct, Straighten And Realign A Certain Segment Of Highway 315 In Panola County, To Designate Such Highway Segment As A Part Of The State Highway System And To Place Such Highway Under The Jurisdiction Of The Transportation Commission; And For Related Purposes.

888.title: Trucks; remove the requirement that visibility must be bad from the requirement to reduce speed during inclement weather.
888.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That Visibility Must Be Bad From The Requirement That All Trucks, Or Truck-trailer Combinations, And Passenger Buses Shall Be Required To Reduce Speed To Forty-five Miles Per Hour During Inclement Weather; And For Related Purposes.

889.title: Motor vehicles; require insurance sticker indicating valid motor vehicle insurance.
889.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require An Insurance Sticker Be Maintained On Motor Vehicles On The Lower, Driver's Side Of The Front Windshield Of The Motor Vehicle To Indicate Proof Of Financial Responsibility; To Require Insurance Companies To Issue The Sticker; To Provide The Same Provisions And Penalties For Failure To Maintain As Provided For Insurance Cards; And For Related Purposes.

890.title: Recognition and welcome signs; allow for placement adjacent to state highways in unincorporated area of counties.
890.description: An Act To Allow For The Placement Of Welcome And Recognition Signs On State Highways Within An Unincorporated Area Of A County; To Authorize The Department Of Transportation To Erect Certain Signs For Member Institutions Of The Mississippi Association Of Independent Colleges And Universities; To Require The Institutions For Which The Signs Are Erected To Purchase And Pay The Cost Of Erecting And Maintaining Such Signs; And For Related Purposes.

891.title: Traffic signs; require MDOT to replace those in disrepair that lead to the Jacinto Courthouse in Alcorn County.
891.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Replace All Directional Traffic Signs For The Jacinto Courthouse In Alcorn County, Mississippi, That The Department Finds To Be In Disrepair; And For Related Purposes.

892.title: Driver's license; authorize the Commissioner of Public Safety to display blood type on at request of recipient.
892.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-35 And 45-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Public Safety To Display A Recipient's Blood Type On A Driver's License Or Identification Card; And For Related Purposes.

893.title: Seat belts; require all passengers of a motor vehicle to use.
893.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Passengers In A Motor Vehicle To Wear A Properly Fastened Safety Seat Belt System While The Motor Vehicle Is Operated On A Public Road; And For Related Purposes.

894.title: Seat belts; provide that failure to use may be considered as contributory or comparative negligence.
894.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-2-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Failure To Use A Seat Belt May Be Considered Contributory Negligence, Comparative Negligence Or A Failure To Mitigate Damages In Civil Cases; And For Related Purposes.

895.title: Radar speed detection equipment; authorize sheriffs and deputies to use on county roads outside of municipalities.
895.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Sheriff And Deputy Sheriffs Of Any County To Use Radar Speed Detection Equipment Upon Any Public Road, Street Or Highway Within The County, Excluding Any Interstate Highway, Lying Outside Of The Corporate Limits Of Any Incorporated Municipality; To Require The Governing Authority Of The County To Conduct An Investigation To Determine Safe And Reasonable Speeds, And Post Speed Limits Accordingly, Before Using Radar Equipment; To Provide That All Fines Collected By A County From The Use Of Radar Shall Be Deposited Into A Fund To Be Appropriated By The Legislature For Maintenance, Reconstruction And/or Repair Of Existing Highways And Bridges; And For Related Purposes.

896.title: MS Center for Legal Services Corporation Fund; create and authorize deposits into.
896.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Filing Fee For A Petition To Expunge An Offense; To Provide That A Certain Amount Of The Fee Shall Be Deposited Into The Mississippi Center For Legal Services Corporation Fund; And For Related Purposes.

897.title: Uninsured motorist coverage; provide that limits will be equal to liability coverage unless insured selects otherwise.
897.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-11-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Uninsured Motorist Coverage Limits Shall Be Automatically Equal To The Limits Of Bodily Injury Liability Coverage And Property Damage Liability Coverage Unless The Insured Specifically Selects Uninsured Motorist Coverage Of Lesser Limits; And For Related Purposes.

898.title: Uninsured motorist coverage; provide that coverage is mandatory in every automobile liability insurance policy.
898.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-11-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Mandate Uninsured Motorist Coverage In All Automobile Liability Insurance Policies; And For Related Purposes.

899.title: Motor vehicle liability insurance policy; require to include medical payment coverage.
899.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-15-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Motor Vehicle Liability Insurance Policies To Include Medical Payment Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

900.title: Workers' compensation; require emergency hearing upon request of either party.
900.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Workers' Compensation Commission To Order An Emergency Hearing Upon Request Or Petition Of Either Party For Such Hearing; And For Related Purposes.

901.title: Railroads; establish procedure for crossing of by utilities.
901.description: An Act To Provide That A Utility May Cross A Class Iii Railroad's Right-of-way If The Utility Gives Notice, Pays A Crossing Fee And Provides A Certificate Of Insurance; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Provide That A Utility Is Not Required To Pay A Fee To A Railroad If It Is Crossing In The Public Right-of-way; To Require A Utility To Pay For Reasonable Flagging Expense Related To The Crossing; To Specify The Amount Of Insurance A Utility Must Carry During The Construction Of The Crossing; To Provide Certain Procedures For A Railroad To Object To The Crossing; And For Related Purposes.

902.title: Community-Based Placement for At-risk Children Pilot Program; create.
902.description: An Act To Create The Community-based Placement For At-risk Children Pilot Program In Order To Plan For Early Intervention With At-risk Children In The County In Which The Pilot Program Is Located; To Enact Standards For Community-based Homes; To Provide Standards For Determination Of Eligibility Of Children For Placement Under The Pilot Program; To Authorize Reasonable Reimbursement For Expenses Of Placements To The Community-based Homes; To Authorize Funding For The Pilot Program; To Provide For Supervision Of And Reporting By The Pilot Program; And For Related Purposes.

903.title: Tax assessors and collectors; revise the compensation provided to.
903.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Salaries Of County Assessors Or Tax Collector, Or Both If The Office Of Assessor Has Been Combined With The Office Of Tax Collector; To Bring Forward Section 25-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Cap On The Salaries Of Tax Assessors, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

904.title: School districts; require uniform accounting system to address local, state and federal funds and transfer audit powers to SDE.
904.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-37-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Uniform Accounting System Prescribed By The State Department Of Education For All School Districts To Include A Method To Keep Records Of All Local, State And Federal Funds; To Amend Section 37-61-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer The Authority To Conduct Financial Audits On School Districts From The State Department Of Audit To The State Department Of Education; And For Related Purposes.

905.title: IHL Board; authorize to increase rate charged per square foot to occupants of properties under its jurisdiction.
905.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-141-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Increase The Rate Charged To Occupants Of Certain Facilities Under Its Jurisdiction To $4.50 Per Square Foot For Services Provided By The Board; And For Related Purposes.

906.title: Memorial highways; designate various segments of highways as.
906.description: An Act To Designate A Segment Of Old U.s. Highway 45 In Alcorn, Prentiss And Lee Counties As "rockabilly Way"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 589 In Lamar County As The "police Chief Willie James Preston Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Bridge On Mississippi Highway 302 In Desoto County That Spans Interstate Highway 55 As "senator George E. Guerieri, Sr., Memorial Bridge"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 35 Within The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Batesville, Mississippi, As The Leonard Morris Memorial Highway; To Designate A Portion Of United States Highway 82 In Leflore County As The "b.b. King Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Portion Of Highway 8 West Of The Town Of Pace As The Juniper Yates "jy" Trice Memorial Highway; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Interstate Highway 55 In Pike County, Mississippi, As The "bo Diddley Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Certain Segment Of Interstate 220 In Hinds County As The Senator Alice Varnado Harden Memorial Highway; To Designate A Portion Of Interstate 220 In Hinds County As The Senator Henry J. Kirksey Memorial Highway; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Develop A Program On How Persons Should Respond To Law Enforcement Officers When Stopped; To Amend Section 37-25-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Driver's Education Programs Taught In Public Schools To Include A Program Developed By The Department Of Public Safety On How Persons Should Respond To Law Enforcement Officers When Stopped; To Require Nonpublic Schools That Offer A Driver's Education Program To Include In Such Program The Program Developed By The Department Of Public Safety On How To Respond To Law Enforcement Officers When Stopped; To Create New Section 65-9-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Division Of State Aid Road Construction To Administer A Certain Bridge Replacement Project On Mississippi Highway 407 In Attala County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

907.title: Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning; increase certain fees charged by.
907.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-141-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Fee That The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning May Charge State Agencies And Other Entities That Occupy Portions Of The Paul B. Johnson, Jr., Building, The Edsel E. Thrash Universities Center And The Etv Building For Utilities, Maintenance And Security; And For Related Purposes.

908.title: State Health Insurance Plan; require to cover certain annual examinations.
908.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan To Include Coverage For Annual Pap Smears And Annual Psa Tests As Part Of The Annual Wellness Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

909.title: Nurse-Family Partnership Pilot Program; require to be established and funded through TANF funds.
909.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-117-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Health To Establish The Nurse-family Partnership Pilot Program In The State Department Of Health; To Provide That The Pilot Program Shall Be Funded Annually Through The Tanf Block Grant Administered By The Department Of Human Services; To Limit The Pilot Program To 100 Families Per Year From Certain Counties; To Bring Forward Section 43-17-5, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

910.title: Mississippi Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship for Students with Dyslexia Program; expand to include students in Grades K through 12.
910.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-173-1, 37-173-3, 37-173-7 And 37-173-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Eligibility For The Mississippi Dyslexia Therapy Scholarship For Students With Dyslexia Program To Include Students In Kindergarten Through Grade 12; And For Related Purposes.

911.title: Mississippi Dyslexia Forgivable Loan Program; increase number of students allowed in each cohort to 40.
911.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Number Of Students Admitted To Each Cohort For The Mississippi Dyslexia Forgivable Loan Program From 20 To 40 Beginning With The 2017-2018 Collegiate Academic Year; And For Related Purposes.

913.title: Right to vote; restore to people who committed disqualifying crimes once they complete all sentencing requirements.
913.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Who Has Committed Any Disqualifying Crime As Provided In Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Shall Have His Or Her Right To Vote Restored Immediately After Completing All Of The Sentencing Requirements; To Amend Section 23-15-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Bring Forward Section 23-15-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

914.title: CON; direct Department of Health to issue for new end-stage renal disease facility in City of Senatobia.
914.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Direct The State Department Of Health To Issue A Certificate Of Need For The Establishment Of A New End-stage Renal Disease (esrd) Facility Within The City Limits Of The City Of Senatobia; To Provide That The Requirement For Substantial Compliance With The Projection Of Need As Reported In The Current State Health Plan Are Waived For The Purposes Of This Facility; And For Related Purposes.

915.title: Joint state-county work program; authorize judges to order offenders to participate in.
915.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-451, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A County Or Circuit Court Judge May Order Certain Offenders To Participate In A Joint State-county Work Program If The District Attorney And Sheriff Of The County Agree To Such Participation; To Amend Section 47-5-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

916.title: Joint state-county work program; revise eligibility requirements for program.
916.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-5-451, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Eligibility Requirements For Joint State-county Work Programs; To Amend Section 47-5-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

917.title: Gaming; increase maximum compensation allowed per bingo session for persons conducting licensed games under Charitable Bingo Law.
917.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-33-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $400.00 To $600.00 The Maximum Compensation Allowed Per Bingo Session For Conducting Licensed Games Under The Charitable Bingo Law, Unless Otherwise Provided For By The Mississippi Gaming Commission; And For Related Purposes.

918.title: Delta State University; authorize to enter into a long-term lease for specified purposes.
918.description: An Act To Authorize Delta State University, With The Approval Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Lease A Certain Portion Of Its Property Located In The City Of Cleveland, Bolivar County, Mississippi, For A Term Of No More Than 40 Years; And For Related Purposes.

919.title: Juvenile offenders convicted of murder; revise sentencing options for.
919.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Alternative Sentencing Options For Juvenile Offenders In Certain Murder Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

920.title: Gaming; bring forward sections to authorize terminal gaming machines.

921.title: Gaming; sale of certain scratch-off cards is illegal gambling activity.
921.description: An Act To Make It Unlawful For Any Person To Sell Cards, Tokens, Chips Or Similar Items, That Entitle A Buyer To Long Distance Telephone Service Or Other Forms Of Service, And That Are Attached To, Accompanied By Or Part Of A Scratch Pad, Bar Code Or Similar Item That The Buyer May Use To Win, Redeem Or Otherwise Obtain Anything Of Value Greater Than The Amount Paid For The Card, Token, Chip Or Other Item; To Require The State Gaming Commission To Establish And Maintain A Toll-free Telephone Number For The Purpose Of Receiving Reports Of Illegal Gambling Activities; To Amend Sections 97-33-1, 97-33-7, 97-33-9 And 75-76-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

922.title: Petitions for municipal annexation; require practical ingress and egress to and from public roads be included in.
922.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-1-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In A Petition For Municipal Annexation, The Petition Must Certify Any Property To Be Annexed Shall Have A Practical Ingress And Egress To And From A Public Road; To Amend Section 21-1-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Certain Exceptions For Certain Property Owners During An Annexation When A Practical Ingress And Egress To And From A Public Road Is Not Present For Within An Annexation; And For Related Purposes.

924.title: Mining permits; provide that local zoning authority shall not impair.
924.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Local Ordinances And Regulations Shall Not Control Or Supersede Mining Permits Issued By The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; To Bring Forward Section 17-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972,for Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

925.title: Health Care Collaboration Act; create.
925.description: An Act To Authorize The University Of Mississippi Medical Center Subject To Approval By The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Enter Into Joint-purchasing Arrangements, Joint Ventures, Joint-operating Agreements, Or Similar Arrangements With Community Hospitals Or Other Public Or Private Health-related Organizations In Order To Participate In Financial Or Clinical Integration Or Clinically Integrated Networks And To Provide For Contracts Of Employment, Services And Ownership Of Property Under Such Arrangements; To Amend Section 11-46-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Health Care Practitioners Working Under Such Arrangements Are Covered By The Tort Claims Act; To Amend Sections 31-7-1 And 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Application Of The Public Purchasing Laws To Such Arrangements; And For Related Purposes.

926.title: Underground Storage Tank Advisory Council; create.
926.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-17-421, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Manner In Which The Underground Storage Tank Regulatory Fee Is Determined; To Require The Mississippi Commission On Environmental Quality To Consider The Report From The Underground Storage Tank Advisory Council And Any Public Comments When Setting The Annual Storage Tank Fee; To Create New Section 49-17-422, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Underground Storage Tank Advisory Council; To Require The Advisory Council To Conduct An Independent Study Of The Costs Related To The Underground Storage Tank Program; To Require The Advisory Council To Recommend An Equitable Fee System For The Storage Tank Program; And For Related Purposes.

927.title: Qualified Small Employer Health Reimbursement Arrangement Act; create.
927.description: An Act To Create The Qualified Small Employer Health Reimbursement Arrangement Act; To Bring Forward Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

928.title: County officials; increase the salaries of certain.
928.description: An Act To Increase The Compensation Paid To Certain County Officials; To Amend Section 19-3-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Supervisors Education And Certification Program For County Supervisors; To Provide An Annual Salary Supplement Upon Attaining Certification; To Authorize Reimbursement For Certain Expenses Associated With Attendance At The Education And Certification Program; To Amend Section 25-3-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Salaries Of The Members Of The Boards Of Supervisors; To Amend Section 9-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Limit On The Compensation For Chancery Clerks And Circuit Clerks; To Amend Section 25-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Filing Fees Charged By Chancery Clerks For The Recording Of Documents; To Amend Section 25-60-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Sections 41-61-59 And 41-61-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Compensation Paid To The County Medical Examiners, Deputy Medical Examiners And Deputy Medical Examiner Investigators; To Amend Section 23-15-153, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Per Diem Paid To Election Commissioners For The Performance Of Their Duties In The Conduct Of An Election Or In The Performance Of Their Duties In Revising The Registration Books And Pollbooks; To Provide That Election Commissioners Who Perform The Duties Of An Executive Committee With Regard To Conducting A Primary Election Shall Receive A Per Diem In The Amount Of $150.00; To Amend Section 25-3-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Salaries Of County Assessors Or Tax Collectors, Or Both If The Office Of Assessor Has Been Combined With The Office Of Tax Collector; To Bring Forward Section 25-3-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides A Cap On The Salaries Of Tax Assessors, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees Charged By Marshals And Constables And For Related Purposes.

929.title: Office of Educator Standards and Licensure; create.
929.description: An Act To Codify New Section 37-3-2.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Office Of Educator Standards And Licensure Within The State Department Of Education; To Provide For The Appointment Of The Director Of The Office Of Educator Standards And Licensure, Who Shall Report Directly To The State Superintendent Of Public Education And The State Board Of Education; To Require The Office To Establish Standards For Educator Preparation Programs And For The Issuance And Renewal Of Educator Licenses; To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Duties Of The Commission On Teacher And Administrator Education, Certification And Licensure And Development Relating To The Issuance Of Educator Licenses In Accordance With The Requirements Established By The Office Of Educator Standards And Licensure; To Amend Section 37-3-89, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

930.title: State Department of Education; remove from certain State Personnel Board procedures for a period of three years.
930.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For A Period Of Three Years, The Personnel Actions Of The State Department Of Education Subject To The Regulations Of The State Personnel Board Shall Be Exempt From State Personnel Board Procedures, And All Employees Of The Agency Shall Be Classified As Nonstate Service During That Period; To Amend Sections 37-3-13, 37-3-25, 37-3-95, 37-13-80 And 43-5-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

931.title: Campaign contributions; revise use of.
931.description: An Act To Prohibit The Personal Use Of Campaign Contributions By Any Elected Public Office Holder Or Any Candidate For Public Office; To Specifically Prohibit Certain Personal Use Expenditures; To Provide That Any Expense That Directly Results From Campaign Or Officeholder Activity Is Permitted; To Provide For The Disposal Of Campaign Contributions Once A Termination Report Is Filed; To Provide Penalties; To Require The Secretary Of State To Issue Advisory Opinions Regarding The Use Of Campaign Contributions; To Amend Section 23-15-801, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Changes; To Amend Section 23-15-803, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Deadline For Filing A Statement Of Organization For A Political Committee To 48 Hours; To Require The Disclosure Of The Name, Address, Officers And Members Of A Political Committee, The Designation Of The Chair And The Custodian Of Financial Books And Records; To Allow The Secretary Of State To Administratively Fine Political Committees Not More Than $5,000.00, Per Violation, For Failing To Comply With Filing Requirements; To Amend Section 23-15-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Candidates To File Campaign Finance Reports Directly With The Secretary Of State By Fax, Email, Postal Mail Or Hand Delivery; To Amend Section 23-15-807, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Unopposed Candidates Are Not Required To File Pre-election Reports But Must File All Other Reports; To Provide That The Required Disclosure Of An Expenditure To A Credit Card Issuer, Financial Institution Or Business Allowing Payments And Money Transfers To Be Made Over The Internet To Include, Either By Detail Or A Separate Entity, The Amount Of The Funds Passing To Each Person, Business Entity Or Organization Receiving Funds From The Expenditure; To Amend Section 23-15-811, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Secretary Of State Or Attorney General May Bring A Mandamus Action To Compel The Required Campaign Finance Disclosure Reports; To Amend Section 23-15-813, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Changes; To Bring Forward Sections 23-15-809, 23-15-815 And 23-15-817, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

932.title: Campaign finance reports; require certain disclosures relating to credit card purchases.
932.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-807, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Candidate Or Political Committee To Disclose Certain Expenditures To A Credit Card Company Or Certain Other Kinds Of Companies On Their Campaign Finance Report; And For Related Purposes.

933.title: Campaign contributions; require disposal of in certain situations.
933.description: An Act To Create New Section 23-15-802, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Candidate Who Withdraws From A Campaign Seeking Election Or Reelection To An Office, Is Defeated As A Candidate For An Office, Resigns From Office, Files A Termination Report, Or Retains Or Raises Campaign Funds For The Purpose Of Running In A Future Election But Fails To Qualify To Dispose Of All Of His Or Her Campaign Contributions; To Bring Forward Sections 23-15-801, 23-15-803, 23-15-805, 23-15-807, 23-15-809, 23-15-811, 23-15-813, 23-15-815 And 23-15-817, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Require The Disclosure Of Certain Campaign Finances, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

934.title: Campaign contributions; prohibit personal use of and revise to require detailed and electronic reporting of.
934.description: An Act To Prohibit The Personal Use Of Campaign Contributions By Any Elected Public Office Holder Or Any Candidate For Public Office; To Specifically Prohibit Certain Personal Use Expenditures; To Provide That Any Expense That Directly Results From Campaign Or Officeholder Activity Is Permitted; To Provide For The Disposal Of Campaign Contributions Once A Termination Report Is Filed; To Provide Penalties; To Require The Secretary Of State To Issue Advisory Opinions Regarding The Use Of Campaign Contributions; To Amend Section 23-15-801, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Changes; To Amend Section 23-15-803, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Deadline For Filing A Statement Of Organization For A Political Committee To 48 Hours; To Require The Disclosure Of The Name, Address, Officers And Members Of A Political Committee, The Designation Of The Chair And The Custodian Of Financial Books And Records; To Allow The Secretary Of State To Administratively Fine Political Committees Not More Than $5,000.00, Per Violation, For Failing To Comply With Filing Requirements; To Amend Section 23-15-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Candidates To File Campaign Finance Reports Directly With The Secretary Of State By Fax, Email, Postal Mail Or Hand Delivery; To Require, Beginning With The 2018 Election Cycle, All Statements, Reports Of Contributions And Expenditures, And Other Reports To Be Filed Electronically Over The Internet; To Require The Secretary Of State, Beginning With The 2018 Election Cycle, To Implement And Maintain An Electronic Database Accessible By The Public Through The Secretary Of State's Website That Provides The Capability Of Search And Retrieval Of All Statements, Reports Of Contributions And Expenditures, And Other Reports Required To Be Filed With The Secretary Of State; To Amend Section 23-15-807, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Unopposed Candidates Are Not Required To File Pre-election Reports But Must File All Other Reports; To Provide That The Required Disclosure Of An Expenditure To A Credit Card Issuer, Financial Institution Or Business Allowing Payments And Money Transfers To Be Made Over The Internet To Include, Either By Detail Or A Separate Entity, Must Include The Amount Of The Funds Passing To Each Person, Business Entity Or Organization Receiving Funds From The Expenditure; To Amend Section 23-15-811, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Secretary Of State Or Attorney General May Bring A Mandamus Action To Compel The Required Campaign Finance Disclosure Reports; To Amend Section 23-15-813, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Changes; To Bring Forward Sections 23-15-809, 23-15-815 And 23-15-817, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

935.title: Campaign contributions; prohibit personal use of.
935.description: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of Campaign Contributions For Personal Use; To Provide The Allowable And Prohibited Uses Of Campaign Contributions; To Provide For The Disposition Of Unused Campaign Contributions; To Provide Penalties For Improper Use Of Campaign Contributions; To Prohibit The Governor, Lieutenant Governor Or Any Member Of The Legislature From Soliciting Or Receiving Campaign Contributions During Any Legislative Session; And For Related Purposes.

937.title: Motor vehicles; prohibit state agencies from purchasing for one year.
937.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-78, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From July 1, 2017, Through June 30, 2018, State Agencies Are Prohibited From Purchasing, Leasing Or Acquiring Any Motor Vehicle, Regardless Of The Source Of Funds Used; To Exempt Vehicles Of The Department Of Child Protection Services From The Preceding Provisions; To Amend Section 25-3-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require State Agencies To Use A Trip Optimizer Type System Developed And Administered By The Department Of Finance And Administration In Computing The Optimum Method And Cost For Travel By State Officers And Employees Using A Motor Vehicle Where The Travel Will Exceed One Hundred Miles Per Day And The Officer Or Employee Is Not Driving A State-owned Or State-leased Vehicle That Has Been Dedicated Or Assigned To The Officer Or Employee; To Provide That The Maximum Authorized Amount Of Travel Reimbursement Related To Motor Vehicle Usage Shall Be The Lowest Cost Option As Determined By The Trip Optimizer Type System; To Amend Section 25-1-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Agencies Making Requests For Authority To Purchase, Lease Or Acquire Vehicles To Submit The Lowest Cost Vehicle Possible To Carry Out Its Intended Use; To Provide That The Bureau Of Fleet Management Shall Only Approve The Lowest Cost Vehicle, Which In Its Estimation, Will Carry Out The Intended Use; To Prohibit Agencies From Purchasing Any Vehicle That The Bureau Of Fleet Management Has Disapproved As Being A Higher Cost Option; And For Related Purposes.

938.title: Division of State Aid Road Construction; authorize to administer a bridge replacement project on Mississippi Highway 407 in Attala County.
938.description: An Act To Create New Section 65-9-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Division Of State Aid Road Construction To Administer A Certain Bridge Replacement Project On Mississippi Highway 407 In Attala County, Mississippi; To Bring Forward Section 65-9-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

939.title: DFA; revise the definition of "construction" to clarify incidental installation cost of furniture and equipment less than $50,000.00.
939.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of Term "construction" For The Purpose Of Including The Incidental Cost Of Installing Furniture And Equipment That Is Less Than $50,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

940.title: Budget process; bring forward various sections relating to.
940.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 27-103-125, 27-103-139, 27-103-203, 27-103-211, 27-103-213, 27-103-301, 43-13-407 And 65-37-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To Various Aspects Of The Budget Process, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 27-103-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Amounts That May Be Transferred From The Capital Expense Fund To The Bureau Of Building, Grounds And Real Property Management For A Single Emergency And For All Emergencies During Any Fiscal Year; To Bring Forward Sections 41-113-3 And 41-113-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Office Of Tobacco Control In The State Department Of Health And Provide For Its Duties, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 41-113-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Funds Appropriated From The Tobacco Control Program Fund That Are Unexpended At The End Of Fiscal Year 2017 Shall Lapse Into Health Care Expendable Fund; And For Related Purposes.

942.title: Mental health courts; establish statewide standards.
942.description: An Act To Authorize Mental Health Court Intervention Programs; To Specify The Purpose And Goals Of Mental Health Courts; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Provide That The Administrative Office Of Courts Shall Be Responsible For Certification And Monitoring Of Local Mental Health Courts; To Establish The State Drug Courts Advisory Committee; To Specify Minimum Standards For Mental Health Courts; To Provide Certain Mental Health Court Intervention Services; To Set Forth Alternative Sentencing Eligibility Criteria And Conditions; To Designate The Powers Of The Administrative Office Of Courts Regarding Mental Health Courts; To Authorize Mental Health Courts To Receive Funds And Assess Reasonable Fees; To Provide Immunity To Persons Who Perform Their Mental Health Court Duties In Good Faith; To Provide That Persons Who Complete All Requirements Imposed By The Mental Health Court Will Have The Record Expunged; To Establish The Mental Health Court Fund; To Amend Section 43-21-357, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Youth Court Intake Unit To Recommend That A Child Be Referred To The Youth Court Mental Health Court And To Allow The Youth Court The Option To Order That A Child Be Referred To The Youth Court Mental Health Court; To Amend Section 25-3-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify Duties Imposed On Supreme Court Justices, Chancery Court Judges And Circuit Court Judges Relating To Mental Health Courts; And For Related Purposes.

943.title: Marshals and constables; revise fees charged by.
943.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Fees Charged By Marshals And Constables; And For Related Purposes.

944.title: Civil actions; provide that P & C insurers have burden of proof for exclusions in "all perils" coverage policy.
944.description: An Act To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against A Property And Casualty Insurer Under An "all Perils" Coverage Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy; And For Related Purposes.

945.title: DUI; revise nonadjudication eligibility of those with a commercial driver's license.
945.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Eligibility For Nonadjudication Of Those Holding A Commercial Driver's License; And For Related Purposes.

946.title: Drug crimes; revise sentencing for certain.
946.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Sentencing For Certain Drug Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

947.title: Drug enhancements; revise penalties.
947.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Drug Offense Enhancements; To Repeal Section 41-29-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Sentencing Enhancements On Second Drug Offense Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

948.title: Drug Offense Enhancements; revise.
948.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Drug Offense Enhancements; To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The List Of Offenses That Render A Person Convicted Between 1995 And 2014 Ineligible For Parole; To Repeal Section 41-29-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Sentencing Enhancements On Second Drug Offense Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

949.title: Parole eligibility; provide uniformity for certain offenders who were convicted between June 30, 1995 and July 1, 2014.
949.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Offenders Convicted Of Certain Crimes Between June 30, 1995, And July 1, 2014, Shall Be Eligible For A Parole Hearing; And For Related Purposes.

950.title: Parole; clarify offenses that render a person convicted between 1995 and 2014 ineligible for.
950.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The List Of Offenses That Render A Person Convicted Between 1995 And 2014 Ineligible For Parole; And For Related Purposes.

951.title: Parole eligibility; revise for offenders 60 years of age or older who have served at least 10 years.
951.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Offender 60 Years Of Age Or Older Who Has Served At Least 10 Years Shall Be Eligible For A Parole Hearing; And For Related Purposes.

952.title: Offenders who received life sentences for committing nonviolent crimes; provide opportunity to petition sentencing courts for parole.
952.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Inmate, Who Has Been Convicted Of Committing A Nonviolent Offense And Who Has Received A Life Sentence Or A Sentence Of At Least 40, Years An Opportunity To Petition His Or Her Sentencing Court For Parole After Serving 10 Years Of That Sentence; To Amend Sections 99-19-81 And 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

953.title: Trusty status and earned time allowances; revise eligibility criteria for offenders.
953.description: An Act To Amend Sections 47-5-138.1, 47-7-3.2 And 47-5-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Eligibility Criteria For Trusty Status And Earned Time Allowances For Inmates; And For Related Purposes.

954.title: Sex crimes against "physically helpless persons"; prohibit courts from suspending sentences for persons who committed.
954.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Courts From Suspending The Sentences Of Persons And Placing Such Persons On Probation If Such Persons Have Been Convicted Of Committing Certain Sex Crimes Against Physically Helpless Persons; To Amend Sections 47-7-33 And 47-7-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

955.title: "Mississippi Universal Prekindergarten Program Act of 2017"; enact.
955.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Universal Prekindergarten Program Act Of 2017"; To Define The Terms Used Herein; To Provide For The Public Funding Of The Program Which Shall Be Available To Parents And Families On A Voluntary Participation Basis; To Prescribe The Minimum Standards Of Education Required To Be Offered To Children Enrolled In The Program; To Prescribe The Manner By Which Payments Will Be Made To Prekindergarten Programs Whether Such Programs Be Offered Through The Public School District Of Residence, An Outside District Or Through A Prequalified Private Provider; To Establish The Minimum Standards Required For The Prequalification Of Private Providers; To Prescribe The Manner By Which Local School Districts Shall Account For Students Enrolled In Prekindergarten Programs For Purposes Of Determining Average Daily Attendance To Calculate Its Annual Budget Request; To Provide That The Program Shall Be Jointly Administered By The State Board Of Education And The Division Of Early Childhood Care And Development, Which Shall Jointly Promulgate Rules And Regulations Governing The Program; To Provide For The Expansion Of School-based Prekindergarten Programs; To Require The Board And The Division To Establish A Process To Calculate The Annual Statewide Tuition Rate For Prekindergarten Education; To Provide For An Administrative Procedures Process For Entities Aggrieved By Actions Of The Board And Division; To Require Annual Reports On The Efficacy Of The Programs And Any Recommendation For Improvement Or Discontinuation To The Legislature; To Bring Forward Section 37-21-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

956.title: Insurance adjusters; revise licensing laws regarding.
956.description: An Act To Amend Sections 83-17-407 And 83-17-417, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Commissioner Of Insurance With A Licensure Waiver And Exemption For Certain Adjuster License Applicants; And For Related Purposes.

957.title: License examiner; require the Department of Public Safety to place within the City of Canton.
957.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Furnish A License Examiner Within The City Of Canton, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

958.title: Commissioner of Revenue; authorize to appoint an attorney on his staff to prosecute crimes investigated by the Dept. of Revenue.
958.description: An Act To Authorize The Commissioner Of Revenue To Designate An Attorney On Staff With The Department Of Revenue To Prosecute Criminal Matters And Cases Investigated By The Department; To Authorize The Commissioner To Request The Services Or Assistance Of Any District Attorney Or The Attorney General In And About Such Matters Or Suits; To Provide That The Designated Attorney Shall Have The Same Right As The District Attorney To Enter The Grand Jury Room While The Grand Jury Is In Session And To Perform Such Services With Reference To The Work Of The Grand Jury As The District Attorney Is Authorized By Law To Perform; And For Related Purposes.

959.title: Municipal court judges; require to be elected.
959.description: An Act To Require The Office Of Municipal Court Judge To Be Elected; To Set The Requirements For Filing An Intent To Be A Candidate For That Office And The Fee To Be A Candidate For That Office; To Amend Sections 21-23-3, 21-23-5 And 21-23-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

960.title: Insurance fraud; prohibit civil liability against a person or entity for reporting of.
960.description: An Act To Prohibit Civil Liability Against A Person Or Entity For Furnishing Information Concerning Insurance Fraud To Any Law Enforcement, Investigatory, Prosecutorial Or Regulatory Agent Or Agency, Insurer, Statutory Residual Market Plan, Or Nonprofit Organization Dedicated To The Investigation And Prosecution Of Insurance Fraud; To Amend Section 83-13-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

961.title: School district accountability; require SBE to develop differential component with alternative measures of success.
961.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Board Of Education, Acting Through The Commission On School Accreditation, To Develop A Differential Component To The Performance-based Accreditation System Which Provides Alternative Means To Assessing The Performance Of Certain Schools And School Districts; To Require The Board To Submit A Report On The Differential Accountability Model To The Education Committees Of The Legislature Before The 2018 Session; To Require The New Accountability Model To Be Implemented During The 2018-2019 School Year; And For Related Purposes.

962.title: Parental involvement in schools; discontinue benefits and public assistance to families failing to maintain.
962.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Temporary Assistance For Needy Families (tanf) Benefits To Be Discontinued When The Parent Of A Compulsory-school-age Child In A Recipient Family Fails To Maintain Reasonable Parental Involvement In The Child's School; To Amend Section 41-86-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Benefits Under The State Child Health Plan To Be Discontinued When The Parent Of A Recipient Compulsory-school-age Child Fails To Maintain Reasonable Parental Involvement In The Child's School; To Amend Section 43-1-29.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Assistance Under The Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program (snap) To Be Discontinued When The Parent Of A Compulsory-school-age Child In A Recipient Family Fails To Maintain Reasonable Parental Involvement In The Child's School; And For Related Purposes.

963.title: Teacher licensure; expand nontraditional routes by revising expert citizen license requirements and allowing limited licenses.
963.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Additional Nontraditional Routes To Teacher Licensure By Revising The Requirements For And Limitations On Expert Citizen Teacher Licenses And By Authorizing Local School Districts To Issue Limited District Teaching Licenses; And For Related Purposes.

964.title: Dual-enrollment; require local school district to pay tuition and costs of students enrolled.
964.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Local School District In Which A Student Is Enrolled To Pay The Tuition And Costs For Courses Taken That Students Under A Dual-enrollment Program At A Postsecondary Institution; To Leave The Discretion To Pay Such Tuition And Costs By The Postsecondary Institution Providing The Instruction Or By The Parents Or Legal Guardians Of The Student; And For Related Purposes.

965.title: Public buildings; require availability of adult changing station in for person with disabilities.
965.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-6-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each Public Building Under The Power And Control Of The State Or Any Of Its Political Subdivisions, As Well As Any Private Or Commercial Business That Is Open To The Public For Assembly Or Amusement Purposes And Constructed On Or After July 1, 2017, To Have At Least One Restroom Facility Located Therein With An Adult Changing Station For Persons With Physical Disabilities; To Require Such Buildings That Were Constructed Before July 1, 2017, To Install And Maintain An Adult Changing Station By January 1, 2020; And For Related Purposes.

966.title: Fantasy Contest Act; revise.
966.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-33-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make A Technical Correction To The Short Title Of The Fantasy Contest Act; To Amend Section 97-33-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 97-33-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Requirements That Apply To Fantasy Contests; To Amend Section 97-33-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Licensure Of Fantasy Contest Operators; To Amend Section 97-33-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties That Apply To Violations Of The Act; To Amend Section 97-33-311, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 97-33-313, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Disciplinary Action; To Amend Section 97-33-315, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Investigative And Administrative Authority Of The Gaming Commission; To Create New Code Section 97-33-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose A Fee On Fantasy Contest Operators Who Offer Fantasy Contests In This State; To Amend Sections 75-76-5 And 75-76-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

967.title: General Fund ending cash balance; first distribution made to Municipal Water Systems Repair Grant Fund.
967.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-103-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Distribution Of The Unencumbered Cash Balance In The General Fund In The State Treasury At The End Of Each Fiscal Year To Have The First Distribution Made To The Municipal Water, Sewer And Wastewater Systems Repair And Replacement Grant Program Fund Instead Of The Municipal Revolving Fund; To Bring Forward Section 21-33-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Which Creates The Municipal Revolving Fund, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

968.title: University of MS Medical Center; authorize remains in the potter's field on its property to be cremated.
968.description: An Act To Authorize The University Of Mississippi Medical Center To Disinter, Remove, Cremate And Reinter Human Remains Reposing In The Potter's Field On The Property Of The Medical Center To A Different Location On The Medical Center's Property; To Repeal Section 2, Chapter 846, Local And Private Laws Of 1973, As Amended By Chapter 854, Laws Of 1974, Which Authorizes The University Of Mississippi Medical Center To Take Certain Actions Regarding Human Remains In The Potter's Field On Its Property; And For Related Purposes.

970.title: Truth in Labeling Act; create.
970.description: An Act To Create The "truth In Labeling Act," To Provide For The Labeling Of Food Products Produced With Genetic Engineering; To Define Terms Used In This Act; To Specify Which Products Shall Be Subject To The Regulation Of This Act; To Provide For The Establishment Of The Mandatory Standard To Be Used And Enforced By The Commissioner Of Agriculture And Commerce In Compliance With The National Labeling Standard; To Ensure That The Commissioner Adopt Regulatory Standards That Specify The Amount Of Bioengineered Substance That May Be Present In Food Products; To Prescribe The Method Of Disclosing Information On Bioengineered Products And Any Reasonable Alternative Disclosure; To Require The Commissioner To Conduct A Study On Identifying Technological Challenges To Consumer Access To Bioengineered Disclosure By July 1, 2018, To Require Persons Subject To The Mandatory Disclosure Provision To Provide Any Records To The Commissioner Upon Request Upon The Commissioner's Examination Or Audit Of Such Persons Or Retail Establishments; And For Related Purposes.

971.title: State song; designate "Mississippi" by Ed Thomas as.
971.description: An Act To Create New Section 3-3-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate "mississippi" By Ed Thomas, As The Official State Song Of Mississippi; To Repeal Chapter 654, Laws Of 1962, Which Designated "go Mississippi" As The Official State Song; And For Related Purposes.

972.title: State Fiscal Officer; transfer sum from Capital Expense Fund to Point Cadet Leasing Fund.
972.description: An Act To Direct The State Fiscal Officer During Fiscal Year 2017 To Transfer A Certain Sum From The Capital Expense Fund To The Point Cadet Leasing Fund To Reimburse The Fund For The Amount That Was Inadvertently Transferred To The Capital Expense Fund Under House Bill No. 878, 2016 Regular Session; And For Related Purposes.

973.title: Personnel Board; certain agencies shall be exempt from rules, regulations and procedures of for three years.
973.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-9-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From July 1, 2017, Through June 30, 2020, The Personnel Actions Of Certain Agencies Shall Be Exempt From The State Personnel Board Rules, Regulations And Procedures; To Amend Section 25-9-148, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Personnel Board To Submit A Monthly Electronic Report To The Chairs Of The House And Senate Appropriations Committees Regarding Increases In Compensation For State Officers And Employees During The Preceding Month; And For Related Purposes.

974.title: DUI; revise violations of.
974.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Time Period For Subsequent Offenses Of Dui; To Revise The Time That One Spends In Jail For A First Offense; To Revise The Nonadjudication Requirements; And For Related Purposes.

975.title: Vietnam Veterans Day in Mississippi; designate March 29th of each year as.
975.description: An Act To Designate March 29th Of Each Year As Vietnam Veterans Day In Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

976.title: Law Enforcement Death Benefits Trust Fund; authorize transfers from rainy day fund when trust funds are insufficient.
976.description: An Act To Amend Sections 45-2-1 And 27-103-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Transfer Of Funds From The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund To The Law Enforcement Officers And Fire Fighters Death Benefits Trust Fund Upon The Requisition Of The Governor Whenever The Monies In The Trust Fund Are Insufficient To Pay The Death Benefits Required To Be Made During Any Fiscal Year Because Of The Death Of Three Or More Covered Individuals During The Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

977.title: Government Employees' Deferred Compensation Law; revise certain provisions of.
977.description: An Act To Amend Sections 25-14-3, 25-14-5, 25-14-7, 25-14-9, 25-14-11, 25-14-13 And 25-14-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms In The Government Employees' Deferred Compensation Plan Law; To Clarify Investment Options Under That Law; To Clarify The Administration Of The Deferred Compensation Plan Administered By The Public Employees' Retirement System And The Administration Of Other Deferred Compensation Plans Authorized Under That Law; And For Related Purposes.

978.title: MS State Oil and Gas Board; remove from the provisions of the MS Budget Transparency and Simplification Act.
978.description: An Act To Amend Sections 53-1-7, 53-1-73, 53-1-77, 53-3-13 And 53-11-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delete The Provision Of Law Requiring Certain Expenses Of The Mississippi State Oil And Gas Board To Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund; To Amend Section 27-104-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Requirement That The State Oil And Gas Board Be Funded By Appropriations From The General Fund; To Transfer From The State General Fund A Certain Amount Of Funds To The Special Funds Of The State Oil And Gas Board; To Bring Forward Section 27-104-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

979.title: PERS; allow members to purchase additional credit for service as law enforcement officer, firefighter or EMS personnel.
979.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-109, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System Who Are Eligible To Receive A Retirement Allowance To Purchase One Year Of Creditable Service Every Five Years Of Membership Service As A Law Enforcement Officer, Firefighter Or Emergency Management Agency Personnel In The Full-time Employment Of An Employer That Participates In The System; To Provide That Any Such Member Shall Pay To The Retirement System Before The Date Of Retirement One Percent Of The Higher Of The Member's Current Annual Earned Compensation Or The Previous Year's Annual Earned Compensation For Each Year Of Claimed Credible Service; To Provide That The Creditable Service Must Be Purchased In Increments Of Five Years Unless The Total Creditable Service Claimed Is Less Than Five Years, In Which Case The Creditable Service Must Be Purchased In Its Entirety; And For Related Purposes.

980.title: Retirement; persons convicted of certain felonies shall have benefits suspended until full restitution has been made.
980.description: An Act To Create New Sections 25-11-147, 25-11-321 And 25-13-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Member Of The Public Employees' Retirement System, The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan Or The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Retirement System Is Convicted Of Or Enters A Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere In Any Court To A Felony In Which Public Funds Were Unlawfully Taken, Obtained Or Misappropriated In The Abuse Or Misuse Of The Person's Office Or Employment That Is Committed On Or After July 1, 2017, The Court Shall Conduct A Hearing In A Separate Civil Proceeding To Determine If All Of The Conditions Have Been Met; To Provide That If All Of The Conditions Have Been Met, The Court Shall Issue An Order That The Member's Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan Be Suspended; To Provide That A Member Who Is Convicted Of Such A Felony Shall Not Have His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan Suspended Until All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired; To Provide That After Receiving The Suspension Order From The Court, The System Shall Request The Attorney General For A Determination Of Whether All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired; To Provide That After The Attorney General Notifies The System That All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired, The Member's Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan Shall Be Suspended Until The Member Has Made Full Restitution Of The Public Funds That Were Unlawfully Taken, Obtained Or Misappropriated In The Abuse Or Misuse Of The Member's Office Or Employment, As Determined By The Attorney General; To Provide That If A Member Of The System Or Plan Is Also A Member Of Another Retirement System Administered By The Board Of Trustees Of The System, And The Felony For Which The Member Was Convicted Or Entered A Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere Was In Connection With Employment Of The Member That Is Covered By Only One Of The Retirement Systems, The Member's Retirement Benefits Will Be Suspended Only From The Retirement System In Which His Or Her Employment Was Covered At The Time That He Or She Committed The Felony; To Provide That The System May Conclusively Rely On A Suspension Order From The Court And The Notice From The Attorney General That The Requirements Of This Act Have Been Met In Suspending A Member's Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan; To Provide That The System Is Not Liable For Any Mistake In The Payment Of Retirement Benefits To A Member In Good Faith Reliance On A Suspension Order From The Court And The Notice From The Attorney General; To Provide That Any Ambiguity Or Uncertainty About Whether A Member's Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan Should Be Suspended Shall Be Resolved In Favor Of The Member; To Amend Sections 25-11-111, 25-11-120, 25-11-129, 25-11-309, 25-11-319, 25-13-11 And 25-13-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

981.title: MAEP; annually increase adjustment to base student cost for at-risk students until 50%.
981.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Annually Increase The Adjustment To The Base Student Cost For At-risk Students Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program So That The Multiplier Is 50% Beginning In The 2022-2023 School Year; And For Related Purposes.

982.title: MS Adequate Education Program; fully fund for FY17 and each year thereafter.
982.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Full Funding Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program For Fiscal Year 2018 And Each Year Thereafter; To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

983.title: PERS; allow retirees to teach in critical needs areas and work full time and receive full salary for three years.
983.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Retired Members Of The Public Employees' Retirement System To Be Employed As A Teacher In A School District Within A Geographical Area Of The State Where There Exists A Critical Shortage Of Teachers And Drawing The Full Amount Of The Retirement Allowance, For A Period Not Exceeding Three Years, During Which Time The Retiree May Work The Full Number Of Normal Working Days For The Position And Receive The Full Amount Of The Salary In Effect For The Position At The Time Of Employment; And For Related Purposes.

984.title: MAEP; bring forward provisions relating to.

985.title: Working Cash-Stabilization Reserve Fund; increase balance to 10% of total General Fund appropriations.
985.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-103-203 And 27-103-213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Balance Of The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund To Ten Percent Of The Total General Fund Appropriations For The Current Fiscal Year; To Amend Section 37-61-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

986.title: Deferred compensation plans; authorize counties and cities to offer more than one plan to its employees.
986.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-14-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Counties, Municipalities And Other Political Subdivisions To Offer More Than One Deferred Compensation Plan To Its Employees; And For Related Purposes.

987.title: MS Department of Information Technology Services; restore as a special fund agency.
987.description: An Act To Prohibit Any State Agency From Hiring Any New Employees In Any Position Classified By The State Personnel Board As An Information Technology Position; To Require The State Personnel Board To Immediately Suspend The Hirings Of Such Person Upon The Effective Date Of This Act; To Require Each State Agency Employment Position Classified As An Information Technology Position To Be Transferred To The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services (mdits); To Require Mdits To Assign Persons Holding Such Positions To Respective State Agency Of Those Persons' Employment; To Require Mdits To Evaluate The Technology Needs And Responsibilities Of State Agencies To Make Necessary Personnel Changes And Reduce The Duplication Of Services; To Exempt The Employees Of Certain Extension Of State Government From The Provision Of This Act; To Amend Sections 25-53-5, 25-53-29, 25-53-151, 25-53-171 And 27-104-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Mdits From The List Of Special Fund Agencies Which Have Their Expenses Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All User Charges And Fees Deposited Into The State General Fund, And Restore The Special Fund Of The Agency To Its Original Status; To Bring Forward Sections 25-53-1, 25-53-3, 25-53-7, 25-53-9, 25-53-11, 25-53-13, 25-53-15, 25-53-17, 25-53-19, 25-53-21, 25-53-23, 25-53-25, 25-53-51, 25-53-53, 25-53-55, 25-53-57, 25-53-59, 25-53-101, 25-53-105, 25-53-107, 25-53-109, 25-53-111, 25-53-113, 25-53-115, 25-53-117, 25-53-119, 25-53-121, 25-53-123, 25-53-125 And 25-53-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Provisions Relating To The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services And Its Powers And Duties, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

988.title: Department of Public Safety and Corrections; require to pay certain employees for all accumulated comp time upon termination or death.
988.description: An Act To Provide That Upon The Termination Of Employment Or Death Of Any Law Enforcement Officer Or Other Law Enforcement Staff Who Works For The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Or The Department Of Corrections, The Department Of Public Safety Or The Department Of Corrections, Respectively, Shall Pay The Officer Or Employee Or His Or Her Estate, As Appropriate, For All Compensatory Leave Accumulated By The Officer Or Employee; To Amend Section 25-9-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; To Amend Section 19-25-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Board Of Supervisors To Pay Sheriffs And Deputies For Compensatory Time Upon Termination Or Death; And For Related Purposes.

989.title: MAEP; extend repealer on requirement that certain absences be considered excused for purposes of average daily attendance.
989.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend By Three Years The Repealer On The Requirement That Certain Absences Be Considered For Calculated Average Daily Attendance Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

990.title: MAEP; define "at-risk pupil" and include a child diagnosed with an autism spectrum disorder.
990.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "at-risk Pupil" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program And To Include A Child Diagnosed With An Autism Spectrum Disorder In The Definition; And For Related Purposes.

991.title: MAEP; revise formula to reflect change from cap of 28 mills to annual variable cap based on statewide average millage rate.
991.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Mississippi Adequate Education Formula By Changing The Cap Of 28 Mills Levied For Local Support To A Variable Cap Based On The Average Statewide Millage Rate, Which The State Department Of Education Shall Certify Annually To School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

992.title: Elementary professional school counselors; allocate funds under Mississippi Adequate Education Program for.
992.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Allocation Of Funds Under The Adequate Education Program For The Purpose Of Employing Elementary Professional School Counselors; To Require The Funds To Be Allocated To Those School Districts Having The Highest Documented Need For Counselors; To Provide An Additional Allocation Of Funds In Each Subsequent Fiscal Year Until Each Elementary School Has Employed At Least One Professional School Counselor; To Authorize The State Department Of Education To Employ A Supervisor Of Professional School Counselors; To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

993.title: MAEP; increase adjustment to base student cost for at-risk students.
993.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Adjustment To The Base Student Cost For At-risk Students Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

994.title: MAEP; determine basic program cost using average daily membership (ADM) in lieu of ADA.
994.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "average Daily Membership (adm)" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Determination Of The Basic Adequate Education Program Cost For Each School District Based On Student Average Daily Membership With Certain Exceptions; To Provide For Student Counts By The State Auditor; To Amend Sections 37-151-85, 37-151-97 And 37-151-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

995.title: Opioid antagonists; authorize standing orders to pharmacies to dispense to persons without individual prescriptions.
995.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-319, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Health Care Practitioners To Issue A Standing Order To One Or More Individual Pharmacies That Authorizes The Pharmacy To Dispense An Opioid Antagonist To Certain Persons Without The Person To Whom The Opioid Antagonist Is Dispensed Needing To Have An Individual Prescription; To Augment The List Of First Responders Who Are Authorized To Administer Opioid Antagonists Such As Naloxone To Provide That Before A Pharmacist May Dispense An Opioid Antagonist Under The Authority Of Such A Standing Order, The Pharmacist Must Complete A Training Program Approved By The State Board Of Pharmacy On Opioid Antagonists; To Amend Section 73-21-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Definition Of The Term "prescription" In The Pharmacy Practice Act Includes Standing Orders Authorized By The Preceding Provision; And For Related Purposes.

996.title: State song; designate "Mississippi Song" as official.
996.description: An Act To Codify Section 3-3-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate "mississippi Song" As The Official State Song; To Repeal Chapter 654, Laws Of 1962, Which Designated "go Mississippi" As The Official State Song; And For Related Purposes.

997.title: Official statehood song; adopt "My Home Mississippi" as during 2017 to commemorate the state's Bicentennial.
997.description: An Act To Designate The Song "my Home Mississippi" As The Official Statehood Song Of Mississippi During The Calendar Year 2017 To Commemorate And Celebrate The State's Bicentennial; And For Related Purposes.

998.title: Enterprise Security Program; establish to provide policies for cybersecurity safety across state government.
998.description: An Act To Create New Section 25-53-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish The Enterprise Security Program Which Shall Provide For The Coordinated Oversight Of The Cybersecurity Efforts Across All State Agencies; To Require The Mississippi Department Of Information Technology Services To Provide Centralized Management And Coordination Of State Policies For The Security Of Data And Information Technology Resources; To Prescribe The Responsibilities Of Mdits With Regard To Administering The Provisions Of The Program; To Prescribe The Responsibilities Of Each State Agency's Executive Director Or Agency Head With Regards To Insuring The Protection Of Agency And Employee Data And Information Systems; And For Related Purposes.

1000.title: Mississippi Department of Information Technology Services; bring forward sections relating to.

1001.title: Securities law; certain failures to supervise individuals are considered as multiple violations of.
1001.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-71-412, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For The Purposes Of Taking Disciplinary Action Against Broker-dealers, Agents And Investment Advisors Under The Mississippi Securities Act Of 2010, Failure To Supervise For Periods Of Twelve Months And Failure To Supervise More Than One Person At A Time Will Be Considered As Separate Violations; To Amend Section 75-71-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Time Limitation On Bringing Actions To Enforce Liabilities Under The Predecessor Securities Act Do Not Apply To A Civil Enforcement Action Or An Administrative Enforcement Action Instituted By The Secretary Of State Under Certain Sections; And For Related Purposes.

1002.title: Securities law; require brokers who make reports about vulnerable persons to send copy to Secretary of State.
1002.description: An Act To Create New Section 75-71-413, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Broker-dealers And Investment Advisers Registered Under The Mississippi Securities Act Who Are Required To File A Report With The Department Of Human Services Under The Mississippi Vulnerable Persons Act Upon Suspicion That A Vulnerable Person Is Being Exploited To Immediately Forward A Copy Of The Report To The Secretary Of State; To Provide That If A Broker-dealer Or Investment Adviser Reasonably Believes That A Requested Disbursement May Result In Financial Exploitation Of Its Customer, That Person May Delay A Disbursement For Up To Fifteen Business Days; To Provide That If A Disbursement Is Delayed, The Broker-dealer Or Investment Adviser Shall Immediately Initiate An Internal Review Of The Suspected Or Attempted Financial Exploitation Of The Customer And Report The Results Of The Review Within Seven Business Days; To Provide That Disclosures And Notifications Of Disbursement Delays Shall Not Be Made To Any Third Party Who Is Suspected Of Financial Exploitation Or Other Abuse; To Provide That A Person Who Makes Disclosures Or Delays Disbursements Under This Section Shall Be Immune From Any Administrative Or Civil Liability That Might Otherwise Arise From Compliance With This Section Or Activity Authorized Under This Section; And For Related Purposes.

1003.title: MS Residential Mortgage Foreclosure Mediation Program; create.
1003.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Residential Mortgage Foreclosure Mediation Program, Which Will Provide For Mediation Between The Borrowers And Lenders Before Foreclosure Actions On Homestead Property Are Begun; To Provide The Procedures To Be Followed In The Program; And For Related Purposes.

1004.title: Automated consumer electronic device purchasing machines; prohibit in the state.
1004.description: An Act To Prohibit The Installation Or Operation Of Automated Consumer Electronic Device Purchasing Machines In The State; And For Related Purposes.

1005.title: Life insurance; authorize funeral services provider to obtain certain information regarding a deceased's.
1005.description: An Act To Authorize A Funeral Services Provider To Obtain Certain Information Regarding A Deceased Person's Life Insurance; And For Related Purposes.

1006.title: Legislature; reduce size of beginning with the 2023 statewide general election.
1006.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Number Of Representatives In The Mississippi House Of Representatives Shall Be Reduced To 99 Representatives Beginning With The 2023 Statewide General Election; To Amend Section 5-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Number Of Senators In The Mississippi Senate Shall Be Reduced To 42 Senators Beginning With The 2023 Statewide General Election; And For Related Purposes.

1007.title: Official State song; designate "Queen of the South" as second official state song.
1007.description: An Act To Codify New Section 3-3-59, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The Song, "queen Of The South," As An Official State Song In Addition To The Present State Song Of Mississippi, "go, Mississippi"; And For Related Purposes.

1008.title: Blue; designate as the official state color.
1008.description: An Act To Designate The Color Blue As The State Color Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1009.title: "My Mississippi"; designate as state poem of Mississippi.
1009.description: An Act To Designate "my Mississippi" As The State Poem Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1010.title: "Mississippi"; designate as an official state song.
1010.description: An Act To Create New Section 3-3-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate "mississippi" By Ed Thomas, As An Official State Song Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1011.title: Official state poem; designate "I Am Mississippi" as.
1011.description: An Act To Codify New Section 3-3-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The Poem "i Am Mississippi" As The Official State Poem Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1012.title: Department of Child Protection Services; make technical amendments to provisions of law relating to and give certain powers and duties to.
