1698.description: An Act To Create The Livable Homes Tax Credit Act; To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Who Purchase A New, Never Occupied Residence That Is Designed To Improve Accessibility And Provide Universal Visitability Or Who Retrofit An Existing Residence For The Purpose Of Improving Accessibility And Providing Universal Visitability; To Provide The Amount Of The Credit; To Limit The Amount Of The Tax Credit That May Be Claimed In A Taxable Year; To Authorize Any Tax Credit Claimed Under This Act But Not Used In Any Taxable Year To Be Carried Forward For Five Consecutive Years; And For Related Purposes.

1699.title: Fire protection districts; prohibit boards of supervisors from taxing real properties annexed by municipalities.
1699.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-189, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Annexed Territory That Is Annexed By A Municipality And Includes A Fire Protection District Shall Be Taxed Simultaneously For Fire Protection Services By The Board Of Supervisors And The Governing Authorities Of The Municipality; To Provide That If There Is A Loss Of Ad Valorem Tax Revenue In A Fire Protection District Due To Annexation By A Municipality Then The Municipality Shall Reimburse The District For A Period Of Three Years For The Loss; To Amend Sections 21-1-27, 21-1-61 And 21-1-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Section; And For Related Purposes.

1700.title: Counties; authorize levying of certain tax in support of Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation.
1700.description: An Act To Create A New Section Authorizing Any County To Levy A Certain Tax Upon All Taxable Property For Support Of The Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation For The Establishment And Operation Of An Education Center Relating To The Prevention Of Cancer; And For Related Purposes.

1701.title: Public School Donation Tax Deduction and Dedicated Use Act; create.
1701.description: An Act To Create The "public School Donation Tax Deduction And Dedicated Use Act"; To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A State Income Tax Deduction For Contributions Made By A Taxpayer To A Public School District; To Provide That Such Contributions May Be Designated By A Taxpayer For Specific Use By A School District; To Amend Section 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1702.title: Tax Credit Scholarship; enact to provide qualifying students eligibility to use to cover eligible education expenses.
1702.description: An Act To Create The Tax Credit Scholarship Act; To Provide That Qualifying Students Shall Be Eligible To Use A Scholarship From Certain Scholarship Organizations To Cover Eligible Educational Expenses; To Provide For A Tax Credit Not To Exceed 50% Of The Taxpayers Tax Liability For Contributions To Certain Scholarship Organizations; To Stipulate The Requirements For Nonpublic Schools Accepting Students For Enrollment Who Receive Scholarships Under The Provisions Of This Act; To Prescribe The Requirements For Scholarship Organizations Administering Tax Credit Scholarships; To Require The Department Of Revenue To Provide An Annual Legislative Report On The Tax Credits Allowed Under This Act; To Allow Parents To Request An Assessment Of Educational Progress Of Students Enrolled; To Prescribe The Powers And Duties Of The Department Of Revenue With Regard To The Administration Of This Act; To Provide That Nonpublic Schools Which Admit Students Receiving Tax Credit Scholarships Are Not Agents Of The State Or Federal Government; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Amounts Received As Tax Credit Scholarships To Pay Educational Expenses Shall Be Excluded From Gross Income; And For Related Purposes.

1703.title: "Small Town Teacher Tax Credit Act"; create to authorize an income tax credit to certain licensed teachers.
1703.description: An Act To Create The Small Town Teacher Tax Credit Act; To Authorize A Refundable Income Tax Credit For Licensed Teachers Who Are Employed By A School District In Geographic Location Defined As A "small Town"; To Provide The Amount Of The Tax Credit For Licensed Teachers With At Least Three Years Of Consecutive Service With The School District; To Provide That If The Amount Of Tax Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; And For Related Purposes.

1704.title: Taxation; revise definition of "hotel" or "motel" under local and private laws that tax hotels and motels.
1704.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-23.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "hotel" Or "motel" For Any Tax Levied And Collected Under The Authority Of A Local And Private Law Of The State Of Mississippi To Include Short-term Lodging In Residential Properties Listed By, Or Rented Through The Use Of, An Online Marketplace Company And Homestay Network Where The Cost Of The Accommodations Are Set By The Property Owner; And For Related Purposes.

1705.title: Ad valorem tax; authorize fee-in-lieu of ad valorem taxes for certain existing enterprises for projects to totaling over $10,000,00.00.
1705.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Authorities To Enter Into Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes Agreements With Existing Enterprises That Have Done Business In The County Or Municipality For At Least Twenty-four Months For Projects Totaling Over $10,000,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

1706.title: Appropriation; City of Mound Bayou to make improvements to existing city pool.
1706.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The City Of Mound Bayou For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Costs Associated With Making Improvements To The Existing City Pool In Order To Encourage City Residents To Engage In Better Health And Fitness Habits For The Fiscal Year 2018.

1707.title: Appropriation; West Bolivar School District for repairs and renovations at three high schools.
1707.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of The West Bolivar Consolidated School District For The Purpose Of Assisting The District In Paying Costs Associated With Making Certain Repairs And Renovations At Three High Schools Of The District For The Fiscal Year 2018.

1708.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Mound Bayou with improvements to existing city pool.
1708.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Mound Bayou, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To The Existing City Pool; And For Related Purposes.

1709.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Shelby with improvements to downtown walking track.
1709.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Shelby, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Enhancement Of And Upgrades And Improvements To The City's Downtown Walking Track And Related Facilities And Development Of A Downtown Playground; And For Related Purposes.

1710.title: Bonds; create a rural counties and municipalities emergency infrastructure loan program and authorize issuance of bonds.
1710.description: An Act To Establish A Revolving Loan Program For The Purpose Of Making Loans To Assist Rural Counties And Municipalities In Paying Costs Associated With Emergency Repair, Maintenance, Construction, Reconstruction, Upgrades Of And Improvements To Infrastructure Projects; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Administer The Revolving Loan Program Created In This Act; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury, Designated As The "rural Counties And Municipalities Emergency Infrastructure Improvements Fund"; To Authorize The Issuance Of $10,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The "rural Counties And Municipalities Emergency Infrastructure Improvements Fund"; And For Related Purposes.

1711.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist the Cleveland School District with construction of a new school.
1711.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Cleveland School District In Paying Costs Associated With Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New School And Related Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1712.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements at the state-owned shipyard in Jackson County.
1712.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of $45,000,000.00 In State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt And/or Dedicating A Certain Amount Of Funds For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; And For Related Purposes.

1713.title: Sales tax law; revise definition of terms "to manufacture" and "manufacturing" for purposes of.
1713.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Terms "to Manufacture" And "manufacturing" Under The State Sales Tax Law To Include The Mining Or Other Extraction Of Natural Sand And Gravel Which After Mining Or Other Extraction Is Subjected To Sorting And Scrubbing And Converted For Use Solely As Proppants Used In Oil And Gas Exploration And Development With At Least Ninety-five Percent Of Such Proppants Being Used In The Production Of Oil And/or Gas From A Horizontally Drilled Wells And/or Horizontally Drilled Recompletion Wells; And For Related Purposes.

1715.title: City of Biloxi; authorize acquire or build Internet capacity and services for use by city departments.
1715.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Biloxi, Mississippi, To Acquire Or Build Internet Capacity And Services For Use By City Departments To More Effectively Deliver Municipal Services To The Public And To Sell Or Lease Surplus Property, Capacity And Services; And For Related Purposes.

1716.title: Town of Sardis; extend repeal date on hotel, motel and restaurant tax; authorize election on continuance of if protested.
1716.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 945, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, As Amended By Chapter 917, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Chapter 915, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend Until July 1, 2021, The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Sardis, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And To Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Enhance Tourism, Industrial And Economic Development And For The Provision Of Parks And Recreation Facilities; To Require That Within 60 Days After The Effective Date Of This Act The Governing Authorities Of The Town Shall Adopt A Resolution Declaring Their Intention To Continue The Tax And Publish The Resolution In A Newspaper Published In The County; To Provide That If 20% Or 1,500, Whichever Is Less, Of The Qualified Electors Of The Town File A Petition Protesting The Tax, The Governing Authorities Shall Call An Election Regarding The Continuance Of The Tax; To Provide That If A Majority Of The Qualified Electors Voting At The Election Vote Against Continuing The Tax, The Tax Shall Be Discontinued; And For Related Purposes.

1717.title: Town of Como; extend repealer on authority to impose tourism tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
1717.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 927, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2017, To July 1, 2021, On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Como, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Food And Beverages At Restaurants; And For Related Purposes.

1718.title: Excise tax on gasoline and diesel; increase rate.
1718.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Gasoline Excise Tax; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-12, 27-55-19 And 27-55-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Certain Exemptions And Refunds Under The Gasoline Excise Tax Law, For The Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 27-55-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Rate Of The Special Fuel Excise Tax Imposed On Undyed Diesel Fuel; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-521, 27-55-523 And 27-55-533, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Mississippi Special Fuel Tax Law, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1719.title: Excise tax on gasoline and diesel; revise rate.
1719.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of The Gasoline Excise Tax; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-12, 27-55-19 And 27-55-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For Certain Exemptions And Refunds Under The Gasoline Excise Tax Law, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Amend Section 27-55-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Rate Of The Special Fuel Excise Tax Imposed On Undyed Diesel Fuel; To Bring Forward Sections 27-55-521, 27-55-523 And 27-55-533, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are Sections Of The Mississippi Special Fuel Tax Law, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Distribution Of Fuel Taxes, For The Purpose Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1720.title: Cigarettes; increase excise tax on.
1720.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-69-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Excise Tax On Cigarettes; To Bring Forward Section 27-70-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Imposes A Tobacco Equity Tax Imposed On Cigarettes Made By Nonsettling Manufacturers, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1721.title: Gas severance tax; include carbon dioxide within definition of term "gas" and revise certain exemptions.
1721.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-25-701, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Carbon Dioxide Within The Definition Of The Term "gas" For Purposes Of The Gas Severance Tax Laws; To Amend Section 27-25-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Gas Severance Tax Exemption Provided For Gas Lawfully Injected Into The Earth For Cycling, Repressuring, Lifting Or Enhancing The Recovery Of Oil; To Provide A Gas Severance Tax Exemption For The Production Of Carbon Dioxide That Is Sold Or Otherwise Used For Industrial Or Commercial Purposes In This State Such As Raw Materials Or Components In The Manufacturing Process Or Oil Production By Use Of An Enhanced Oil Recovery Method; To Provide That An Amount Equal To The Gas Severance Tax Revenue Deposited Into The State General Fund During The Preceding Fiscal Year Shall Be Annually Allocated And Distributed By The Department Of Revenue To Counties And Municipalities For Use On The Repair, Maintenance And Reconstruction Of Roads, Streets And Bridges; And For Related Purposes.

1723.title: Itawamba County; authorize to construct or acquire a county jail anywhere in the county.
1723.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Itawamba County, Mississippi, To Construct Or Acquire A County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1724.title: Ad valorem taxes; revise provisions for counties and municipalities.
1724.description: An Act To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Levied By A County A Portion Of The Assessed Value Of Taxable Real Property Located Within A Municipality; And For Related Purposes.

1725.title: Bonds; create small municipalities/rural counties road and bridge improvements loan program and authorize bonds to provide funds.
1725.description: An Act To Establish A Revolving Loan Program For The Purpose Of Making Loans To Assist Small Municipalities And Rural Counties In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Maintenance And Reconstruction Of Roads, Streets And Bridges; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Administer The Revolving Loan Program Created In This Act; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury, Designated As The "small Municipalities And Rural Counties Road And Bridge Improvements Fund"; To Authorize The Issuance Of $20,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The "small Municipalities And Rural Counties Road And Bridge Improvements Fund"; And For Related Purposes.

1726.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt property of certain foundations that provide support to state institutions of higher learning.
1726.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Real Or Personal Property Belonging To Any Foundation That Is Exempt From Federal Income Taxation Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code And Receives, Invests And Administers Private Support For A State-supported Institution Of Higher Learning, Is Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

1727.title: MS Critical Needs School District Tax Deduction Act of 2017; create.
1727.description: An Act To Be Known As The Mississippi Critical Needs School District Tax Deduction Act Of 2017; To Define Certain Terms; To Establish The Mississippi Critical Needs School District Tax Deduction Program To Attract First-year Teachers To Geographical Areas Of The State Where There Exists A Critical Need In Primary And Secondary Education Instruction, And To Retain Those First-year Teachers And Veteran Teachers Who Serve As Licensed Teachers In Critical Needs School Districts By Making Tax Incentives Available To Them; To Provide That The Program Shall Be Available To First-year Teachers Licensed By The State Department Of Education Who Enter Into A Contract For Employment In A Critical Needs School District And Commit To Provide Four Years Of Service As A Teacher In That School District; To Provide That A First-year Teacher In The Program Is Eligible For An Income Tax Deduction In An Amount Not Exceeding Twenty Thousand Dollars For Each Year Of Service Rendered In The Critical Needs School District During The Four-year Period, And If The Teacher Continues Teaching In That Critical Needs School District After The Four-year Period, For Each Of The Next Four Years Of Service Rendered In That School District; To Provide That A First-year Teacher Must Complete One Full Academic And Contractual Year Of Service As A Licensed Teacher In A Critical Needs School District In Order To Be Eligible For The Tax Deduction; To Provide That If A Teacher Who Is Eligible For The Tax Deduction Leaves The Critical Needs School District In Which The Teacher Was Employed When The Tax Deduction Was Initially Granted Before The End Of The Four-year Period, The Teacher Shall Not Be Eligible For The Tax Deduction For The Remainder Of The Four-year Period; To Provide That After A Teacher Completes Four Years Of Service In A Critical Needs School District, The Teacher May Transfer To Another Critical Needs School District And Commit To Provide Four Years Of Service As A Teacher In That School District, And Will Be Eligible To Receive The Tax Deduction For Each Year Of Service Rendered In That School District During The Four-year Period; To Provide That A First-year Teacher Shall Be Eligible To Receive The Tax Deduction Authorized In The Program For A Maximum Of Ten Years During Which The Teacher Is Participating In The Program, Except That If A Teacher Leaves The Critical Needs School District In Which The Teacher Was Employed When The Tax Deduction Was Initially Granted Before The End Of The Four-year Period, The Maximum Number Of Years For Which The Teacher Is Eligible To Receive The Tax Deduction Shall Be Reduced By The Number Of Years Remaining In The Four-year Period; To Provide That The Program Shall Be Available To Veteran Teachers Licensed By The State Department Of Education Who Are Serving As A Teacher In A Critical Needs School District; To Provide That A Veteran Teacher In The Program Is Eligible For An Income Tax Deduction In An Amount Not Exceeding Twenty Thousand Dollars For Each Year Of Service Rendered In The Critical Needs School District Through The End Of The Tenth Year Of Service As A Teacher In That School District; To Provide That A Veteran Teacher Shall Be Eligible To Receive The Tax Deduction Authorized In The Program For A Maximum Of Ten Years During Which The Teacher Is Participating In The Program, Reduced By The Number Of Years That The Teacher Rendered Service As A Teacher In The Critical Needs School District Before The 2016-2017 School Year; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exclude From Gross Income Under The Income Tax Laws Amounts Received By A Teacher For Service Rendered In A Critical Needs School District, Not Exceeding Twenty Thousand Dollars For Each Year Of Service Rendered; And For Related Purposes.

1728.title: MS Critical Needs School District Tax Credit Act of 2017; create.
1728.description: An Act To Be Known As The Mississippi Critical Needs School District Tax Credit Act Of 2017; To Define Certain Terms; To Establish The Mississippi Critical Needs School District Tax Credit Program To Attract First-year Teachers To Geographical Areas Of The State Where There Exists A Critical Need In Primary And Secondary Education Instruction, And To Retain Those First-year Teachers And Veteran Teachers Who Serve As Licensed Teachers In Critical Needs School Districts By Making Tax Incentives Available To Them; To Provide That The Program Shall Be Available To First-year Teachers Licensed By The State Department Of Education Who Enter Into A Contract For Employment In A Critical Needs School District And Commit To Provide Four Years Of Service As A Teacher In That School District; To Provide That A First-year Teacher In The Program Is Eligible For An Income Tax Credit In An Amount Not Exceeding One Thousand Two Hundred Dollars For Each Year Of Service Rendered In The Critical Needs School District During The Four-year Period, And If The Teacher Continues Teaching In That Critical Needs School District After The Four-year Period, For Each Of The Next Four Years Of Service Rendered In That School District; To Provide That A First-year Teacher Must Complete One Full Academic And Contractual Year Of Service As A Licensed Teacher In A Critical Needs School District In Order To Be Eligible For The Tax Credit; To Provide That If A Teacher Who Is Eligible For The Tax Credit Leaves The Critical Needs School District In Which The Teacher Was Employed When The Tax Credit Was Initially Granted Before The End Of The Four-year Period, The Teacher Shall Not Be Eligible For The Tax Credit For The Remainder Of The Four-year Period; To Provide That After A Teacher Completes Four Years Of Service In A Critical Needs School District, The Teacher May Transfer To Another Critical Needs School District And Commit To Provide Four Years Of Service As A Teacher In That School District, And Will Be Eligible To Receive The Tax Credit For Each Year Of Service Rendered In That School District During The Four-year Period; To Provide That A First-year Teacher Shall Be Eligible To Receive The Tax Credit Authorized In The Program For A Maximum Of Ten Years During Which The Teacher Is Participating In The Program, Except That If A Teacher Leaves The Critical Needs School District In Which The Teacher Was Employed When The Tax Credit Was Initially Granted Before The End Of The Four-year Period, The Maximum Number Of Years For Which The Teacher Is Eligible To Receive The Tax Credit Shall Be Reduced By The Number Of Years Remaining In The Four-year Period; To Provide That The Program Shall Be Available To Veteran Teachers Licensed By The State Department Of Education Who Are Serving As A Teacher In A Critical Needs School District; To Provide That A Veteran Teacher In The Program Is Eligible For An Income Tax Credit In An Amount Not Exceeding One Thousand Two Hundred Dollars For Each Year Of Service Rendered In The Critical Needs School District Through The End Of The Tenth Year Of Service As A Teacher In That School District; To Provide That A Veteran Teacher Shall Be Eligible To Receive The Tax Credit Authorized In The Program For A Maximum Of Ten Years During Which The Teacher Is Participating In The Program, Reduced By The Number Of Years That The Teacher Rendered Service As A Teacher In The Critical Needs School District Before The 2016-2017 School Year; To Create New Section 27-7-22.39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Credit Against A Taxpayer's Income Tax Liability For Service Rendered As A Teacher In A Critical Needs School District In An Amount Not To Exceed One Thousand Two Hundred Dollars For Each Year Of Service Rendered; And For Related Purposes.

1729.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for certain railroad purposes and road projects.
1729.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The North Central Ms Regional Rail Authority For The Purpose Of Refinancing Certain Acquisition Costs Of The Rail Line That Extends From Southaven, Mississippi, To A Point Near Canton, Mississippi, And To Provide Funds To Refurbish And Improve Such Rail Line; To Provide That The Principal Of And Interest On The Bonds Will Be Paid Primarily From Certain Lease Payments Deposited Into A Bond Sinking Fund; To Bring Forward Section 1, Chapter 518, Laws Of 2014, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Design, Engineering, Land Acquisition And Construction Of The Reunion Parkway/interstate 55 Interchange Project In Madison County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Louisville, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Constructing A Road And Other Transportation Infrastructure In The City That Will Provide And Improve Access To Land Owned By The City Designated For An Economic Development Project; To Amend Section 27-31-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That County Boards Of Supervisors And Municipal Authorities May Enter Into Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes Agreements For Certain Projects Having A Minimum Capital Investment Of $100,000,000.00 From Any Source Or Combination Of Sources, Provided That A Majority Of The Capital Investment Is From Private Sources, When Such A Project Is Located Within A Geographic Area For Which A Presidential Disaster Declaration Was Issued On Or After January 1, 2014; Related And For Related Purposes.

1730.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for various Mississippi Development Authority programs.
1730.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $7,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Grants Or Loans To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Facilities; To Amend Section 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $67,000,000.00 To $68,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act For Projects Designed To Enhance Facilities That Are At Risk For Closure Pursuant To The Base Closure And Realignment Act Of 1991 Or Other Applicable Federal Law; To Create The Mississippi Site Development Grant Program To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Providing Grants To Municipalities, Counties And Local Economic Development Organizations To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Improving The Marketability Of Publicly Owned Industrial Property For Industrial Economic Development Purposes; To Create The Mississippi Site Development Grant Fund To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Site Development Grant Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of $10,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; And For Related Purposes.

1731.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist municipalities and counties with bridge improvements.
1731.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Municipalities And Counties In This State In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, Replacement, Reconstruction And Construction Of Bridges In Municipalities And Counties, Including Those Bridges On State Designated Highways That Are Maintained By Municipalities And Counties; And For Related Purposes.

1732.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for various purposes.
1732.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt And/or Dedicating A Certain Amount Of Funds For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Highway Safety Patrol Substation In Starkville, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Repair And Renovation Of Capital Facilities, Improvements, Dams, Roofing, Wastewater And Water Well Mandates, And Other Facility Maintenance Items And Purposes; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Watershed Repair And Rehabilitation Cost-share Program; To Amend Section 51-37-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Increase The Amount Of Funds That May Be Disbursed As Grant Funds To The City Of Columbus, Mississippi, To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Columbus City Hall Building And Related Facilities; To Provide For The Disbursement Of Grant Funds To The City Of Columbus, Mississippi, To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The City's Children's Museum; To Provide For The Disbursement Of Grant Funds To The Town Of Caledonia, Mississippi, To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Town's Museum/community Center; To Bring Forward Section 27-70-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Imposes A Tobacco Equity Tax On Cigarettes Made By Nonsettling Manufacturers, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 57-89-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes Certain Rebates To Motion Picture Production Companies Under The Mississippi Motion Picture Incentive Act, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-55-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Imposes An Excise Tax On The Sale Of Gasoline, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-55-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides Certain Exemptions From The Excise Tax On Fuel, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-55-519, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Imposes An Excise Tax On The Sale Of Special Fuel, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-55-521, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Imposes A Special Excise Tax On Certain Sales Or Uses Of Fuel, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Section 27-5-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For The Diversion Of Fuel Tax Revenue, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; To Bring Forward Sections 27-65-75 And 65-39-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

1733.title: Bonds; authorize for various purposes.
1733.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Repairs And Renovations For State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Repairs And Renovations For Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt And/or Dedicating A Certain Amount Of Funds For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Highway Safety Patrol Substation In Starkville, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Repair And Renovation Of Capital Facilities, Improvements, Dams, Roofing, Wastewater And Water Well Mandates, And Other Facility Maintenance Items And Purposes; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Watershed Repair And Rehabilitation Cost-share Program; To Amend Section 51-37-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Construction, Repair, Renovation And Replacement Of Buildings At The Alcoholic Beverage Control Warehouse Located In Madison County, Mississippi, And For The Purchase Or Renovation Of Equipment At Such Warehouse; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1734.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt certain equipment while in the hands of a dealer as merchandise.
1734.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Zero Turn Mowers, Mini-excavators, Discs, Bush Hogs, Box Blades And Similar Items While In The Hands Of Bona Fide Dealers As Merchandise; And For Related Purposes.

1735.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Town of Friars Point in constructing a community center.
1735.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Friars Point, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Constructing A Community Center; And For Related Purposes.

1736.title: Sales tax; reduce rate on retails of all-terrain vehicles to farmers for agricultural purposes.
1736.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Decrease The Sales Tax Rate On Retail Sales Of All-terrain Vehicles To Farmers For Agricultural Purposes And Parts Used In The Repair And Maintenance Of Such All-terrain Vehicles Used For Such Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1737.title: Appropriation; DHS for increased funding for child care services.
1737.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Human Services For The Purpose Of Providing Increased Funding For Child Care Services For Persons Who Are Beneficiaries Of Services From The Department For The Fiscal Year 2018.

1738.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Quitman County in construction of a passenger train depot in Marks.
1738.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Quitman County, Mississippi, In The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A Passenger Train Depot In Marks, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1739.title: Income tax; provide a credit for taxpayers allowed to claim federal earned income tax credit.
1739.description: An Act To Provide A State Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Claiming The Federal Earned Income Tax Credit; To Provide The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That If The Amount Of Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; And For Related Purposes.

1741.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Forrest County with road and bridge improvements.
1741.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Forrest County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To A Portion Of Glendale Avenue In Forrest County, And With Construction Of A New Bridge That Will Span The Bouie River In Forrest County; And For Related Purposes.

1742.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for purposes related to construction of facility at Jackson-Medgar Wiley Evers International Airport.
1742.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Lease Payments Or Lease Guaranty Payments On A Lease Or Leases That Are Entered Into For The Construction, Furnishing, And Equipping Of A Heavy Aircraft Maintenance Repair And Overhaul Facility At The Jackson-medgar Wiley Evers International Airport In Rankin County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1743.title: Lauderdale County; extend repeal date on the Lauderdale County Tourism Commission.
1743.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 991, Local And Private Laws Of 1997, As Last Amended By Chapter 929, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Date Of Repeal To October 1, 2027, On The Law That Establishes The Lauderdale County Tourism Commission; To Require An Election On The Continuation Of The Tax If A Certain Number Of Electors File A Written Protest Against The Continuation Of The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1744.title: Jackson County; authorize the cleaning of certain blighted property.
1744.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Jackson County, Mississippi, To Conduct Hearings To Determine Whether Certain Property Within The County Is Blighted Property; To Require The Board Of Supervisors To Provide Notice To The Owners Of "blighted" Property; To Provide The Form And Manner Of The Notice; To Authorize The County To Charge The Actual Costs Of Correcting The Blighted Property; And For Related Purposes.

1745.title: Town of Tishomingo; authorize expansion of gas distribution system.
1745.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Tishomingo In Tishomingo County, Mississippi, To Expand Its Gas Distribution System Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The Town Of Tishomingo; And For Related Purposes.

1746.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
1746.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Warren, Washington, Issaquena, Sharkey Community Action Agency, Inc.; We Care Community Services, Inc.; And Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And For Related Purposes.

1747.title: DeSoto County; authorize to contribute funds, in-kind donations and support to Economic Development Council, Inc.
1747.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Donate Funds, Make In-kind Donations And Provide Support To The Desoto County Economic Development Council, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1748.title: DeSoto County; authorize contribution to Historic DeSoto Foundation, Inc.
1748.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Historic Desoto Foundation, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1749.title: Suffrage; restore to Sidney Harrington Smith III.
1749.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Sidney Harrington Smith Iii, Of Harrison County, Mississippi.

1750.title: Grenada County; authorize to contract for the housing of inmates from other county or private jails that are located in this state.
1750.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Grenada County, Mississippi, To Contract For The Housing Of Inmates With Any Other County Or Private Jail Facility That Is Located Within The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1751.title: Coahoma County; clarify authority of the Economic Development Authority pertaining to certain industrial sites.
1751.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 862, Local And Private Laws Of 1981, As Last Amended By Chapter 906, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, Clarify The Authority Of The Economic Development Authority Of Coahoma County To Sell, Lease, Trade, Exchange Or Otherwise Dispose Of Industrial Sites Situated Within The Industrial Park Complexes Or Project Areas To Individuals, Firms Or Corporations, Public Or Private, And Governmental Entities And Political Subdivisions; And For Related Purposes.

1752.title: Coahoma County; authorize contribution to Spring Initiative, Inc.
1752.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Spring Initiative, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1753.title: City of Madison; authorize use of golf carts on certain streets within.
1753.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Madison, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within Certain Subdivided Residential Neighborhoods In The City; And For Related Purposes.

1754.title: Washington County; extend the repeal date on the Washington County Convention and Visitors Committee and the tourism tax.
1754.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 816, Local And Private Laws Of 1991, As Last Amended By Chapter 937, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Date Of Repeal From July 1, 2017, To July 1, 2021, On The Provision Of Law That Establishes The Washington County Convention And Visitors Committee And Authorizes A Tax On Hotels, Motels And Restaurants; And For Related Purposes.

1755.title: City of Vicksburg; increase minimum benefits under Disability and Relief Fund for Firemen and Policemen.
1755.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 899, Local And Private Laws Of 1988, As Last Amended By Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Increase The Amount Of The Minimum Monthly Benefits Authorized For Persons Receiving Benefits Under The Disability And Relief Fund For Firemen And Policemen Of The City Of Vicksburg; And For Related Purposes.

1757.title: Clarke County; authorize contribution to the Multi-County Community Service Agency, Inc.
1757.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Clarke County Mississippi, To Make Contributions To The Multi-county Community Service Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1758.title: Tunica County; authorize contributions to Ten Point Coalition, Inc.
1758.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Ten Point Coalition, Inc., For The Purpose Of Operating And Maintaining A Community Service Program Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1759.title: Tunica County; authorize funding for Tunica County Museum via a designated 1% sales tax.
1759.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Tunica, Mississippi, To Provide Funding For The Tunica County Museum, Inc., By Way Of A Designated One Percent Sales Tax Within The City Limits Of The Town Of Tunica; And For Related Purposes.

1760.title: Madison County and Ridgeland; authorize an interlocal agreement to provide joint police protection on certain roads.
1760.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Madison County, Mississippi, And The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Ridgeland, Mississippi, To Enter Into An Interlocal Agreement For The Provision Of Joint Police Protection And Law Enforcement Within The Rights-of-way Of Certain Roads; And For Related Purposes.

1761.title: Attala and Leake Counties; authorize interlocal agreement for the housing of inmates.
1761.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Attala County, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Leake County, Mississippi, To Enter Into An Interlocal Agreement Concerning The Housing Of Attala County's Inmates In Leake County's Correctional Facility; And For Related Purposes.

1762.title: Humphreys County; authorize to make contribution to Belzoni-Humphreys Development Foundation.
1762.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Humphreys County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Belzoni-humphreys Development Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

1763.title: City of Hattiesburg; extend repealer on Hattiesburg Tourism Commission and hotel/ motel tax.
1763.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 878, Local And Private Laws Of 1990, As Last Amended By Chapter 946, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend Until July 1, 2021, The Date Upon Which The Hattiesburg Tourism Commission Is Repealed; To Require Certain Auditing Of Funds Received As They Relate To The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1764.title: Tunica County, authorize contributions to Tunica County Economic Development Foundation, Inc.
1764.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 928, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Amended By Chapter 934, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, As Amended By Chapter 919, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Tunica County Economic Development Foundation, Inc., Through And Including Calendar Year 2021; And For Related Purposes.

1765.title: Rankin County; authorize placement of certain specialty street signs within.
1765.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Rankin County, Mississippi, To Display The Placement Of Certain Specialty Signs At The Intersection Of Highways 25 And 43, In Rankin County, Mississippi, To Welcome Individuals To The Community Of Sandhill, Mississippi, And To Acknowledge A Certain Olympic Gold Medal Recipient; And For Related Purposes.

1766.title: Carroll County; authorize to contract for the housing of inmates from other county or private jails that are located in this state.
1766.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Carroll County, Mississippi, To Contract For The Housing Of Inmates With Any Other County Or Private Jail Facility That Is Located Within The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1767.title: Scott County; authorize contributions to the Multi-County Community Service Agency, Inc.
1767.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Scott County, Mississippi, To Make Contributions To The Multi-county Community Service Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1768.title: Greene County; authorize to construct or acquire a county jail anywhere in the county.
1768.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Greene County, Mississippi, To Construct Or Acquire A County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1769.title: Hancock County; authorize county district attorney to appoint youth court prosecutor.
1769.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County, Mississippi, To Have The District Attorney Of The County Appoint The Youth Court Prosecutor For The County; And For Related Purposes.

1770.title: Town of D'Lo; authorize use of golf carts on certain public roads and streets within.
1770.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of D'lo, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The Town; And For Related Purposes.

1771.title: Hancock County; authorize release to media of certain redacted copies of youth court records concerning abuse/neglect.
1771.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County, Mississippi, To Require The Youth Court Of The County To Release Redacted Youth Court Records To The News Media Of Any Child Where A Child Is The Subject Of An Allegation Of Abuse Or Neglect; To Provide That The Records Shall Be Released At Cost To The Media; And For Related Purposes.

1772.title: Hancock County; authorize certain redacted copies be provided to parent/guardian of a child who is the subject of a youth court cause.
1772.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County, Mississippi, To Require The Youth Court Of The County To Provide A Redacted Copy Of Any Record, Report Or Investigation Concerning The Child Of The Parent Who Is The Subject Of A Youth Court Cause; And For Related Purposes.

1773.title: City of Pascagoula; authorize use of golf carts on certain public roads and streets.
1773.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; To Require Individuals Operating A Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; And For Related Purposes.

1774.title: City of Booneville; authorize imposition of a tax on hotels, motels and restaurants to promote tourism and recreation.
1774.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Booneville, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional Sales Tax Of Not More Than 2% Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation In The City; To Provide For An Election On Whether Such Tax May Be Levied; To Provide That The Proceeds Of The Tax Shall Be Equally Distributed To The Booneville & Prentiss County Main Street Association And The City's Parks And Recreation Department In Order To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; To Clarify How The Proceeds Of The Tax May Be Expended For The Promotion Of Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

1775.title: City of Jackson; authorize to create special local improvement assessment districts.
1775.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By The Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

1776.title: Lauderdale and Kemper Counties; authorize contribution to Multi-County Community Service Agency, Inc.
1776.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County, Mississippi, And The Board Of Supervisors Of Kemper County, Mississippi, To Make Contributions To The Multi-county Community Service Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1777.title: Kemper County; authorize contribution to the Multi-County Community Service Agency, Inc.
1777.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Kemper County Mississippi, To Make Contributions To The Multi-county Community Service Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1778.title: Warren County; authorize to construct or acquire a county jail anywhere in the county.
1778.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Construct Or Acquire A County Jail Anywhere Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

1779.title: Town of Plantersville; authorize to participate in State and School Employees Life and Health Insurance Plan.
1779.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Plantersville, To Obtain Coverage Under The State And School Employees Life And Health Insurance Plan; And For Related Purposes.

1780.title: Hancock County; extend the date of repeal on the Hancock County Tourism Development Bureau.
1780.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1019, Local And Private Laws Of 1996, As Last Amended By Chapter 924, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date From July 1, 2017, To July 1, 2021, On The Provisions Of Law That Create The Hancock County Tourism Development Bureau And Prescribe Its Powers And Duties And Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Hancock County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Contracts With Not-for-profit Organizations For Certain Purposes And Authorize The Levy Of A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Derived From Room Rentals By Hotels And Motels; And For Related Purposes.

1781.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Panola County, Mississippi, To Allow The Boys And Girls Club Of Northwest Mississippi, To Use A County Owned Building And To Provide Other Assistance To The Club; And For Related Purposes.

1879.title: Mrs. Mollie Blackmon; mourn the loss and commend the life and legacy of upon her passing.
1879.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life, Legacy And Christian Service Of Mrs. Mollie Bennett Blackmon And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1880.title: Donald Woods; commend his heroic service during World War II and as Mississippi Highway Patrolman.
1880.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Courage And Bravery Of Donald Woods And Commending His Distinguished Service During World War Ii On Behalf Of This Great Nation And His Service As A Highway Patrolman For The State Of Mississippi.

1881.title: Richard R. "Dickie" Caperton; commend upon retirement as City of Louisville Alderman.
1881.description: A Resolution Commending Richard R. "dickie" Caperton Upon His Retirement As City Of Louisville Alderman For Ward 1.

1882.title: Mayor Dan Burchfield; commend upon his retirement from public service.
1882.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service That Mayor Dan Burchfield Provided As Alderman And Mayor Of Eupora Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1883.title: Mr. Bradford C. Freeman; commend gallantry and bravery as member of Easy Company, 506th 101st Airborne Division during World War II.
1883.description: A Resolution Recognizing The Courage And Bravery Of Mr. Bradford C. Freeman And Commending His Valiant Service During World War Ii On Behalf Of This Great Nation.

1884.title: Hartfield Academy Hawks Boys Basketball Team; congratulate upon winning the MAIS class AAA State Championship and finishing second in overall tournament.
1884.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Hartfield Academy Hawks Boys Basketball Team Upon Winning The Mais Class Aaa State Championship And Finishing Second In The Overall State Tournament.

1885.title: Dr. Oswago Harper; commend on being named Administrator of the Year for the Gulfport School District.
1885.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Dr. Oswago Harper Upon Earning The Elite Honor Of Administrator Of The Year For The Gulfport School District.

1886.title: Elaine Lann Loftin; congratulate upon retirement after distinguished teaching career and for being named Teacher of the Year.
1886.description: A Resolution Commending The Superb Teaching Career Of Mrs. Elaine Lann Loftin Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement From Hamilton Attendance Center And Congratulating Her For Being Named Hamilton Attendance Center's Teacher Of The Year.

1887.title: Moran McLelland Pope, Jr.; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1887.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Moran Mclelland Pope, Jr., And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1888.title: Taylor Howard; commend service to his country during World War II and service to his community.
1888.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Honoring The Meritorious And Distinguished Service Of Sergeant Taylor Howard To His Country During World War Ii And His Continual Selfless Service To His Community And His State.

1889.title: Black Brothers' Building Supply; commend service to the Choctaw County community.
1889.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Honoring The Impeccable Customer Service And Economic Stability That Black Brothers' Building Supply Has Provided To Choctaw County Community Since 1971.

1890.title: Hind Community College Men's Soccer Team; commend outstanding season as MACJC State Champions and NJCAA Region 23 Champions.
1890.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2016-2017 Hinds Community College Men's Soccer Team And Head Coach Doug Williams Upon Winning The Mississippi Association Of Community And Junior Colleges State Soccer Championship And The National Junior Athletic Association Region 23 Championship.

1891.title: Congress; urge to keep the unique needs of.
1891.description: A Resolution Urging Congress To Keep The Unique Needs Of Children Front And Center In The Health Care System And To Protect Mississippi's Children's Health Coverage As It Considers The American Health Care Act Or Any Reforms To The Affordable Care Act And Medicaid.

1892.title: Holly Grove M.B. Church; commend on the occasion of its 100th anniversary.
1892.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Holly Grove Missionary Baptist Church Upon The Occasion Of Its Centennial Anniversary, Acknowledging The Celebration Of 100 Years Of Devout Faith And Spiritual Excellence.

1893.title: The Wilk-Amite Record; commend and congratulate on its 125th year anniversary.
1893.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Wilk-amite Record, Llc In Gloster, Mississippi, Upon The Occasion Of Its Quasquicentennial Anniversary, Celebrating One Hundredth Twenty-fifth Year Of Continuous Operation.

1894.title: Letter Carriers' Stamp Out Hunger Food Drive Day; designate May 13, 2017, as.
1894.description: A Resolution Commending The Vicksburg Local Branch 94 Of The National Association Of Letter Carriers (nalc) Upon Its Outstanding Service To The Community And To Designate May 13, 2017, As Letter Carriers' Stamp Out Hunger Food Drive Day.

1895.title: Dr. Fanasy Deming-Jefcoat; commend upon being honored as 2017 Dental Alumnus of the Year.
1895.description: A Resolution Commending The Impressive Career Accomplishments Of Dr. Fanasy Deming-jefcoat And Congratulating Her Upon Being Honored As The 2017 Dental Alumnus Of The Year.

1896.title: Linda Jean and Paul Morgan Rowan; commend upon 60th wedding anniversary.
1896.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Linda Jean And Paul Morgan Rowan Upon The Occasion Of Their 60th Wedding Anniversary.

1897.title: Stephanie Parsons; commend upon earning the Girl Scouts Gold Award.
1897.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Stephanie Parsons On Being Awarded The Gold Award By The Girl Scouts Of America In Tishomingo, Mississippi.

1898.title: Claire Ferguson and Charlie Brand; commend upon winning MHSAA Class 2A/1A Mixed Doubles Championship for East Webster High School.
1898.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Claire Ferguson And Charlie Brand Of East Webster High School Upon Winning The 2016 Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 2a/1a Mixed Doubles Championship.

1899.title: Deputy Martis "Bubba" Comans; mourn loss and commemorate life and service upon his passing.
1899.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life, Public Service And Many Accomplishments Of The Former Warren County Sheriff's Deputy Martis "bubba" Comans, And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1900.title: Barbara Trapp; commend upon being named "Outstanding Citizen" by the Junior Auxiliary.
1900.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mrs. Barbara Trapp Upon Being Named The Junior Auxiliary's "outstanding Citizen."

1901.title: Meridian High School Boys Basketball Team; commend upon winning MHSAA Class 6A State Basketball Championship.
1901.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Meridian High School Wildcats Boys Basketball Team Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a State Boys Basketball Championship.

1902.title: Honorable Mark Formby; commend distinguished legislative career and congratulate on appointment to Workers' Compensation Commission.
1902.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Laudable Legislative Career Of The Most Honorable And Distinguished Gentleman From Pearl River, Representative Mark Formby, And Congratulating Him Upon Being Appointed To The Workers' Compensation Commission.

1903.title: Quanderies KaShawn Powe; commend life and legacy upon his passing.
1903.description: A Resolution Commending The Life And Legacy Of Quanderies Kashawn Powe And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1904.title: Joint Session; call to hear State of the State address of Governor Phil Bryant.
1904.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1905.title: Constitution; amend to provide that parents have a fundamental right to direct the upbringing, education and care of their children.
1905.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section 32a To Provide That Parents Have A Fundamental Right To Direct The Upbringing, Education And Care Of Their Children; To Provide That Parental Rights Include The Right To Choose Alternatives To Public Schools; To Provide That The State Shall Not Infringe On A Parent's Fundamental Rights Without Demonstrating A Governmental Interest Of The Highest Order; And For Related Purposes.

1906.title: Constitution; amend to require the members of the State School Board of Education to be elected.
1906.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 203, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2020, The Members Of The State Board Of Education Shall No Longer Be Appointed And The Board Shall Be Comprised Of One Member Elected From Each Congressional District Of The State And One Member Elected From The State At Large; To Provide That The Terms Of The Elected Board Members Are For Four Years; To Provide That A Board Member May Be Removed By A Three-fifths Vote Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives; And For Related Purposes.

1907.title: Constitution; amend to authorize the Legislature to grant certain authority for metropolitan governmental creation.
1907.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Enact General Law Which Grants Authority To The Legislature To Enact Local And Private Law Prescribing The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1908.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the Legislature shall meet in regular session only once every two years for 125 days.
1908.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2024, The Legislature Shall Meet In Regular Session Once Every Two Years Rather Than Annually; To Provide That The Biennial Sessions Of The Legislature Shall Last For 125 Calendar Days; And For Related Purposes.

1909.title: Constitution; amend to reconstitute the Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning.
1909.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Reconstitute The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

1910.title: Constitution; amend to authorize legislative review of administrative rules.
1910.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Authorize The Legislature To Review Any Administrative Rule Promulgated By A State Agency And Approve Or Reject The Rule In Whole Or In Part After The Review.

1911.title: U.S. constitution; application to Congress for calling a convention to propose amendments that address free and fair elections.
1911.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A Convention Of The States Under Article V Of The Constitution Of The United States For The Purpose Of Proposing Amendments To The Constitution Of The United States Relating To Free And Fair Elections.

1912.title: Congress; urge to call a convention of States to propose limited amendments to the U.S. Constitution.
1912.description: A Concurrent Resolution Expressing The Incumbent Urgency And Necessity Concerning An Application To The United States Congress For An Article V Constitutional Convention Of The States For Proposing Amendments To The United States Constitution Which Impose Fiscal Restraints On The Federal Government, Limit The Power And Jurisdiction Of The Federal Government And Limit The Terms Of Office For Its Officials And For Members Of Congress.

1913.title: Joint session; call to hear State of the State address of Governor Phil Bryant.
1913.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1914.title: Constitution; amend to provide for the automatic restoration of suffrage for persons convicted of nonviolent crimes after a period of 5 yrs from completion of sentence.
1914.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Automatic Restoration Of Suffrage To Any Person Disqualified By Reason Of Non-violent Crime, After A Period Of Five Years From The Completion Of Any Sentence, Probation And/or Payment Of Restitution; And For Related Purposes.

1915.title: United States Embassy in Israel; urge the President to relocate to Jerusalem.
1915.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The President Of The United States To Immediately Implement The Provisions Of The Jerusalem Embassy Act Of 1995, And Begin The Process Of Relocating The United States Embassy In Israel To Jerusalem.

1916.title: Dr. Barbara Hamilton; commemorate life and express sympathy upon her passing.
1916.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Dr. Barbara Yvonne Hamilton And Expressing Sympathy Upon Her Passing.

1917.title: Roy F. Hodges; commend heroism of during World War II.
1917.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Courage And Bravery Of Roy F. Hodges And Commending His Valiant Service On Behalf Of This Great Nation During World War Ii.

1918.title: National Speech and Debate Education Day; acknowledge on March 3, 2017.
1918.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging March 3, 2017, As "national Speech And Debate Education Day" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance On March 3, 2017.

1919.title: Neshoba Central "Lady Rockets" Softball Team; commend for winning MHSAA Class 5A-6A slow-pitch softball state championship.
1919.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Neshoba Central High School Slow-pitch Softball Team And Head Coach Trae Embry Upon Winning Their Fifth Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 5a-6a Slow-pitch Softball State Championship.

1921.title: Constitution; amend to require preferential elections with no party affiliation.
1921.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section To Abolish Partisan Primaries; To Provide The Time For Holding Preferential And General Elections; To Provide That When Only One Person Has Qualified As A Candidate For An Office, Such Person's Name Shall Be Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That A Preferential Election Shall Be Held Three Weeks Before The General Election And The Candidate Who Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast For Such Office Shall Have His Name And His Name Only Placed On The General Election Ballot; To Provide That When No Candidate Receives A Majority Of The Votes Cast In The Preferential Election For An Office, That The Two Candidates Who Receive The Highest Number Of Votes In The Preferential Election Shall Have Their Names Placed On The General Election Ballot As Candidates For Such Office; To Require The Legislature To Provide For Nonpartisan Preferential Municipal Elections By General Law; And For Related Purposes.

1922.title: Police Chief Glenda Shoemaker; commend life and legacy upon passing.
1922.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life, Legacy And Accomplishments Of Police Chief Glenda Shoemaker And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To Her Family And Friends Upon Her Passing.

1923.title: Tori Bowie; commend for winning gold, silver and bronze medals in track and field during 2016 Summer Olympic Games.
1923.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Tori Bowie For Her Numerous Athletic Accolades In The Sport Of Track And Field, Particularly Her Gold Medal In The 4x100 Meter Relay, Silver Medal In The 100 Meter Dash, And Bronze Medal In The 200 Meter Dash During The 2016 Summer Olympic Games In Rio De Janeiro, Brazil.

1924.title: Town of Terry; recognize upon 150th anniversary.
1924.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Town Of Terry, Mississippi, Upon The Occasion Of Its 150th Anniversary, And Expressing Sincere Wishes For Continued Success And Prosperity In The Future.

1925.title: U.S. Congress; urge to hold a constitutional convention of states to impose fiscal restraints on the federal government.
1925.description: A Concurrent Resolution Of The Mississippi Legislature Expressing The Incumbent Urgency And Necessity Concerning An Application To The United States Congress For An Article V Constitutional Convention Of The States For Proposing Amendments To The United States Constitution Which Impose Fiscal Restraints On The Federal Government, Limit The Power And Jurisdiction Of The Federal Government, And Limit The Terms Of Office For Its Officials And For Members Of Congress.

1927.title: Fannie Lou Hamer; commend her life and legacy upon the occasion of her 100th birthday.
1927.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The Life And Remembering The Legacy And Distinguished Service Of Mississippi Civil Rights Icon Fannie Lou Hamer, Of Ruleville, Mississippi, Upon The Occasion Of Her 100th Birthday.

1928.title: Reverend and Mrs. James Carroll Sandford; commend their lives and service to Covington County.
1928.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring And Commending Reverend And Mrs. James Carroll "jake" Sanford For Their Wonderful, Selfless Service To Covington County And To The Veterans Of The State Of Mississippi.

1929.title: Constitution; amend to require Governor, not State Board of Education, to appoint State Superintendent of Education.
1929.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Governor, Rather Than The State Board Of Education, To Appoint The State Superintendent Of Public Education From Candidates Recommended By The Board; And For Related Purposes.

1930.title: Constitution; amend to require actual cause or physical evidence before a search warrant is issued.
1930.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 23, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Search Warrant Shall Only Be Issued For Actual Cause Or Physical Evidence Instead Of Probable Cause; And For Related Purposes.

1931.title: Constitution; provide that defense of double jeopardy is not available to person accused of killing an unarmed person.
1931.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 22, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Defense Of Double Jeopardy, Which Protects A Person Against A Second Prosecution For The Same Offense After Acquittal Or Conviction And Against Multiple Punishments For The Same Offense, Shall Not Be An Available Defense To Any Person Who Is Accused Of Killing An Unarmed Person; And For Related Purposes.

1932.title: Constitution; amend to require the Legislature to review administrative rules that would significantly impact the state budget.
1932.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Require The Legislature To Review Any Administrative Rule Promulgated By A State Agency That Would Effect The State Budget By Ten Percent Or More; To Provide That Any Such Rule Would Become Effective At The End Of The Next Legislative Session, Unless The Legislature Disapproves Of The Rule By A Resolution Adopted By Both Houses.

1933.title: Constitution; amend to provide that during legislative sessions held in odd years only appropriation bills shall be considered.
1933.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2021, And In Each Legislative Session Held In Every Odd Year Thereafter, Only Appropriation Bills Shall Be Considered Unless Two-thirds Of The Members Of Both Houses Vote To Consider A Bill That Is Not An Appropriation Bill; To Provide That Bills That Address A Major Economic Development Project Or State Of Emergency May Also Be Considered During Such Legislative Session; And For Related Purposes.

1934.title: Constitution; amend to provide that Legislature shall meet in regular session only once every two years.
1934.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 36, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2020, The Legislature Shall Meet In Regular Session Once Every Two Years Rather Than Annually; And For Related Purposes.

1935.title: Constitution; amend to provide that the minimum age to serve in Mississippi State Senate is 18 years.
1935.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 42, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi State Senate From 25 To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1936.title: Constitution; amend to provide that minimum age to serve in the Mississippi House of Representatives is 18 years.
1936.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 41, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Decrease The Minimum Age To Be A Member Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives From 21 Years To 18 Years Of Age; And For Related Purposes.

1937.title: Constitution; amend to provide for the automatic restoration of suffrage for certain crimes.
1937.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide For The Automatic Restoration Of Suffrage To Any Person Disqualified By Reason Of Crime, Upon The Completion Of Any Sentence, Probation And/or Payment Of Restitution, Except For Persons Disqualified For The Crimes Of Murder, Rape And Statutory Rape, Which Still Require A Two-thirds Vote By Both Houses Of The Mississippi Legislature To Restore Suffrage; And For Related Purposes.

1938.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1938.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 140 And Repealing Sections 141 And 142 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1939.title: Daylight Saving Time; urge Congress to enact legislation to allow individual states to be on year-round.
1939.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Congress Of The United States To Enact Legislation Allowing Individual States To Establish Daylight Saving Time As The Standard Time In Their Respective States Throughout The Calendar Year.

1940.title: Constitution; amend to require Legislature to enact a balanced budget for each fiscal year.
