1940.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, By Creating A New Section 69a To Require The Legislature To Enact A Balanced Budget Of The Entire Expenditures And Revenues Of The State For Each Fiscal Year And Limit The Amount Of Debt Obligation That Can Be Authorized Each Year; And For Related Purposes.

1941.title: Slavery; issue an apology for the State of Mississippi's role in and urge reconciliation.
1941.description: A Concurrent Resolution Apologizing For The Wrongs Of Slavery, And Expressing Regret For Mississippi's Role In Slavery, And Urging Reconciliation.

1942.title: Choctaw Central Lady Warrior; commend upon winning the MHSAA Class 3A slow-pitch softball state championship.
1942.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2016 Choctaw Central Lady Warriors Slow-pitch Softball Team For Winning The Mhsaa Class 3a State Championship.

1943.title: Mrs. Donie C. Whitehead; commend upon occasion of her 100th birthday.
1943.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mrs. Donie C. Whitehead Upon The Momentous Occasion Of Her 100th Birthday.

1944.title: Mental Health Awareness Month; declare May 2017 as.
1944.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring The Month Of May 2017, As Mental Health Awareness Month, And Encouraging The Citizens Of The State Of Mississippi To Acknowledge Its Observance.

1946.title: United States Constitutional Amendment Convention of the States under Article V; apply for certain restraints on federal government.
1946.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying To The Congress Of The United States To Call An Amendment Convention Of The States Pursuant To Article V Of The United States Constitution Limited To Proposing Amendments That Impose Fiscal Restraints On The Federal Government, Limit The Power And Jurisdiction Of The Federal Government, And Limit The Terms Of Office For Its Officials And For Members Of Congress.

1947.title: Term limits; enact for certain elected officials.
1947.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Sections 34, 35, 133, 134 And 173, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Who Has Served Two Consecutive Four-year Terms In The Mississippi House Of Representatives, Mississippi Senate, Or Office Of The Secretary Of State, State Treasurer, Auditor Of Public Accounts And Attorney General Is Not Eligible To Serve Again In That Office Until One Full Term Has Intervened During Which The Person Did Not Serve In That Office.

1948.title: Driver's licenses; state opposition to federal law requiring states to enact laws requiring the suspension of for persons who are convicted of drug offenses.
1948.description: A Concurrent Resolution Stating The Legislature's Opposition To The Enactment Or Enforcement Of A Law That Meets The Requirement Of 23 Uscs Section 159, Which Requires That The Driver's Licenses Of Persons Convicted Of Drug Offenses Be Revoked Or Suspended For A Period Of Six Months, Regardless Of Whether The Offense Was Related To The Operation Of A Motor Vehicle.

1950.title: Mississippi; recognize state history on occasion of bicentennial.
1950.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The State Of Mississippi Upon The Occasion Of Its Bicentennial And Celebrating 200 Years Of Mississippi History.

1951.title: Florence High School Football Team; commend and congratulate on outstanding season.
1951.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Florence High School Eagles Football Team And Head Coach Steve Pruett For Completing An Outstanding Twelve-win Season And Capturing The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 4a District 6 Championship.

1952.title: Joint Rules; amend to create a procedure for issuance of ethnic disparity impact statements.
1952.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Create New Joint Rule No. 41 To Provide A Procedure For The Issuance Of A Racial And Ethnic Disparity Impact Statement For Every Bill, Concurrent Resolution And Amendment Which Proposes A Change In The Law That Creates A Public Offense.

1953.title: Great Wall between United States and Mexico; urge the State of Mississippi to donate One Million Dollars to help erect.
1953.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The State Of Mississippi To Donate One Million Dollars To Help Build The "great Wall" Dividing The United States And Mexico.

1954.title: Command Sergeant Major Lawrence "Rabbit" Kennedy; commend distinguished 35-year career in United States Army.
1954.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Army Command Sergeant Major Lawrence "rabbit" Kennedy And Extending Gratitude For His Many Years Of Distinguished Service To His Country.

1955.title: "National Wear Red Day"; acknowledge observance of on February 3, 2017, in Mississippi.
1955.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Contributions Of The American Heart Association's Go Red For Women Movement And The Importance Of The Ongoing Fight Against Heart Disease And Stroke And Acknowledging Friday, February 3, 2017, As Observance Of National Wear Red Day In The State Of Mississippi.

1956.title: University of Southern Mississippi Symphony Orchestra; recognize international members and contributions to Mississippi.
1956.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The University Of Southern Mississippi Symphony Orchestra For Its Inclusion Of Outstanding International Musicians And Recognizing The Orchestra's Positive Impact On Our State.

1957.title: Jerry O'Keefe; commend his life and service upon his passing.
1957.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Saluting The Heroic Service Of World War Ii Ace Fighter Pilot And Former Biloxi Mayor, Businessman And State Representative Jeremiah Joseph "jerry" O'keefe, Iii.

1958.title: Mr. Paul Johnson; commend upon induction into Mississippi Tennis Hall of Fame.
1958.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Coach Paul Johnson Upon His Induction Into The Mississippi Tennis Hall Of Fame On January 14, 2017.

1959.title: Dak Prescott; congratulate upon receiving the 2016 Associated Press Rookie of the Year Award and commend outstanding career to date.
1959.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Dallas Cowboys Quarterback Dak Prescott Upon Receiving The 2016 Associated Press Nfl Offensive Rookie Of The Year Award.

1960.title: Brian Fleming; congratulate upon being named the 2016 Male Athlete of the Year.
1960.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Brian Fleming For Being Named The 2016 Mississippi Male Athlete Of The Year And Recognizing His Accomplishments In Sporting Clays.

1961.title: Evelyn Watkins; congratulate upon being named the 2016 Female Athlete of the Year.
1961.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Evelyn Watkins For Being Named The 2016 Mississippi Female Athlete Of The Year And Recognizing Her Accomplishments In The Sport Of Running.

1962.title: John Tomlinson; commend distinguished career with Mississippi State University upon his retirement.
1962.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Accomplishments Of Mr. John Tomlinson Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From Mississippi State University.

1963.title: Megan Heggie; commend for being named the 2016 State Games of Mississippi "Youth Athlete of the Year".
1963.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Megan Heggie Of Meridian, Mississippi, For Being Named The 2016 State Games Of Mississippi "youth Athlete Of The Year."

1964.title: Coach Gwyn Young; commend outstanding basketball career upon 900th win.
1964.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Many Accomplishments Of Coach Gwyn Young Upon His 900th Win And Overall 901-250 Record As The Copiah-lincoln Community College Athletic Director And Head Basketball Coach Of The Lady Wolves Basketball Team.

1965.title: Florence High School "Eagles" Boys Soccer Team; congratulate upon winning MHSAA Class 4A State Championship.
1965.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating The Florence High School Eagles Boys Soccer Team Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 4a Boys Soccer State Championship.

1966.title: Prentiss County Sheriff's Office Narcotics Agent Grady Smith; commend upon being named the Crime Stoppers of Northeast Mississippi Officer of the Year.
1966.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Prentiss County Sheriff's Office Narcotics Agent Grady Smith Upon Being Named The Crime Stoppers Of Northeast Mississippi Officer Of The Year.

1968.title: Northwest Rankin High School "Cougars" Girls Soccer Team; congratulate upon winning MHSAA Class 6A State Championship.
1968.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating The Northwest Rankin High School Girls Soccer Team Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a Girls Soccer State Championship.

1969.title: Northwest Rankin High School "Cougars" Boys Soccer Team; congratulate upon winning MHSAA Class 6A State Championships.
1969.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating The Northwest Rankin High School Boys Soccer Team Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 6a Boys Soccer State Championship.

1970.title: Bobby Rush; congratulate upon winning Grammy Award in the traditional blues category for his album "Porcupine Meat."
1970.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Famous Bluesman Bobby Rush Upon Winning The Grammy In The Traditional Blues Category For His Album "porcupine Meat" At The 59th Grammy Awards.

1971.title: Department of Revenue; urge to establish tax amnesty program for liabilities that accrued after January 1, 2005, and before December 31, 2015.
1971.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Department Of Revenue To Establish An Amnesty Program For Taxpayers Having An Unpaid Tax Liability Due After January 1, 2005, And Before December 21, 2015.

1972.title: Nelson Leroy Russell; commend life and express sympathy upon his passing.
1972.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Nelson Leroy Russell And Expressing Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1973.title: Robert J. Occhi; commend upon his retirement as President and CEO of Coast Electric Power Association.
1973.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service Of Mr. Robert J. Occhi Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As The President And Chief Executive Officer Of Coast Electric Power Association.

1974.title: Women's Equality Day; designate August 26, 2017, as in Mississippi.
1974.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating August 26, 2017, As Women's Equality Day In Mississippi, And Recognizing The Important Milestone Of Women's Suffrage.

1975.title: Alcorn State University Women's Tennis Team; commend for winning the 2016 SWAC Tennis Tournament.
1975.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2016 Alcorn State University Lady Braves Tennis Team, Head Coach Anthony Dodgen And Graduate Assistant Coach Kertsen Vanem For Winning The 2016 Southwestern Athletic Conference Women's Tennis Tournament.

1976.title: LisaAnn Redd; commend for being crowned Ms. Wheelchair Mississippi 2016.
1976.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Commend And Congratulate Ms. Lisaann Redd, Ms. Wheelchair Mississippi 2016, Upon Winning The Coveted Crown And Express Deepest Wishes For Continued Success In All Of Her Future Endeavors.

1978.title: Palmer Baptist Church; commend upon occasion of its 100th anniversary.
1978.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Diligence, Service And Wide Influence Of The Pastors And Members Of Palmer Baptist Church On The Occasion Of The Church's Historic 100th Year Anniversary.

1979.title: Annabeth Breeden; commend upon being named a Distinguished Finalist in the 2017 Prudential Spirit of Community Awards.
1979.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Annabeth Breeden Upon Being Named A Distinguished Finalist In The 22nd Annual Prudential Spirit Of Community Awards.

1980.title: National Ovarian Cancer Awareness Month; acknowledge during September 2017.
1980.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Observing September 2017 As "national Ovarian Cancer Awareness Month" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance During The Month Of September 2017.

1982.title: Mrs. Dianne Pittman Holbert; commend career of and congratulate upon her retirement.
1982.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Career Of Mrs. Dianne Pittman Holbert And Congratulating Her Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement.

1983.title: Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month; designate March 2017.
1983.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating March 2017 As Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month And Urging All Citizens To Participate In Events Promoting The Awareness Of Colorectal Cancer.

1984.title: Christopher L. Smith; acknowledge and commend service and leadership in Shriners International as Imperial Potentate.
1984.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. Christopher L. Smith Upon Being Elected As The Imperial Potentate Of Shriners International And Shriners Hospitals For Children.

1985.title: HCR; request the Joint Committee on the Library of Congress to approve the replacement of the statue of James Zachariah George with a statue of B.B. King.
1985.description: A Concurrent Resolution Formally Requesting The Joint Committee On The Library Of Congress To Approve The Replacement Of The Statue Of James Zachariah George That Is Displayed In Statuary Hall In The Capitol Of The United States With A Statue Of Blues Legend B.b. King.

1987.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Northeast Ms Natural Gas District; authorize expansion of its gas distribution system.
1987.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Section 1 Of Chapter 309, Laws Of 1966, As Amended By Chapter 496, Laws Of 1982, As Amended By Chapter 576, Laws Of 2000, As Amended By Chapter 349, Laws Of 2002, As Amended By Chapter 476, Laws Of 2016, To Authorize The Northeast Mississippi Natural Gas District To Expand Its Gas Distribution Services Into Certain Portions Of Lee And Monroe Counties; And For Related Purposes."

1988.title: Dr. William A. Lewis; commend career upon the occasion of his retirement.
1988.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Career Of Dr. William A. Lewis And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

1989.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Lottery; require the Gaming Commission to establish a.
1989.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Require The Mississippi Gaming Commission To Establish A State Lottery To Be Administered By The Mississippi Gaming Commission And To Require The Net Proceeds Of The Lottery To Be Distributed One-fourth To Municipalities, One-fourth To Counties And One-half To The Education Enhancement Lottery Fund; To Amend Sections 67-1-71, 75-76-3, 75-76-5, 97-33-9, 97-33-11, 97-33-13, 97-33-21, 97-33-23, 97-33-31, 97-33-33, 97-33-35, 97-33-37, 97-33-39, 97-33-41, 97-33-43, 97-33-45, 97-33-47 And 97-33-49, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes."

1990.title: Lyme Disease Awareness Month; declare the month of May 2017 as.
1990.description: A Concurrent Resolution Declaring The Month Of May 2017 As "lyme Disease Awareness Month."

1991.title: Phi Theta Kappa's All-Mississippi Academic Team; commend upon occasion of "Mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day".
1991.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Members Of Phi Theta Kappa's All-mississippi Academic Team On The Occasion Of "mississippi Phi Theta Kappa Day."

1992.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Taxpayer Pay Raise Act of 2016; revise provisions regarding income tax and corporation franchise tax rate reductions.
1992.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Sections 27-7-5, 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Before The Initial Scheduled Tax Rate Reductions For The Phase Out Of Income Taxation On The First $5,000.00 Of Taxable Income And The Phase Out Of The Corporation Franchise Tax, As Provided In The Taxpayer Pay Raise Act Of 2016, Senate Bill No. 2858, 2016 Regular Session, Shall Take Effect And Be Operable, Each Of The Two Immediately Preceding State Fiscal Years Must Have Been Fiscal Years During Which The State Fiscal Officer Made No Reductions To Agency Allocations Under Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972; To Provide That If A Scheduled Tax Rate Reduction Becomes Operable And There Is Later A State Fiscal Year During Which The State Fiscal Officer Makes Reductions To Agency Allocations Under Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Then The Next Scheduled Tax Rate Reduction Shall Not Take Effect And Be Operable Until After There Is One State Fiscal Year During Which There Are No Such Reductions Made To Agency Allocations; To Provide That If A Scheduled Tax Rate Reduction Is Not Operable For A Calendar Year Because The Requirements Of This Act Are Not Satisfied, Then That Tax Rate Reduction Shall Take Effect And Be Operable And Apply To The Next Calendar Year After Such Requirements Are Satisfied, Regardless Of The Tax Rate Reduction Scheduled For Such Calendar Year; And For Related Purposes."

1993.title: Joey Brinson; commend upon competing in the 2016 Paralympic Games in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
1993.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Joey Brinson Upon Competing For The United States Of America In Wheelchair Fencing At The 2016 Summer Paralympic Games In Rio De Janeiro, Brazil, And For His Numerous Other Achievements In The Sport.

1994.title: Ryan Estep; commend for outstanding wheelchair fencing career.
1994.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Olympic Wheelchair Fencer Ryan Estep For His Outstanding Career And Congratulating Him For His Numerous Achievements In The Sport.

1995.title: Reverend Keith Tonkel; mourn loss and commemorate life and ministry of upon his passing.
1995.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life, Legacy And Ministry Of Reverend Keith Tonkel And Expressing Our Deepest Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1996.title: Ashland High School Blue Devils Boys Basketball Team; congratulate upon winning their second consecutive MHSAA Class 1A State Championship.
1996.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Ashland High School Blue Devils Boys Basketball Team Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 1a State Championship For The Second Year In A Row.

1997.title: Johnny Ainsworth; commend distinguished head coaching career upon the occasion of his retirement from Greene County High School.
1997.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Head Coach Johnny Ainsworth Upon His Retirement From Greene County High School After 20 Years Of Coaching The Wildcats.

1998.title: Hinds Community College; congratulate upon occasion of its centennial celebration.
1998.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating Hinds Community College Upon The Grand Occasion Of Its Centennial Celebration.

1999.title: Lafayette High School Lady Commodores Basketball Team; commend upon winning Class 4A State Championship.
1999.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Lafayette High School Lady Commodores Basketball Team Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 4a State Basketball Championship.

2000.title: Choctaw Central Lady Warriors Girls Basketball Team; commend upon winning MHSAA Class 3A State Championship.
2000.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Choctaw Central Lady Warriors Girls Basketball Team Upon Winning The Mhsaa Class 3a State Championship.

2001.title: Neshoba Central High School "Lady Rockets" Bowling Team; commend upon winning Division II State Championship.
2001.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Neshoba Central High School Bowling Team And Head Coach Joey Blount Upon Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Division Ii State Bowling Championship.

2002.title: Neshoba Central Lady Rockets Basketball Team; commend upon winning MHSAA Class 5A State Championship.
2002.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Neshoba Central Lady Rockets Girls Basketball Team Upon Winning The Mhsaa Class 5a State Championship.

2003.title: Laurel High School Tornadoes Boys Basketball Team; commend and congratulate upon winning back-to-back MHSAA Class 5A State Championships.
2003.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Laurel High School Tornadoes Boys Basketball Team Upon Winning Back-to-back Mhsaa Class 5a State Championships.

2004.title: Caterpillar Inc.; commend executives and employees upon 35th anniversary of operations in Mississippi.
2004.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Executives And Employees Of Caterpillar Inc., On The Momentous Occasion Of Its 35th Anniversary Celebration Of Operations In Mississippi.

2005.title: Suspend deadlines for introduction; Taxpayer Pay Raise Act of 2016; delay date of initial corporation franchise tax rate reduction.
2005.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, And The Introduction, Consideration And Passage, Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delay The Date Of The Initial Scheduled Tax Reduction For The Phase Out Of The Corporation Franchise Tax, As Provided In The Taxpayer Pay Raise Act Of 2016, Senate Bill No. 2858, 2016 Regular Session; And For Related Purposes."

2006.title: Former Speaker Pro Tempore Robert G. Clark, Jr.; commend upon 50th anniversary of election to the Mississippi House of Representatives.
2006.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commemorating The 50th Anniversary Of The Election Of Former Speaker Pro Tempore Robert George Clark, Jr., To The Mississippi House Of Representatives In 1967, In Representation Of House District 47, And Acknowledging The Historical Impact Of His Election On The Progression Of The State Of Mississippi And The Critical Legislative Policies Enacted During His Esteemed Career.

2007.title: The Mississippi Arts and Entertainment Experience; commend upon grand opening and inducting first class of Hall of Fame.
2007.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Mississippi Arts And Entertainment Experience (the Max) Upon Its Grand Opening And Congratulating A Premier Category Of Eighteen Legendary Mississippi Actors And Actresses, Artists, Authors, Musicians, Playwrights And Thespians, Upon Being Inducted Into The Inaugural Class Of The Mississippi Arts And Entertainment Experience Hall Of Fame.

2008.title: Taiwan; commend and affirm strong and lasting ties with the State of Mississippi.
2008.description: A Concurrent Resolution Encouraging Further Economic Ties And Friendship Between The Republic Of China (taiwan) And The State Of Mississippi.

2009.title: Dr. Maria Luisa Alvarez Harvey; mourn the loss and commemorate life of.
2009.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Dr. Maria Luisa Alvarez Harvey.

2010.title: JROTC Leadership in Academic and Career Education Month; acknowledge during March 2018.
2010.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Observing March 2018 As "jrotc Leadership In Academic And Career Education Month" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance During The Month Of March 2018.

2011.title: Mayor Billy Skellie; commend upon retirement as Mayor of the City of Long Beach.
2011.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service That Mayor Billy Skellie Provided As Mayor Of The City Of Long Beach Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

2012.title: Lieutenant Colonel Bert E. Sullivan, Jr.; commend distinguished career upon the occasion of his retirement.
2012.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Meritorious Service Of Lieutenant Colonel Bert E. Sullivan, Jr., Rendered To The United States Of America, And Congratulating Him Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement.

2013.title: George Regional Hospital; commend upon being named the Top-Performing Rural Hospital in the State of Mississippi.
2013.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating George Regional Hospital Upon Being Named The Top Performing Rural Hospital In The State Of Mississippi.

2014.title: Rheumatic Disease Awareness Month; designate September 2017 as.
2014.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating The Month Of September 2017 As Rheumatic Disease Awareness Month In The State Of Mississippi.

2016.title: United States Institute of Peace and United States State Department; urge Congress to vote no on proposed budget cuts to.
2016.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Congress Of The United States To Vote No On The Proposed Drastic Budget Cuts To The United States Institute Of Peace And United States State Department, Thereby Protecting The American Interests Of Global Peace And Prosperity.

2017.title: Joe Gill; commend upon receipt of the 2017 Charles H. Lyles/Lyles-Simpson Award.
2017.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mr. Joseph Irvin Gill, Jr., Upon Being Named The 2017 Recipient Of The Charles H. Lyles/lyles-simpson Award.

2018.title: Dr. Maria Luisa Alvarez Harvey; mourn the loss and commend the life of upon her passing.
2018.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Dr. Maria Luisa Alvarez Harvey.

2019.title: Conference report for HB 1492; amend.
2019.description: A Concurrent Resolution Amending The Conference Report For House Bill No. 1492.

2020.title: Joint Resolution; authorizing competitive bidding for office space in the New Capitol.
2020.description: A Joint Resolution Of The House Management Committee Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives And The Rules Committee Of The Mississippi State Senate Requiring The Committees, Meeting As A Joint Committee, Authorizing Competitive Bidding For Certain Space On The Fourth Floor Of The New Capitol Building, And Authorizing Reallocation Of The Space If No Acceptable Payment Is Received.

2021.title: FY 2017 Appropriation to MDE; delete prohibition against expenditure of public funds for MS Association of School Superintendents.
2021.description: An Act To Repeal Section 44 Of Chapter 105, Laws Of 2016 (house Bill No. 1643), Which Is The Prohibition Against The Expenditure Or Transfer Of Any Public Funds To The Mississippi Association Of School Superintendents; And For Related Purposes.

2022.title: Assistant teachers; require school districts to notify of nonreemployment within 10 days after adoption of budget.
2022.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require School Districts To Give Assistant Teachers Notification Of Nonreemployment No Later Than 10 Days After The Adoption Of The District's Annual Budget By The Board For The Forthcoming Academic School Year; And For Related Purposes.

2023.title: Bonds; authorize general obligation bonds to repair and renovate the Freedom House in Canton.
2023.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Furnishing, Equipping, Repairing And Renovating The Freedom House In Canton, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2024.title: Health Care CON review; party requesting or appealing a hearing on application is responsible for costs and attorney fees.
2024.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-197, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Party Requesting A Hearing On An Application For A Health Care Certificate Of Need Who Does Not Prevail At The Hearing Shall Pay Costs And Attorney Fees, And To Apply The Same Requirement To Any Party Who Appeals An Order Of The Hearing Officer To The Proper Court And Loses On Appeal; And For Related Purposes.

2025.title: Deer hunting with dogs; authorize commission to regulate and require permits and licenses for.
2025.description: An Act To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Hunt Deer With Dogs Except During Such Special Open Seasons For The Hunting Of Deer With Dogs As May Be Designated By The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks On A Statewide, Regional, Or Local Basis; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful For Any Person To Hunt Deer With Dogs On Any Tract Of Real Property Unless A Permit For Hunting Deer With Dogs Has Been Issued By The Department For The Tract To The Owner Or Owners Of The Tract Or The Lessee Of Deer Hunting Rights For The Tract; To Provide That Such Permit Shall Not Be Issued Unless The Tract Of Land Consists Of A Certain Number Of Contiguous Acres; To Provide The Fee For Such Permit; To Provide That Certain Information Must Be Contained On A Tag On The Collars Of Dogs Utilized To Hunt Deer; To Provide That A Person Who Hunts Deer With Dogs Must Obtain And Possess A Deer-dog Hunting License In Addition To All Other Required Hunting Licenses And Permits; To Provide The Fee For Such License; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Release Or Place A Dog, For The Purpose Of Hunting Deer, Upon Or Onto A Public Right-of-way Without The Permission Of All The Landowners Whose Property Adjoins The Right-of-way Within Fifty Feet Of The Location At Which The Dog Is Released Or Placed; To Amend Sections 49-7-27 And 49-7-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2027.title: School district tax increase request; require itemization of central office expenses.
2027.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-39-207, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The School Boards Of School Districts Requesting An Increase In Ad Valorem Tax Effort In Dollars For The Support Of The School District To Include In Its Notice Of Advertisement Of Such Request To Include An Itemized Report Of Expenses Of The Central Office That Identifies Each Office Position By Title Or Description, The Office Function And The Current Salary Received; To Require Such School Board To Also Publish The Notice Of Advertisement Containing The Itemized Report On The Website Of The School District And To Make The Notice Available To The State Department Of Education For Publication On The Department's Website; And For Related Purposes.

2028.title: Use tax; seller must collect if the sale is solicited through a resident that is receiving compensation for certain customer referrals.
2028.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-67-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Is Subject To The Power Of This State To Levy And Collect The Use Tax When The Person Makes A Sale Of Tangible Personal Property Taxable Under This Article By Soliciting Business Through An Independent Contractor Or Other Representative Who Is A Resident Of This State; To Provide That A Person Shall Be Presumed To Be Soliciting Business Through An Independent Contractor Or Other Representative Who Is A Resident Of This State If The Person Has Entered Into An Agreement With A Resident Of This State Under Which The Resident, For A Commission Or Other Consideration, Directly Or Indirectly Refers Potential Customers, Whether By A Link On An Internet Website Or Otherwise, To The Seller, If The Cumulative Gross Receipts From Sales By The Seller To The Customers In The State Who Are Referred To The Seller By All Residents With This Type Of An Agreement With The Seller Is In Excess Of $10,000.00 During The Preceding Four Quarterly Periods; And For Related Purposes.

2029.title: Prescription Drugs Consumer Affordable Alternative Payment Options Act; create.
2029.description: An Act To Codify Sections 73-21-201 Through 73-21-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create The Prescription Drugs Consumer Affordable Alternative Payment Options Act; To Provide For Pharmacist Communication With Patients; To Provide That Compliance With This Act Shall Not Constitute A Violation Of Any Contract Or Any Agreement To Which The Pharmacist Or Pharmacy Is A Party; To Provide That A Pharmacist, His Agents And Employees Shall Not Be Liable For Any Act Or Failure To Act Pursuant To This Act; And For Related Matters.

2030.title: Medical examiner and pathologist fees for investigation of death and autopsies; extend repeal date.
2030.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-61-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Date Of Automatic Repeal For The Statute Prescribing Medical Examiner And Pathologist Fees For Death Investigations And Autopsies; And For Related Purposes.

2031.title: Post-Acute Residential Brain Injury Rehabilitation Facility; define for purpose of licensure.
2031.description: An Act To Amend Sections 41-75-1, 41-75-3, 41-75-5 And 41-75-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define "post-acute Residential Brain Injury Rehabilitation Facility" For The Purpose Of Licensure By The State Department Of Health; To Require A License To Operate And Provide Procedures For Application; And For Related Purposes.

2032.title: Group health insurance plan coverage for prescription drugs; authorize medication synchronization for beneficiaries.
2032.description: An Act To Provide That All Individual And Group Health Insurance Contracts Providing Prescription Drug Coverage In The State Shall Apply A Prorated Daily Cost-sharing Rate For A Partial Supply To Allow Beneficiaries To Synchronize Their Medications On The Same Day Each Month; To Provide That This Medication Synchronization Authority Shall Be Fully Applicable To The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan And The Mississippi Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

2033.title: Counties; revise the maximum amount of aid to fire departments appropriated annually by a board of supervisors.
2033.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Maximum Amount Of Aid To Fire Departments Which May Be Appropriated Out Of The County Treasury By A Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

2034.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; Blue Knights? International Law Enforcement Motorcycle Club tag issued only to members.
2034.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-19-56.432, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Distinctive License Tag For The Blue Knights? International Law Enforcement Motorcycle Club, Inc., May Be Issued Only To Members Of Such Club; And For Related Purposes.

2035.title: Hunting and fishing licenses; not required if resident is an honorably discharged veteran.
2035.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Residents Of This State Who Are Active Duty Members Of The Armed Forces Of The United States To Hunt And Fish In This State Without A License Regardless Or Where They Are Serving On Active Duty; To Authorize Honorably Discharged Veterans Of The Armed Forces Of The United States Who Are Residents Of This State To Hunt And Fish In This State Without A License; And For Related Purposes.

2037.title: Home inspectors; delete repealer on licensure law.
2037.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 73-60-1, 73-60-3, 73-60-7, 73-60-23, 73-60-29 And 73-60-45, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Licensure Of Home Inspectors By The Mississippi Real Estate Commission; To Amend Section 8, Chapter 442, Laws Of 2013, To Delete The Repealer On Those Sections; And For Related Purposes.

2038.title: Imitation firearms; prohibit.
2038.description: An Act To Prohibit Realistic Toy Guns And Imitation Firearms That Could Be Mistaken For Actual Firearms; To Create Exceptions; And For Related Purposes.

2039.title: Bonds; authorize for Phase II of construction of a new headquarters building for the Department of Public Safety.
2039.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Phase Ii Of Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Headquarters Building For The Department Of Public Safety; And For Related Purposes.

2040.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of bonds for capital improvements at the State Fire Academy.
2040.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The Mississippi State Fire Academy; And For Related Purposes.

2041.title: Grand larceny; theft of prescription drugs or firearms.
2041.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-17-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Theft Of Controlled Substances, Legend Drugs Or Firearms Will Constitute Grand Larceny Without Regard To The Value Of The Things Stolen; To Amend Section 97-17-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Technical Corrections To The Offense Of Larceny Of A Motor Vehicle; To Amend Section 97-17-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2043.title: County prosecuting attorney; amounts paid to for secretarial services shall not be considered as part of annual salary.
2043.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make It Clear That Amounts Paid To County Prosecuting Attorneys For Secretarial Assistance Shall Not Be Consider As A Part Of Such Prosecuting Attorneys' Annual Salary; And For Related Purposes.

2044.title: Health insurance; require coverage for hearing aids and services for hearing impaired children.
2044.description: An Act To Require That Certain Insurance Policies And Contracts Shall Provide Coverage For Hearing Aids And Services For Deaf And Hearing Impaired Children; And For Related Purposes.

2045.title: Third Circuit District; revise residency requirement.
2045.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Subdistrict Residency Requirements In The Third Circuit District; And For Related Purposes.

2046.title: Disabilities; authorize designation of certain on driver's licenses or I.D. cards.
2046.description: An Act To Amend Sections 63-1-35 And 45-35-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Designation Of Certain Disabilities On Driver's Licenses And Identification Cards Under Certain Circumstances; To Require Training For Law Enforcement Officers In Recognizing Certain Mental Or Medical Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

2047.title: Gang criminal activity; revise offense of and civil forfeiture for.
2047.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-44-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Short Title Of The Mississippi Street Gang Act; To Amend Section 97-44-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Terms; To Amend Section 97-44-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Penalties For Criminal Gang Activity; To Amend Section 97-44-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Evidentiary Standards; To Create New Section 97-44-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A Civil Cause Of Action Based On Gang Activity; To Create New Section 97-44-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify Venue; To Create New Section 97-44-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Service Of Process; To Create New Section 97-44-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Injunctive Relief; To Create New Sections 97-44-109 And 97-44-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Forfeiture Of Real And Personal Property; To Repeal Sections 97-44-9, 97-44-11, 97-44-13, 97-44-15, 97-44-17 And 97-44-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Constituted Various Provisions In The Street Gang Act That Are Eliminated Or Subsumed Under This Act; To Create New Section 97-35-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Threats Against A Law Enforcement Officer Or Judge; To Provide That Offenders Who Are Convicted Of Conducting Or Participating In Criminal Gang Activity Shall Not Be Eligible For Parole Or Any Early Release Program Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections; To Amend Sections 97-3-2, 47-5-138.1, 47-5-139 And 47-5-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2048.title: Retirement; persons convicted of certain felonies shall forfeit benefits from PERS, SLRP and MHSPRS.
2048.description: An Act To Create New Sections 25-11-147, 25-11-321 And 25-13-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Receipt Of Retirement Benefits From The Public Employees' Retirement System, The Supplemental Legislative Retirement System And The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol Retirement System Is Conditioned On The Member's Honest And Faithful Performance Of His Or Her Public Duties For The State; To Provide That A Member's Conviction Of Or Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere To A Felony That Is Related To Or In Connection With The Member's Employment In The State Service Is Considered To Be A Breach Of The Public Trust And A Breach Of The Member's Contract With The State; To Provide That If A Member Of The System Or Plan Is Convicted Of Or Enters A Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere In Any Court To A Felony That Is Related To Or In Connection With The Member's Employment In The State Service And Is Committed On Or After July 1, 2017, The Court Shall Conduct A Hearing In A Separate Civil Proceeding To Determine If All Of The Conditions Have Been Met; To Provide That If All Of The Conditions Have Been Met, The Court Shall Issue An Order That The Member Be Terminated From Membership In The System Or Plan And Forfeit His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan; To Provide That A Member Who Is Convicted Of Such A Crime Shall Not Be Terminated From Membership In The System Or Plan Or Forfeit His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan Until All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired; To Provide That After Receiving The Termination And Forfeiture Order From The Court, The System Shall Request The Attorney General For A Determination Of Whether All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired; To Provide That After The Attorney General Notifies The System That All Appeals Of The Conviction Have Been Finally Concluded Or The Time For An Appeal From The Conviction Has Expired, The System Shall Terminate The Member From Membership In The System Or Plan And The Member Shall Forfeit His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan; To Provide That A Member Who Is Terminated From Membership In The System Or Plan Shall Have His Or Her Contributions Refunded Without Any Interest; To Provide That If A Member Of The System Or Plan Is Also A Member Of Another Retirement System Administered By The Board Of Trustees Of The System, And The Crime For Which The Member Was Convicted Or Entered A Plea Of Guilty Or Nolo Contendere Is Related To Or In Connection With Employment Of The Member That Is Covered By Only One Of The Retirement Systems, The Member Will Be Terminated Only From The Retirement System In Which His Or Her Employment Was Covered At The Time That He Or She Committed The Crime, And Will Forfeit Retirement Benefits Only From That Retirement System; To Provide That The System May Conclusively Rely On A Termination And Forfeiture Order From The Court And The Notice From The Attorney General That The Requirements Of This Act Have Been Met In Terminating A Member From Membership In The System Or Plan; To Provide That The System Is Not Liable For Any Mistake In The Payment Of Retirement Benefits To A Member In Good Faith Reliance On A Termination And Forfeiture Order From The Court And The Notice From The Attorney General; To Provide That Any Ambiguity Or Uncertainty About Whether A Member Should Be Terminated From Membership In The System Or Plan Or Forfeit His Or Her Retirement Benefits From The System Or Plan Shall Be Resolved In Favor Of The Member; To Amend Sections 25-11-105, 25-11-111, 25-11-117, 25-11-120, 25-11-129, 25-11-305, 25-11-309, 25-11-311, 25-11-319, 25-13-3, 25-13-11, 25-13-21, 25-13-28 And 25-13-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2049.title: Antlered deer; all of bag limit for hunters 75 or older may be any antlered deer.
2049.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-7-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That For Hunters 75 Years Of Age Or Older All Of The Bag Limit On Antlered Deer Set By The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks May Be Any Antlered Deer; And For Related Purposes.

2050.title: State employees; allow medical leave without use of personal leave when dependent is dismissed from school sick.
2050.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-3-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow State Employees To Use Major Medical Leave Without Prior Use Of Personal Leave To Cover The Care For A Dependent When The Dependent Is Dismissed From A School Or Daycare Due To Illness; And For Related Purposes.

2051.title: Public contracts; give preference to resident bidders.
2051.description: An Act To Amend Sections 19-13-111, 31-7-15 And 31-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Letting Of Public Contracts, Preference Shall Be Given To Resident Bidders Whenever All Things Are Equal With Regard To Quality And Service But Differ Only With Regard To Price, If The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Resident Bidders Is Not More Than Two Percent Greater Than The Aggregate Of The Prices In Bids Received From Nonresident Bidders; To Provide That A Nonresident Bidder Domiciled In A State Having Laws Granting Preference To Resident Bidders Shall Be Awarded Mississippi Contracts Only On The Same Basis As The Nonresident Bidder's State Awards Contracts To Mississippi Residents Bidding Under Similar Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

2052.title: Columbia Training School property; DFA may transfer portion of to the Marion County Board of Supervisors.
2052.description: An Act To Authorize The Department Of Finance And Administration To Transfer And Convey Certain Real Property Located At Columbia Training School In Marion County, Mississippi, To The Marion County Board Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

2053.title: Agriculture; prohibit rules related to poultry products inspections which are more stringent than federal rules.
2053.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-33-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Poultry Producers Are Exempt From Certain State Regulations If The Poultry Producers Qualify For Exemption Under The Federal Poultry Products Inspection Act; To Amend Section 75-33-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Commissioner Of Agriculture And Commerce Shall Not Adopt Regulations Related To Exemptions Under The Poultry Products Inspection Act Which Are More Stringent Than Federal Regulations; And For Related Purposes.

2054.title: Civil liability; prohibit damages for wrongful birth or wrongful life.
2054.description: An Act To Create New Section 15-1-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Damages For Wrongful Birth Or Wrongful Life; And For Related Purposes.

2055.title: Common Core National Education Standards; State Board of Education shall replace with ELA Standards in 2017-2018 school year.
2055.description: An Act To Provide That Beginning With The 2017-2018 School Year The State Board Of Education Shall Replace The Common Core State Standards With The Ela Standards In Place In Several States; To Provide That The State Of Mississippi Shall Retain Sole Control Over The Development, Establishment And Revision Of Curriculum Standards; And For Related Purposes.

2056.title: School board members; all elected beginning with the November 2019 general election.
2056.description: An Act To Codify Section 37-6-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact The "nonpartisan School Board Election Act"; To Provide That Beginning With The November 2019 General Election, The Members Of The County Boards Of Education, Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts, The Trustees Of Consolidated School Districts And The Trustees From The Special Municipal Separate School Districts Shall Be Elected In A Nonpartisan Election Concurrent With The State General Election; To Provide That The Terms Of Office Of All School Board Members Shall Be Four Years; To Provide For Nominating Petitions To Run For The Office Of Elected School Board Members And A Uniform Number Of Signatures On Said Petitions Of Nomination; To Provide The Procedure For Filling Vacancies In The Office Of Elected School Board Members; To Amend Sections 37-5-1, 37-5-3, 37-5-7, 37-5-9, 37-5-18, 37-5-19, 37-7-203, 37-7-207, 37-7-221, 37-7-223, 37-7-225, 37-7-227, 37-7-229 And 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Sections 37-7-204, 37-7-209, 37-7-211, 37-7-215, 37-7-217 And 37-7-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Electing Trustees Of Municipal Separate School Districts From Added Territory; To Repeal Sections 37-7-705, 37-7-707, 37-7-709, 37-7-711, 37-7-713, 37-7-715 And 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide Certain Methods For Selecting Trustees Of Special Municipal Separate School Districts; And For Related Purposes.

2057.title: Qualifications for local school board; require at least one year of postsecondary education.
2057.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-5-1 And 37-7-201, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Members Of Local School Boards To Have At Least One Year Of Postsecondary Education As A Qualification For Office; And For Related Purposes.

2058.title: Parole; clarify list of offenses that make offenders convicted between 1995-2014 ineligible for.
2058.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The List Of Offenses That Render Offenders Convicted Between 1995 And 2014 Ineligible For Parole; And For Related Purposes.

2059.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds for the E.E. Bass Cultural Arts Center.
2059.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The E.e. Bass Cultural Arts Center In Greenville, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2060.title: Workers' compensation; increase maximum total recovery and remove cap on permanent total disability compensation.
2060.description: An Act To Amend Sections 71-3-13, 71-3-17, 71-3-21 And 71-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Total Compensation That An Employee May Recover Under The Workers' Compensation Law, And To Provide That Compensation For Permanent Total Disability Shall Be Paid To The Employee Until His Death; And For Related Purposes.

2061.title: State employee salaries; direct State Personnel Board to implement across-the-board increase.
2061.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct The State Personnel Board To Amend The Variable Compensation Plan As Necessary To Award A Salary Increase To Each State Employee Whose Salary Is Funded By The State General Fund In The Amount Of A 5% Across-the-board Increase Per Year Beginning July 1, 2017; And For Related Purposes.

2062.title: Prekindergarten programs; establish Early Childhood Services Interagency Coordinating Council.
2062.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Additional Duties For The State Early Childhood Advisory Council; And For Related Purposes

2063.title: Salary supplement for national board certified school nurses; increase number of nurses eligible.
2063.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-19-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Number Of Licensed School Nurses Eligible For A Salary Supplement For National Board Certification; And For Related Purposes.

2064.title: Income tax; authorize a credit for dependent care equal to that allowed for federal income tax purposes.
2064.description: An Act To Provide For An Income Tax Credit Equal To The Household And Dependent Care Services Credit Authorized For Federal Income Tax Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2065.title: Tourism project incentive program; cultural retail attraction certificates expire on 7/1/17 unless complete by that date.
2065.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-26-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certificates Issued Under The Tourism Project Sales Tax Incentive Program Authorizing Participation In The Program By Entities That Are Developing Tourism Projects That Are Cultural Retail Attractions Shall Expire On July 1, 2017, Unless The Project Is Completed By Such Date; And For Related Purposes.

2066.title: Homestead exemption; provide for certain owners of manufactured homes or mobile homes.
2066.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-53-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide An Exemption From Ad Valorem Taxes For An Owner Of A Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Who Occupies Such Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home As His Primary Home And Has Done So At The Same Physical Location For At Least Two Consecutive Years, Regardless Of Whether Such Person Owns The Land On Which The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home Is Located Or How The Manufactured Home Or Mobile Home And Land Are Assessed; To Provide That A Person May Not Claim The Exemption Provided In This Act If The Person Claims An Exemption Under The Homestead Exemption Law; And For Related Purposes.

2068.title: SREB contract program at out-of-state college of optometry; students not required to practice in Mississippi.
2068.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-135-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Mississippi Students Participating In The Southern Regional Education Board (sreb) Contract Program At Any College Of Optometry Outside Of The State Shall Not Be Required To Return To The State Of Mississippi To Practice After Graduation; And For Related Purposes.

2069.title: Enhanced eligibility verification system; direct Division of Medicaid to establish.
2069.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-219, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Division Of Medicaid To Establish An Enhanced Eligibility Verification System Which Will Verify Residency And Eligibility Of Recipients And Remove Ineligible Recipients From The Medicaid Rolls; And For Related Purposes.

2070.title: Harvest permits; increase maximum vehicle weight and delete date of repeal.
2070.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-19-81 And 63-5-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Maximum Gross Vehicle Weight Limit That Applies To Vehicles That Have Been Issued A Harvest Permit; To Delete The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law That Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Issue Harvest Permits To Owners And Operators Of Vehicles Hauling Certain Products; And For Related Purposes.

2072.title: Hunting on streets and railroads; clarify prohibition on.
2072.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Prohibition Against Hunting On Any Street, Public Road, Public Highway, Levee, Or Railroad; And For Related Purposes.

2073.title: MS Gulf Coast Region Utility Act; prohibit county authorities from extending service to area unless certain conditions are met.
2073.description: An Act To Amend Sections 49-17-743 And 49-17-745, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit County Utility Authorities Created Under The Mississippi Gulf Region Utility Act From Extending Any Water, Wastewater And Storm Water Service To An Area Unless Certain Conditions Are Met; And For Related Purposes.

2074.title: Search not incident to arrest; require consent.
2074.description: An Act To Create New Section 99-1-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Oral Advisement And Written Consent Before Search Of A Vehicle Or Of A Person During Law Enforcement Officer Contact; And For Related Purposes.

2075.title: Paternity; clarify circumstances under which putative father cannot contest.
2075.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Circumstances Under Which A Putative Father Cannot Further Contest Paternity; And For Related Purposes.

2076.title: Child support; duty to pay suspended upon incarceration for a felony.
2076.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-11-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Duty To Pay Child Support Is Suspended During The Period Of Incarceration Of A Noncustodial Parent For A Felony Offense; To Amend Section 93-5-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2077.title: State flag; require governmental entities, public colleges and universities and school districts to display or be subject to penalty.
2077.description: An Act To Amend Sections 3-3-15 And 37-13-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Governmental Entities That Receive State Funds And Public Colleges And Universities To Display The Official State Flag On Monday Through Friday Of Each Week On Or At Each Building In Which An Office Of The Governmental Entity Is Located And On Each Campus Of Each Public College Or University Or School District; To Require That If A Governmental Entity Or A Public College Or University Or School District Is Not Displaying The Official State Flag As Required By This Section, The Governor Shall Notify The Governmental Entity Or The Public College Or University Or School District Of The Noncompliance, And The State Fiscal Officer Shall Withhold 25% Of The Monthly Salary Of The Administrative Head Of The Governmental Entity Or The Public College Or University Or The Public School District Until Such Time As It Is In Compliance With The Requirements Of This Section; And For Related Purposes.

2078.title: Legislative member election contests; person who brings and loses contest must pay attorney's fees and costs.
2078.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-955, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The House Of Representatives And The Senate To Award Attorney's Fees And Costs Against An Unsuccessful Petitioner In A Legislative Election Contest; And For Related Purposes.

2079.title: Genetically engineered salmon; prohibit sale or cultivation of.
2079.description: An Act To Prohibit The Sale, Farming, Cultivation, Incubation Or Inducement To Spawn Of Atlantic Salmon Or Genetically Engineered Fish That May Come Into Contact With Or Spread Contagious Diseases To Native Fish In This State; To Authorize The Department Of Agriculture And Commerce To Enforce The Requirements Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2080.title: Statutory rape; relieve children who are close in age from criminal responsibility.
2080.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Statutory Rape To Relieve Children Who Are Close In Age From Criminal Responsibility; To Amend Sections 97-3-95 And 97-3-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Crime Of Sexual Battery To Relieve Children Who Are Close In Age From Criminal Responsibility; And For Related Purposes.

2081.title: Small Business and Grocer Investment Act; revise the definition of "underserved community."
2081.description: An Act To Amend Sections 57-10-705 And 57-10-707, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are A Part Of The Small Business And Grocer Investment Act, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "underserved Community;" To Remove A Provision That Prohibits The Use Of State Funds As A Source Of Funding For A Food Retailer Under The Program; To Revise The Eligibility Requirements For Applicants And Projects Under The Program; To Authorize The Mississippi Development Authority To Utilize A Certain Amount Of The Funds Available To The Program For Cost Of Administering The Program; And For Related Purposes.

2082.title: Mississippi Delta Enterprise Zone; create.
2082.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Delta Enterprise Zone To Focus On Improving The Small Business Climate The Mississippi Delta Region Through Providing Incentives To Small Businesses, Creating Incubators And Tax Incentives For Mississippi Based Independent Grocery Stores, Farmers Markets And Existing Convenience Stores In The Enterprise Zone, And By Providing Training And Technical Assistance; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Develop New Strategies For The Enterprise Zone That Will Increase Business Activities In The Enterprise Zone; To Provide That Activities In The Zone Shall Be Administered By A Coordinator Appointed By The Advisory Board Created By This Act; To Provide For The Duties Of The Coordinator; To Create The Delta Enterprise Zone Advisory Board And Provide For Its Duties; And For Related Purposes.

2083.title: Appropriation FY2018; pilot programs for legal representation for indigent parents in child abuse cases.
2083.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Office Of The State Public Defender Of Mississippi, For The Purpose Providing Additional Funding For Pilot Programs To Provide Legal Representation To Indigent Parents In Abuse And Neglect And Termination Of Parents Rights Cases For Fy2018; And For Related Purposes.

2084.title: Insurance agents; exempt age 75 or older from continuing education requirements.
2084.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-17-251, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From The Requirements Of Continuing Education Insurance Agents Who Are 75 Years Of Age Or Older And Have Held An Agent's License For At Least Ten Years; And For Related Purposes.

2085.title: Wildlife; allow mentally handicapped persons to hunt during special youth season and exempt from license requirements.
2085.description: An Act To Allow Mentally Handicapped Persons To Hunt During Any Special Youth Season Established By The Commission On Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks; To Exempt Those Persons From Obtaining A License; And For Related Purposes.

2086.title: Public waterways; landowner not liable for illegal use of ATVs in public waters.
2086.description: An Act To Amend Section 51-1-4, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Persons Using All-terrain Vehicles In Public Waterways Without Permission Of Landowner Are Not Entitled To Recover Damages Against Such Landowner For Injuries; And For Related Purposes.

2087.title: Bonds; authorize issuance of general obligation bonds to repair & renovate the Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center.
2087.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center In Natchez, Mississippi, Which Is Designated A Mississippi Landmark By The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History; And For Related Purposes.

2088.title: Kindergarten-age children; require compulsory school attendance for all.
2088.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Provisions Of The Mississippi Compulsory School Attendance Law Are Fully Applicable To Kindergarten-age Children; To Require Such Kindergarten-age Children To Attend Licensed Public, Parochial, Nonpublic Or Homeschool Kindergarten Programs; And For Related Purposes.

2089.title: Youth court; clarify original jurisdiction over certain serious offenses.
2089.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-151, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Original Jurisdiction Of The Youth Court Over Certain Serious Offenses; To Bring Forward Sections 97-3-65, 97-3-95, 97-5-39 And 97-5-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2090.title: Tax sales; list of lienors on property sold at a tax sale shall be provided to bidders at the tax sale.
2090.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-43-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Chancery Clerk To Make Available To Bidders At Tax Sales A List Of All Lienors On Each Parcel Of Land Offered For Sale To Whom Notices Of A Tax Sale Were Required To Be Sent; And For Related Purposes.

2091.title: School resource officers; require uniform statewide training.
2091.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Relating To School Resource Officer Qualifications To Require That All School Resource Officers Complete A Uniform Statewide Training Prior To Being Permitted To Serve In A School; And For Related Purposes.

2092.title: Health insurance; Commissioner of Insurance must approve rate filings containing an increase in premiums.
2092.description: An Act To Require Each Insurer Issuing Health Insurance Policies For Delivery In This State To File With The Commissioner Of Insurance Its Premium Rates And Classification Of Risks Pertaining To The Policies; To Require Approval By The Commissioner Of Insurance Before Rate Filings Containing An Increase In Premium Rates May Become Effective; And For Related Purposes.

2094.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt property used for housing and providing services to victims of domestic violence and sexual assault.
2094.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Taxation All Property, Real Or Personal, Used Exclusively For The Housing Of And Provision Of Services To Victims Of Domestic Violence Or Sexual Assault, Which Is Owned, Operated And Managed By A Not-for-profit Corporation, Qualified Under Section 501(c)(3) Of The Internal Revenue Code; And For Related Purposes.

2095.title: Partisan political activity by employee of Department of Human Services; repeal prohibition on.
2095.description: An Act To Repeal Section 43-1-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Partisan Political Activity By An Employee Of The Department Of Human Services And Provides Criminal Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2096.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of g.o. bonds to assist in establishing a McComb and Pike County musical heritage/creative arts museum.
2096.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Mccomb Main Street Association In Mccomb, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Incurred For The Establishment Of A Mccomb And Pike County Musical Heritage/creative Arts Museum In Mccomb; And For Related Purposes.

2097.title: Income and franchise tax; allow refundable credit for costs of purchasing/installing solar energy system or energy efficiency services.
2097.description: An Act To Authorize An Income And/or Franchise Tax Credit Equal To A Certain Amount Of The Cost Of Purchasing And Installing Solar Energy Systems And Energy Efficiency Services; To Provide The Manner In Which The Credit May Be Claimed; To Provide That If The Amount Of Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income And/or Franchise Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; And For Related Purposes.

2098.title: Bonds; authorize general obligation bonds to four lane MS Hwy 24 from Liberty to I-55.
2098.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Additional Funds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Construction Or Reconstruction Of Mississippi Highway 24 To Four Lanes Between Liberty And Interstate 55; And For Related Purposes.

2099.title: DHS supervision; reduce to 6 months.
2099.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-609, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reduce The Amount Of Time A Child Must Have Been Under Dhs Supervision Before Durable Guardianship May Be Granted; To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 43-21-613, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2100.title: Juvenile sentencing; provide criteria for determining parole eligibility and require hearing before imposing life without parole.
2100.description: An Act To Authorize A Procedure Consistent With Decisions Of The United States Supreme Court And The Mississippi Supreme Court For The Parole Of Certain Offenders Who Were Under The Age Of Eighteen When They Committed The Crimes For Which They Are Sentenced; To Provide For The Procedure To Be Followed Before Certain Juvenile Offenders May Be Sentenced To Life Imprisonment Without The Possibility Of Parole; To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2101.title: Official State Flag; change design to that of the "Magnolia Flag."
2101.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Design Of The Official Flag Of The State Of Mississippi To That Of The First Official Flag Of Mississippi Known As The "magnolia Flag"; And For Related Purposes.

2102.title: Medicaid; expand eligibility to include individuals entitled to benefits under federal Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
2102.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-13-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Medicaid Eligibility To Include Those Individuals Who Are Entitled To Benefits Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca) Beginning July 1, 2017; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Essential Health Benefits For Individuals Eligible For Medicaid Under The Federal Patient Protection And Affordable Care Act Of 2010 (aca); And For Related Purposes.

2103.title: Public Defenders Education Fund; establish education and training cost.
2103.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-26-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Funds To The State Public Defender For Education Of Public Defenders; To Amend Section 37-26-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Education Fund Fee Charged In All Civil Cases; To Amend Section 37-26-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Distribution Of The Fee To The Appropriate Funds; And For Related Purposes.

2104.title: Clarksdale Public Utilities Commission may be abolished by a majority vote of electors voting in a special election.
2104.description: An Act To Authorize The Clarksdale Public Utilities Commission To Be Abolished By A Majority Vote Of The Qualified Electors Voting At A Special Election Called By The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Clarksdale, Mississippi; To Provide That If A Majority Of The Qualified Electors Vote To Abolish The Commission, Such Commission Shall Be Abolished 30 Days After The Election Is Certified And The Governing Authorities Shall Assume Control And Operation Of The City's Utilities; And For Related Purposes.

2105.title: Campaign finance reports; to be available on county and municipal websites.
2105.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-805, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Campaign Finance Reports From Candidates For Local Government Offices Shall Be Made Available On County And Municipal Websites; And For Related Purposes.

2106.title: Headlights; require use of when windshield wipers necessary.
2106.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Use Of Headlights Whenever Driving Conditions Necessitate The Use Of Windshield Wipers; And For Related Purposes.

2107.title: Distinctive motor vehicle license tag; authorize for the Home of Grace.
2107.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of Distinctive Motor Vehicle License Tags To Supporters Of The Home Of Grace; To Prescribe An Additional Fee For The Issuance Of Such License Tags; To Provide For The Distribution Of The Additional Fees Collected; And For Related Purposes.

2108.title: Official Mississippi Bicentennial song; authorize.
2108.description: An Act Authorizing Mississippi To Have An Official Bicentennial Song; And For Related Purposes.

2109.title: Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) and (SNAP) Programs; impose certain restrictions on expenditures and eligibility.
2109.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose Certain Restrictions Affecting A Person's Eligibility For Tanf Assistance; To Prohibit Tanf Recipients From Purchasing Certain Items With Their Benefits; To Limit Tanf Atm Withdrawals, To Impose Certain Residency Requirements For Tanf Eligibility; To Impose Certain Work Requirements On Tanf Recipients; To Impose Certain Limitations On The Allowable Period Of Tanf Eligibility; To Impose Certain Restrictions Affecting A Person's Eligibility And Expenditures Under The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (snap); And For Related Purposes.

2110.title: United States Citizenship Test; require as a condition for high school graduation.
2110.description: An Act To Require The Demonstration Of Proficiency In Civics As A Condition Of High School Graduation By Requiring Students To Take The United States Citizenship Test As A Part Of The United States History Curriculum; To Require The United States History Curriculum And Test To Include Historical Knowledge Beginning With The Settlement Of Jamestown, Virginia, In 1607; To Amend Section 37-16-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2111.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to widen portions of Highway 16 in Kemper County.
2111.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For Use By The Mississippi Transportation Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Widening Of Portions Of Mississippi Highway 16 In Kemper County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2112.title: Natchez-Adams Special Municipal Separate School District; elect members of school board.
2112.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-7-703, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Board Of Trustees Of The Natchez-adams Special Municipal Separate School District To Be Elected; To Provide That The New Natchez-adams County School Board Shall Be Elected From Districts That Are The Same As The Board Of Supervisors Districts; To Provide That The Election For The School Board Shall Be A Nonpartisan Election; To Prescribe The Procedures To Be Used If A Vacancy Occurs On The School Board; To Provide That The Candidate With The Highest Number Of Votes Shall Be Declared Elected; To Amend Sections 23-15-193, 37-7-705, 37-7-707, 37-7-709, 37-7-711, 37-7-713, 37-7-715 And 37-7-717, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2113.title: Child abuse; felony if child tests positive for a controlled substance at birth.
2113.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-5-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Felonious Child Abuse Is Committed When A Child Tests Positive At Birth For Certain Controlled Substances That Were Not Prescribed By A Physician; To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Bring Forward Section 43-21-353, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Mandatory Reporting Of Child Abuse And Immunity For Reporting Such Abuse; And For Related Purposes.

2114.title: MDOC; require to provide cash overtime pay instead of comp time to correctional facility employees.
2114.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Provide Cash Overtime Pay Instead Of Compensatory Time To All Corrections Officers, Other Law Enforcement Staff And Other Employees Who Work In The Correctional Facilities Under The Jurisdiction Of The Department For All Time Worked By The Officer Or Employee That Is Considered To Be Overtime For The Position Involved Under The Federal Fair Labor Standards Act; To Amend Sections 25-1-98, 25-3-92 And 25-9-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2115.title: Department of Corrections; shall pay correctional facility employees for all accumulated comp time upon termination or death.
2115.description: An Act To Provide That Upon The Termination Of Employment Or Death Of Any Corrections Officer, Other Law Enforcement Staff Or Other Employee Who Works In Any Of The Correctional Facilities Under The Jurisdiction Of The Mississippi Department Of Corrections, The Department Shall Pay The Officer Or Employee Or His Or Her Estate, As Appropriate, For All Compensatory Leave Accumulated By The Officer Or Employee; To Amend Section 25-9-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2116.title: MDOC; require to provide cash overtime pay instead of comp time to corrections supervisors and commanders.
2116.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Corrections To Provide Cash Overtime Pay Instead Of Compensatory Time To The Corrections Supervisors And Corrections Commanders Who Work In The Correctional Facilities Under The Jurisdiction Of The Department For All Time Worked By The Supervisor Or Commander That Is Considered To Be Overtime For The Position Involved Under The Federal Fair Labor Standards Act; To Amend Sections 25-1-98, 25-3-92 And 25-9-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2117.title: Habitual offenders; revise method of determining whether a felony triggers sentencing as.
2117.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person May Be Sentenced As A Habitual Offender Only If He Has Been Sentenced To And Served Separate Terms Of One Year Or More In A State Or Federal Correctional Facility; And For Related Purposes.

2118.title: Youthful Offender Unit; offenders housed in to remain under court's jurisdiction.
2118.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Offenders Placed On Earned Probation In The Youthful Offender Unit (you) Shall Remain Under The Court's Jurisdiction; To Require The Court's Approval Before Those Offenders May Be Transferred From The You; To Amend Section 47-5-1401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2119.title: Habitual offender; offenses that trigger enhanced sentencing must have been committed when a person was 18 years of age or older.
2119.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Felony May Be Counted For The Purposes Of Sentencing A Person As A Habitual Offender If The Felony Was Committed When The Person Was 18 Years Of Age Or Older; And For Related Purposes.

2120.title: Mississippi Prison Industries Corporation; abolish and transfer to MDOC.
2120.description: An Act To Abolish The Mississippi Prison Industries Corporation; To Amend Sections 47-5-938 And 47-5-1251, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Repeal Sections 47-5-531 Through 47-5-575, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Mississippi Prison Industries Act Of 1990; And For Related Purposes.

2122.title: Assistant teachers/reading instructors; require in each K-3 class.
