2562.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-44, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Any Rate-regulated Natural Gas Public Utility With Certificated Service Area In Mississippi To Undertake Economic Development Activities; And For Related Purposes.

2563.title: Counties; maintain public drainage system on private lands.
2563.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-5-92.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Counties To Maintain Public Drainage System On Private Lands; And For Related Purposes.

2565.title: Violent habitual offender; require bifurcated trial.
2565.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require A Bifurcated Trial In Order To Sentence An Offender As An Habitual Violent Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2566.title: Violent habitual offender; revise.
2566.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Sentencing Of An Offender As A Habitual Violent Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2567.title: Habitual offender; revise sentencing.
2567.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Sentencing Of An Offender As A Habitual Offender; And For Related Purposes.

2568.title: Controlled substance offenses; revise enhanced penalties.
2568.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-142, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Penalties For Sale Of Controlled Substances Within A Certain Distance From Schools; To Repeal Section 41-29-147, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Enhanced Penalties For Second And Subsequent Drug Offenses; And For Related Purposes.

2569.title: Simple drug possession; reclassify offense.
2569.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reclassify Low-level Simple Drug Possession; And For Related Purposes.

2570.title: Habitual offender sentencing; revise.
2570.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Habitual Offender Sentencing; And For Related Purposes.

2571.title: CON for nursing facility in any underserved minority zip code area in the state; authorize.
2571.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-7-191, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of A Health Care Certificate Of Need For The Construction Of A 60-bed Nursing Facility In Any Underserved Minority Zip Code Area In The State; And For Related Purposes.

2572.title: Public construction contracts; establish alternative decision procedure for bids on high complexity construction projects.
2572.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Establish An Alternative Decision Procedure Which May Be Used By State Agencies And Local Governing Authorities For Bids On High Complexity Construction Projects; To Define The Term "high Complexity Construction Project" As Used In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2573.title: Office of Public Safety Planning of the Mississippi Department of Public Safety; transfer to DFA.
2573.description: An Act To Transfer The Office Of Public Safety Planning Of The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety To The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration; To Amend Sections 45-1-2 And 27-104-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2574.title: State agencies; limitation of rulemaking authority.
2574.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-43-3.111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Limitations On State Agency Rulemaking Authority; And For Related Purposes.

2575.title: Naloxone; authorize dispensing without a prescription.
2575.description: An Act To Create New Section 73-21-124, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Pharmacists To Dispense Naloxone Hydrochloride Without A Prescription; To Require The Pharmacy Board And The Medical Board To Promulgate Regulations; And For Related Purposes.

2576.title: Authorize distillers; to purchase their product from the state and sell product.
2576.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Issuance Of Distiller's Package Retailer's Permits; To Provide That A Distiller's Package Retailer's Permit Shall Authorize The Holder Of A Manufacturer's Permit, Class 1, Distiller's And/or Rectifier's Permit, To Operate A Package Store On The Premises Of The Licensed Distillery Exclusively For The Sale At Retail In Original Sealed And Unopened Packages Of Alcoholic Beverages Distilled At Such Distillery; To Provide That The Alcoholic Beverages Sold At Such A Package Store Shall Not Be Consumed On The Premises Where Sold; To Provide That Alcoholic Beverages Shall Not Be Sold In Any Package Or Container Containing Less Than 50 Milliliters By Liquid Measure; To Make It Clear That The Holder Of A Manufacturer's Permit, Class 1, Distiller's And/or Rectifier's, May Also Hold A Distiller's Package Retailer's Permit; To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Annual Privilege License Tax Levied For Distiller's Package Retailer's Permits; And For Related Purposes.

2577.title: Light wine and beer; retailer whose dealership is at a distillery may keep certain distilled spirits on the premises.
2577.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-3-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Retail Dealer Of Light Wine Or Beer Who Is Also The Holder Of A Manufacturer's Permit, Class 1, Distiller And/or Rectifier's Permit, Who Does Not Hold An On-premises Permit Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law And Whose Retail Dealership Is On The Premises Of The Distillery, May Keep And Store Distilled Spirits Manufactured At The Distillery On The Premises Of The Distillery If The Distilled Spirits Are Kept At A Location Separate From The Area In Which Retail Sales Of Light Wine Or Beer Occur; And For Related Purposes.

2578.title: Public buildings; update and consolidate the list of under DFA's supervision and care.
2578.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-5-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Update And Consolidate The List Of Buildings Under The Department Of Finance And Administration's Supervision And Care; To Amend Sections 29-5-81 And 29-5-161, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2579.title: Homestead exemption; require annual application for and full reimbursement to local governments for tax loss.
2579.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-33-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Homestead Exemption To Be Applied For Annually; To Require The Date Of Birth Of The Owner And, If The Owner Is Married, The Date Or Birth Of His Or Her Spouse To Be Included In The Application For Homestead Exemption; To Amend Section 27-33-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Amount Of Reimbursement Of Homestead Exemption Revenue Losses For Counties And School Districts Shall Be The Full Amount Of Homestead Exemption Allowed For Each Applicant; To Amend Section 27-33-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2581.title: Crimes of violence; revise list of offenses designated as such.
2581.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Offenses That Are Designated As Crimes Of Violence; And For Related Purposes.

2582.title: Abortion; prohibit an abortion of an unborn human individual with a detectable heartbeat.
2582.description: An Act To Codify New Section 41-41-34.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit An Abortion Of An Unborn Human Individual With A Detectable Fetal Heartbeat Except When A Medical Emergency Necessitates; To Authorize And Direct The State Board Of Health To Promulgate Regulations For The Appropriate Methods Of Performing An Examination For The Presence Of A Fetal Heartbeat; To Amend Section 73-25-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Physician Performing An Abortion On A Pregnant Woman Before Determining If The Unborn Human Individual Has A Detectable Fetal Heartbeat Is Subject To License Revocation Or Disciplinary Action; And For Related Purposes.

2583.title: State agency regulations; automatic expiration of rules adopted under federal agreements.
2583.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-43-3.114, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State Agency Regulations Adopted Under Federal Agreements Shall Expire On December 31, 2017, Unless Readopted Under The Mississippi Administrative Procedures Act And To Require Each Agency To Provide The Legislature With A List Of Each Regulation Scheduled To Expire; And For Related Purposes.

2584.title: State buildings; rename the MDEQ Building on Amite Street as the "Patrick Alan Nunnelee Building."
2584.description: An Act To Rename The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality Building In Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, The "patrick Alan Nunnelee Building"; To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration In Conjunction With The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality To Erect The Proper Lettering Or Signage On The Outdoor Facade Of The Building Displaying The Official Name As The "patrick Alan Nunnelee Building"; And For Related Purposes.

2586.title: Appropriation FY2018; pilot programs for electronic submission of arrest records.
2586.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Criminal History Center Of The Mississippi Department Of Public Safety For The Purpose Of Providing Funding For Pilot Programs To Develop Electronic Submission Of Arrest Records In Conjunction With The Administrative Office Of Courts Project Of Developing Online Submission Of Criminal Dispositions For Fy2018; And For Related Purposes.

2587.title: "Mississippi Health Agency Reorganization Act of 2017"; enact.
2587.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Health Agency Reorganization Act Of 2017"; To Provide That The Mississippi Department Of Mental Health Shall Be Under The Policy Direction Of The Governor; To Provide That The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Mental Health Shall Be Appointed By And Serve At The Will And Pleasure Of The Governor And To Provide That The Executive Director Shall Establish The Organizational Structure Of The Department; To Provide That The State Board Of Mental Health Shall Be An Advisory Board To The Department; To Amend Sections 41-4-1, 41-4-3, 41-4-5, 41-4-7, 41-4-9 And 41-4-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Provide That The Mississippi State Department Of Health Shall Be Under The Policy Direction Of The Governor; To Provide That The Executive Director Of The Mississippi State Department Of Health Shall Be Appointed By And Serve At The Will And Pleasure Of The Governor And To Provide That The Executive Director Shall Establish The Organizational Structure Of The Department; To Provide That The State Board Of Health Shall Be An Advisory Board To The Department; To Amend Sections 41-3-1.1, 41-3-3, 41-3-4, 41-3-5.1, 41-3-6, 41-3-15, 41-3-17, 41-3-18, 41-3-19, 41-3-20, 41-3-21, 41-3-51 And 41-3-53, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Provide That The State Department Of Rehabilitation Services Shall Be Under The Policy Direction Of The Governor; To Provide That The Executive Director Of The State Department Of Rehabilitation Services Shall Be Appointed By And Serve At The Will And Pleasure Of The Governor And To Provide That The Executive Director Shall Establish The Organizational Structure Of The Department; To Provide That The State Board Of Rehabilitation Services Shall Be An Advisory Board To The Department; To Amend Sections 37-33-151, 37-33-153, 37-33-155, 37-33-157, 37-33-159, 37-33-161, 37-33-163, 37-33-201, 37-33-205, 37-33-207 And 37-33-253, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; To Amend Sections 43-13-105, 43-13-107, 43-13-109, 43-13-111, 43-13-113, 43-13-116 And 43-13-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Change The Name Of The Division Of Medicaid In The Office Of Governor To The "department" Of Medicaid In The Office Of Governor And To Provide For The Qualifications For The Executive Director Of The Department Of Medicaid; To Amend Section 25-9-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Employee Positions Affected By This Reorganization From The Regulations Of The State Personnel Board; And For Related Purposes.

2588.title: Probation and parole officers; limit number of cases that may be handled.
2588.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Limit To 100 The Number Of Cases That A Probation And Parole Officer May Handle At One Time; And For Related Purposes.

2589.title: Federal MOU/MOE or contract agreements; require publication by state agencies.
2589.description: An Act To Codify Section 25-43-4.101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Certain Publication And Notice Requirements For State Agencies Prior To Entering Into Any Federal Memorandum Of Understanding (mou), Maintenance Of Effort (moe) Or Federal Contract Agreements; And For Related Purposes.

2591.title: Mississippi Delta National Heritage Area; directors may place appropriate signs and markers on public roads.
2591.description: An Act To Authorize The Management Entity Of The Mississippi Delta National Heritage Area, Upon Direction Of The Board Of Directors Of The Mississippi Delta National Heritage Area And In Conjunction With The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, To Erect Appropriate Signs And Markers Along Public Streets, Roads, Highways And Interstates Within The Mississippi Delta National Heritage Area; And For Related Purposes.

2592.title: Inactive state boards, commissions and councils; abolish.
2592.description: An Act To Abolish Certain Inactive Boards, Commissions, Councils, Committees, Authorities, Task Forces And Panels; To Repeal Section 23-15-169.6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Task Force To Study Voting Systems That Comply With The Help America Vote Act Of 2002; To Repeal Section 27-104-8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Commission On Public Procurement Codes; To Repeal Section 31-29-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Institute For Technology Development Oversight Committee; To Repeal Section 41-30-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Duties Of The Advisory Committee On Alcohol Abuse And Alcoholism Of The Advisory Council On Comprehensive Health Planning Of The Office Of The Governor; To Repeal Section 41-95-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates The Mississippi Health Finance Authority; To Repeal Section 41-95-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prescribes The Duties And Responsibilities Of The Mississippi Health Finance Board; To Repeal Sections 41-105-1 And 41-105-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establish And Prescribe Duties For The Healthcare Coordinating Council; To Repeal Section 43-33-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Housing Task Force; To Repeal Section 45-23-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes A Technical Advisory Committee Of Boiler And Pressure Vessel Safety; To Repeal Section 49-31-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Task Force On Recycling; To Repeal Section 57-1-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes An Advisory Council To The Department Of Economic Development; To Repeal Section 57-19-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Food Technology Advisory Board; To Repeal Section 61-4-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Mississippi Wayport Authority And A Mississippi Wayport Authority Advisory Council; To Repeal Section 69-1-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Council Of State Agencies On Agriculture; To Repeal Section 69-1-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Establishes The Agricultural Marketing Advisory Task Force; To Repeal Sections 5-3-27, 5-3-29, 5-3-31, 45-19-51, 45-19-53, 45-19-55, 45-19-7, 45-19-59, 45-19-61, 45-19-63 And 45-19-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorize An Investigation Of Un-american Activities In The State, Empower The Secretary Of State To Investigate Subversive Groups, Empower The Secretary Of State To Require A List Of Officers And Members Of Subversive Groups, Provide A Criminal Penalty For Failure To Comply, Direct District Attorneys To Enforce This Law And Direct The Attorney General To Seek An Injunction To Dissolve Such Subversive Groups; And For Related Purposes.

2593.title: Juvenile offenders; provide alternative sentencing options.
2593.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-3-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Alternative Sentencing Options For Juvenile Offenders In Certain Murder Convictions; And For Related Purposes.

2594.title: Mississippi Education Savings Scholarship Accounts Program; establish.
2594.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Education Savings Scholarship Accounts Program To Be Administered By The State Department Of Education; To Define Eligibility For The Program; To Provide That Participating Families Receive 90% Of The Base Student Cost Allocation Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Formula; To Prescribe The Authorized Educational Expenditures For Education Savings Scholarship Account Funds Which Shall Include Private School Tuition, Books Online Learning Programs And Postsecondary Expenses; To Provide For The Transfer Of Adequate Education Funds By The State Department Of Education To The State Treasurer To Be Deposited Into Individual Student Education Savings Scholarship Accounts And To Establish Funds For That Purpose; To Provide For The Transfer Of A Pro Rata Amount Of Local School District Taxes Into Individual Student Education Savings Scholarship Accounts By The Local School District; To Amend Sections 37-13-91 And 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2595.title: "Mississippi Educational Improvement Tax Credit Act of 2017"; establish.
2595.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Education Improvement Tax Credit Act Of 2017"; To Establish An Educational Improvement Tax Credit (eitc) Program Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority To Provide Financial Assistance To Low- And Middle-income Families Seeking Educational Options For Their Children; To Authorize The Income Tax Credit For Business Firms Making Contributions To Qualified Educational Scholarship Organizations Or Educational Improvement Organizations And To Provide Standards And Limitations For Such Contributions; To Provide That The Scholarships Received By An Eligible Student From A Scholarship Organization Are Deductible As An Adjustment To Gross Income; To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2596.title: Concealed-carry license; 18-year-old with instructor certification qualifies for.
2596.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Eligibility For An Instructor-certified Concealed-carry License; To Amend Section 97-37-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Holders Of An Instructor-certified Concealed-carry License To Carry A Concealed Weapon On Educational Property; To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A Person Who Is At Least 18 Years Of Age To Obtain An Instructor-certified Concealed-carry License; And For Related Purposes.

2597.title: Chemical endangerment of a child or fetus; create crime of.
2597.description: An Act To Create The Offense Of Chemical Endangerment Of A Child Or Fetus And To Prescribe Punishment Therefor; To Mandate That Prosecutors Offer Substance Abuse Treatment Programs As An Alternative To Prosecution; And For Related Purposes.

2598.title: Unfair Cigarette Sales Law; repeal.
2598.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 75-23-1 Through 75-23-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The Unfair Cigarette Sales Law; And For Related Purposes.

2599.title: "Mississippi Opportunity Scholarship Act of 2017"; establish.
2599.description: An Act Entitled The "mississippi Opportunity Scholarship Act Of 2017"; To Provide Definitions; To Provide An Opportunity Scholarship Program Under Which Low-income And Middle-income Students In Persistently Lowest Achieving Schools And Any Student With A Disability May Use The State Payments To Their Home School District To Pay Tuition To Attend A Nonresident Public School Or A Participating Nonpublic School; To Provide For A Three-year Phase-in Of This Opportunity Scholarship Program; To Provide Standards For The Receipt And Calculation Of Such Scholarships; To Establish An Opportunity Scholarship Fund; To Provide For The Phased-in Reduction Of Adequate Education Fund Payments In Resident School Districts In The Amount Of Such Scholarship Payments; To Establish And Empower An Education Opportunity Board Within The State Department Of Education To Administer The Opportunity Scholarship Program; To Provide For An Optional Local Tuition Grant Program For Such Students; To Provide For A Middle-income Scholarship Program; To Prescribe Limitations And Require Annual Reporting; And For Related Purposes.

2600.title: Student transfer from school or school district which has lost accreditation; provide for mandatory transfer.
2600.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Parent Or Legal Guardian Of A School-age Child Who Is Enrolled In A School Or School District Whose Accreditation Has Been Withdrawn May File A Petition To An Accredited School District Of The Parent Or Legal Guardian's Choice Who Shall Grant The Transfer On A Space-available Basis; To Amend Sections 37-15-29, And 37-15-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Transfer Of Students In Conformity Thereto Upon The Petition Of The Parent Or Guardian Of Such Student; To Provide That Transportation Of Such Student To The Transferee School Shall Be The Responsibility Of The Parent Or Guardian Unless The School District Agrees To Provide Transportation; To Amend Section 37-151-93, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No School District Accepting Any Transfer Student Shall Charge The Student Any Tuition Fees; To Amend Sections 37-15-13 And 37-15-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2601.title: Common Core educational standards; parents can opt out.
2601.description: An Act To Authorize And Direct Public School Districts To Allow Parents And Legal Guardians Of Enrolled Students To Opt Out Of Common Core Aligned Curricula, Certain Student Data And The Release Of Information Concerning Their Children's Personal Beliefs; To Prescribe A Form For The Student Privacy Protection Opt-out Request By The Parent Or Legal Guardian; To Direct The State Board Of Education To Issue Regulations Consistent With The Student Data Confidentiality Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2602.title: Intercept gaming winnings of parents with a child support arrearage; provide procedures for.
2602.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-76-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Declare As Public Policy That Children Are Adversely Affected When A Parent Who Has An Outstanding Child Support Arrearage Diverts Child Support To Gaming; To Codify Section 75-76-58, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Procedures For The Mississippi Gaming Commission, The Department Of Human Services And Licensees Under Chapter 76 Of Title 75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Carry Out The Intercept And Seizure Of Game Winnings Of Parents With A Child Support Arrearage; And For Related Purposes.

2603.title: Employment Protection Act; revise and clarify.
2603.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Retention Of E-verify Confirmations For At Least Three Years, Revise And Clarify Enforcement And Penalties Under The Mississippi Employment Protection Act, Revise Definitions, And Provide For Expediting Trial Of Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2605.title: Educational expenses at qualified private schools; individual income tax credits for.
2605.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide A State Income Tax Deduction For Educational Expenses By Parents Who Send Their Children Or Dependents To A Qualified Private School Or A Homeschool Program; And For Related Purposes.

2606.title: Income tax; authorize a deduction for certain retrofitting or upgrades to homes in Coastal Area of Mississippi.
2606.description: An Act To Provide An Income Tax Deduction For Certain Retrofitting Or Upgrades To Homes Located In The Coastal Area Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2607.title: Gulf Coast Restoration Fund; establish board of trustees to make expenditure recommendations.
2607.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-103-302, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Deposit Into The State Treasury Of Certain Funds Received By Or On Behalf Of The State Of Mississippi Through A Negotiated Settlement For Economic Damages In Connection With The Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill; To Create A Special Fund In The State Treasury To Be Designated As The Gulf Coast Restoration Fund; To Provide That Monies In The Special Fund Shall Be Used By The Department Of Marine Resources, Upon Appropriation By The Legislature, Based Upon The Recommendation Of The Board Of Trustees Of The Gulf Coast Restoration Fund To Provide Assistance To Entities For The Purpose Of Promoting Ecological Habitat, Promoting Economic Development And Overall Community Benefit; To Create The Board Of Trustees Of The Gulf Coast Restoration Fund; To Provide For The Composition Of The Board Of Trustees; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees Of The Gulf Coast Restoration Fund Shall Review Applications For Assistance Under This Act And Make Recommendations For Assistance To The Department Of Marine Resources; And For Related Purposes.

2608.title: Termite inspections; clarify inspector's duty to client.
2608.description: An Act To Create New Section 69-19-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Qualifications Of Persons Authorized To Issue A Wood-destroying Insect Inspection Report; To Create New Section 69-19-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify The Contents Of The Report, Provide For Warranty Of The Report Contents, And Provide For Civil Liability Therefor; To Create New Section 69-19-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Specify Remedies; To Create New Section 69-19-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Transfer Of Liabilities Concurrent With A Transfer Of Assets; To Amend Section 69-19-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2609.title: Government self-insurance programs; authorize Commissioner of Insurance to conduct examinations of.
2609.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-46-20, 19-7-7 And 37-7-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Conduct An Examination Of Certain Self-insurance Programs Providing Coverage To Governmental Entities; And For Related Purposes.

2611.title: SLRP; authorize current members to opt out and close for persons first elected after July 1, 2017.
2611.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Grant All Persons Who Are Contributing Members Of The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan On July 1, 2017, A One-time Option To Withdraw From Membership In The Plan; To Provide That Upon Exercising This Option The Contributions To The Plan By The Member Shall Cease And The Person's Accumulated Contributions To The Plan Shall Be Paid To Him Or Her; To Provide That This Option Must Be Exercised Before September 1, 2017; To Provide That Persons Who Are Elected As Members Of The State Legislature Or President Of The Senate For Terms Beginning After July 1, 2017, And Who Previously Served As Members Of The Legislature Or President Of The Senate But Were Not A Member Of The State Legislature On July 1, 2017, Shall Have The Option Of Withdrawing From Membership In The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan; To Provide That The Person's Accumulated Contributions To The Plan Shall Be Paid To Him Or Her; To Provide That Once Exercised, This Option Shall Be Permanent; To Provide That All Persons Who Become Members Of The State Legislature For The First Time After July 1,2017, And The Persons Who Become The President Of The Senate For The First Time After July 1, 2017, Shall Not Become Members Of The Supplemental Legislative Retirement Plan; And For Related Purposes.

2612.title: State flag; require display if the United States Flag is also displayed at all public buildings and provide penalties.
2612.description: An Act To Amend Sections 3-3-15 And 37-13-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The State Flag To Be Displayed If The United States Flag Is Displayed From All Public Buildings Owned Or Leased By A Public University, College Or School District; To Provide A Statutory Penalty Against The Agency Head, University President Or School District Superintendent For Any State Agency, University, College Or School District That Does Not Display The State Flag And United States Flag; To Authorize Any Mississippi Citizen To Seek An Injunction To Enforce This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2614.title: Lottery Contingency Act of 2017; create.
2614.description: An Act To Create The "lottery Contingency Act Of 2017"; To Provide That In The Event That A State Lottery In Enacted, Any Revenue Collected By The State From Such A Lottery After The Administrative Expenses Of The Lottery Have Been Paid And Any Prize Money Awarded, Shall Be Distributed To The Various Local Taxing Districts Of The State And Utilized By The Local Taxing Districts To Reduce Ad Valorem Taxation; And For Related Purposes.

2615.title: MDEQ building; rename as the "Patrick Alan Nunnelee Building."
2615.description: An Act To Rename The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality Building In Jackson, Hinds County, Mississippi, The "patrick Alan Nunnelee Building"; To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration In Conjunction With The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality To Erect The Proper Lettering Or Signage On The Outdoor Facade Of The Building Displaying The Official Name As The "patrick Alan Nunnelee Building"; And For Related Purposes.

2616.title: Hospice licensure; authorize State Department to issue licenses to certain applicants.
2616.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-85-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The State Department Of Health To Issue Hospice Licenses To Certain Applicants; And For Related Purposes.

2617.title: Mississippi stroke system of care and STEMI system of care; authorize State Department of Health to designate and adopt standards.
2617.description: An Act Relating To The Mississippi Stroke System Of Care And Stemi System Of Care; Defining And Requiring Emergency Medical Services Training And Transport Protocol Plans For Stemi Patients And Acute Stroke Patients In Accordance With American Heart Association Criteria; To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Health To Identify And Recognize Stemi And Multilevel Stroke Centers; And For Related Purposes.

2619.title: Workers' compensation claims; may be made by persons 18 and older.
2619.description: An Act To Amend Section 71-3-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Anyone Who Has Attained The Age Of 18 May Receive Their Own Compensation And Make Decisions Regarding Their Case Under The Workers' Compensation Act; And For Related Purposes.

2620.title: Dog and cat abuse; conform reporting to FBI guidelines.
2620.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A First-offense Felony Of Aggravated Abuse Of A Dog Or Cat; To Enact Definitions; To Limit The Number Of Counts That Can Be Charged Arising From A Single Incident; To Require That Reporting Of All Offenses Against Dogs Or Cats Will Conform To Fbi Reporting Guidelines; And For Related Purposes.

2621.title: MS Credit Availability Act; authorize licensees to charge fees/costs for repossession and sale of collateral.
2621.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-619, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Licensees Under The Mississippi Credit Availability Act To Charge Fees And Costs Relating To The Repossession And Sale Of Collateral; And For Related Purposes.

2623.title: "Deepwater Horizon Oil Disaster Fund"; all funds received by state shall be appropriated for state and county road maintenance.
2623.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-103-302, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Funds Received By The State Of Mississippi Through A Negotiated Settlement Or Recovery For Damages In Connection With The Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Shall Be Deposited Into A Special Fund Called The "deepwater Horizon Oil Disaster Fund" To Be Appropriated By The Legislature For State And County Highway Maintenance; And For Related Purposes.

2627.title: Mississippi Adequate Education Program funding formula; bring forward.
2627.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 37-151-1, 37-151-5, 37-151-6, 37-151-7, 37-151-7.1, 37-151-8, 37-151-77, 37-151-79, 37-151-81, 37-151-83, 37-151-85, 37-151-87, 37-151-89, 37-151-91, 37-151-97, 37-151-99, 37-151-101, 37-151-103 And 37-151-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The Formula For Determination Of Annual Allocations For Current Operation Of Schools Under The Mississippi Adequate Education Program And The Computation Of The Required Local Revenue In Support Of The Adequate Education Program; To Bring Forward Sections 37-61-9 And 37-61-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Annual Adoption Of Local School District Budgets; To Bring Forward Sections 37-3-53, 37-17-6, 37-17-11, 37-19-7, 37-23-175, 37-23-179, 37-57-1, 37-57-104, 37-57-105 And 37-57-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For School District Accountability And Accreditation Standards, Define Gifted Students, Authorize And Set Limitations On Ad Valorem Tax Levies For The Maintenance Of School Districts, Provide A Limitation On Aggregate Receipts From Taxes For School Purposes And Authority For A Referendum In Order To Exceed That Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

2628.title: Student absences for school activities; shall be counted for average daily attendance funding purposes.
2628.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-91, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Approved Student Absences For School Activities Shall Be Counted For Average Daily Attendance Funding Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2630.title: Cannabidiol; clarify use in research of seizures and other medical conditions.
2630.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-136, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Use Of Cannabidiol In Research Of Treatments For Seizures And Other Medical Conditions; To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Schedule I To The Requirements Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2631.title: Mississippi Arts Commission; abolish and transfer power, duties and assets to Mississippi Development Authority.
2631.description: An Act To Amend Sections 39-11-1, 39-11-3, 39-11-7, 39-11-9, 39-11-11 And 39-11-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer The Duties, Responsibilities, Authority, Power, Assets, Liabilities, Contractual Rights And Obligations, Property Rights And Employees Of The Mississippi Arts Commission To The Mississippi Development Authority; To Create The Mississippi Arts Advisory Council And Provide For Its Membership And Duties; To Amend Sections 39-27-1, 39-32-1, 39-33-1 And 57-11-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Repeal Section 39-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes The Mississippi Arts Commission To Employ An Executive Director And Other Officers, Experts And Employees, And Fix Their Salaries; And For Related Purposes.

2634.title: Special local improvement assessments district; authorize municipalities to create.
2634.description: An Act To Authorize Municipalities To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By A Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By A Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By A Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; To Amend Section 21-33-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2635.title: MSU; authorize to enter into a long-term lease for housing and retail purposes.
2635.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 1, Chapter 493, Laws Of 2016, Which Authorizes The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, Acting On Behalf Of Mississippi State University Of Agriculture And Applied Sciences, To Enter Into Lease And Sublease Of Property Located Thereon For The Purpose Of Developing Housing And Retail Space To Benefit The University; To Bring Forward Sections 2 And 3, Chapter 493, Laws Of 2016, Which Provide That The Term Of Such Leases Shall Not Exceed 40 Years And One Additional Option For A Renewal Period Not To Exceed 10 Years; To Bring Forward Section 4, Chapter 493, Laws Of 2016, Which Provides That Leases Or Subleases Entered Into By The Board Shall Be Protected From Actions Of Successor Boards Based On The Binding Successor Doctrine; And For Related Purposes.

2636.title: Dept. of Fin. & Admin.; include condition of roofs at universities, community/junior colleges in capital needs report.
2636.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-11-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Finance And Administration To Include In Its Annual Study Of Capital Needs The Condition And Rating Of All Roofs At Each University, Community College And Junior College; To Provide That Each Roof Must Be Inspected Every Three Years; To Provide That Any Request For New Construction Shall Also Identify Sources Of Nonstate Funds To Support Such Project As Well As Proposed Sources Of Funds For Future Operating, Repair And Renovation Costs; And For Related Purposes.

2637.title: Delta State University property; authorize lease of certain parcel in Bolivar County.
2637.description: An Act To Authorize Delta State University, With The Approval Of The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning, To Lease A Certain Portion Of Its Property That Is Located In The City Of Cleveland, Mississippi, For A Term Of No More Than 40 Years; And For Related Purposes.

2638.title: Fire insurance rating systems; require certain standard for classification of property located outside a municipality.
2638.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-2-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Property Located Outside A Municipality Shall Be Classified With The Same Fire Grading Classification As Property In The Fire Station District That Has The Closest Geographic Location; And For Related Purposes.

2639.title: Youth court; parents may review the youth court records of the parent's child.
2639.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-261, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Parents May Review The Youth Court Records Of The Parent's Child; And For Related Purposes.

2642.title: Equine riders; require helmet for certain minors on incremental basis.
2642.description: An Act To Greatly Improve The Safety Of Mississippi Child Horseback Riders By Requiring Them To Wear Approved Equestrian Safety Helmets When Riding Upon Certain Public Property; To Provide For Incremental Implementation; And For Related Purposes.

2643.title: Cooperatives; provide for the incorporation of.
2643.description: An Act To Provide For The Incorporation Of Cooperative Associations; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Requisites For The Articles Of Association Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Adoption Of Bylaws By Cooperatives; To Specify The Membership Of Cooperatives And The Requisites For Voting By Members; To Provide For The Organization Of Meetings And The Notification Of Members Of Meetings; To Provide For The Authorization To, Control And Use Of Stock By Cooperatives; To Provide For The Number, Election And Removal Of Directors; To Provide For The Meetings Of Directors; To Authorize Executive Committees; To Provide For The Officers Of Cooperatives; To Provide For The Compensation And Benefits To Directors, Officers And Employees Of A Cooperative; To Provide For The Liability Of Directors, Members, Stockholders And Patrons Of Cooperatives; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Dispose Of Assets; To Provide Rules That Govern Contracts By Cooperatives; To Provide That The Directors Shall Determine And Distribute Net Assets At Least Once Annually; To Provide For Annual Reports; To Provide The Manner In Which Articles Of Association May Be Amended; To Provide The Manner In Which Cooperatives May Merge And Consolidate; To Provide The Manner In Which A Cooperative May Voluntarily Dissolve Itself; To Limit The Use Of The Term "cooperative" To Associations Organized Under This Act And To Provide Penalties For Improper Use Of Such Term; To Provide For Administrative Dissolution; To Amend Section 79-35-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2644.title: Domestic abuse; allow protection of pets in a protective order.
2644.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-21-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions In The Protection From Domestic Abuse Act; To Amend Section 93-21-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Court, In Issuing A Protective Order, To Include The Protection Of Pets In The Order; And For Related Purposes.

2645.title: Deposit of state agency special funds into the State General Fund; make technical amendments.
2645.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize State Agencies To Charge Each Other For Services If Federal Grants, Pass-through Funds, Cost Allocation Charges, Surplus Property Charges Or Project Fees Are Involved; To Amend Section 27-104-205, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Certain Special Funds Shall Be Exempt From The Requirement That All Special Funds Are To Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Amend Sections 7-3-59, 23-15-169.7, 23-15-5 And 79-29-1203, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The End Of Year Balance Of The Help Mississippi Vote Fund And The Elections Support Fund Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund And The Program Shall Be Administered From Appropriations From The State General Fund; To Amend Section 7-5-305, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Insurance Integrity Enforcement Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Sections 9-11-35 And 21-23-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Mississippi Department Of Revenue Shall Administer The Justice Court Collections Payment Program And The Municipal Court Collections Payment Program; To Delete The Justice Court Collections Special Fund; To Delete The Municipal Court Collections Special Fund; To Amend Section 11-46-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Tort Claims Board Shall Be Exempt From The Requirement That Special Funds Are To Be Deposited Into The State General Fund And From The Prohibition Against Charging Fees; To Amend Sections 25-31-41 And 99-19-72, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The District Attorneys Operation Fund Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund And The Expenses Of The District Attorneys Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund; To Amend Sections 27-19-99 And 27-19-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That License Plates And Decal Fees Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Amend Section 27-19-179, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Department Of Revenue License Tag Acquisition Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 27-104-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Revenue From The Statewide Cost Allocation (swca) Plan Shall Only Be Used By The Department Of Finance And Administration For The Maintenance Of State-owned Property; To Amend Section 29-1-95, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Proceeds From Tax Sales In The Land Records Maintenance Fund Administered By The Secretary Of State Used To Pay Taxes Due To Local Governmental Entities Shall Be Exempt From The Requirement That All Special Funds Are To Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Amend Section 29-1-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Effective July 1, 2017, Public Trust Tidelands Leases Shall Be Negotiated By The Executive Director Of The Mississippi Department Of Marine Resources And Executed By The President Of The Board Of Supervisors Of The County In Which The Tidelands Is Located And The Secretary Of State May Assist In The Management Of Such Lands On Request; To Amend Section 29-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Public Trust Tidelands Fund Shall Be Administered By The Mississippi Commission On Marine Resources To Be Expended On The Mississippi Gulf Coast As Provided By Law; To Amend Section 29-15-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer The Public Trust Tidelands Assessment Fund To The Public Trust Tidelands Fund; To Amend Sections 37-26-3 And 37-26-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The State Court Education Fund And The State Prosecutor Education Fund And The State Court Constituents Fund And The State Court Security Systems Fund Programs Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 37-26-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Children's Advocacy Centers Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 43-19-61, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Legal Division Of The Child Support Unit Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer And To Delete Reference To Certain Trust Funds; To Amend Section 43-47-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Vulnerable Persons Unit Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 45-2-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Law Enforcement Officers And Firefighters Disabilities Benefits Fund Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 45-6-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Motorcycle Officers Training Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 53-1-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Emergency Plugging Program And The Oil And Gas Conservation Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 27-103-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Individual Project Cap On Expenditures From The Capital Expense Fund; To Amend Section 71-3-73, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Year-end Balance Of The Second Injury Fund Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund; To Amend Sections 73-31-7, 73-75-11 And 73-75-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Effective July 1, 2018, The Mississippi Autism Board Be Assigned To The State Board Of Psychology For Administrative Support, And To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Behavior Analyst Licensure Law Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 75-57-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Propane Education And Research Fund Shall Be Diverted Into The State General Fund And The Program Shall Be Administered By Appropriation From The State General Fund; To Amend Section 75-63-81, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Preneed Contracts Loss Recovery Fund Shall Be Exempt From The Requirement That Special Funds Be Diverted Into The State General Fund And To Provide That No Such Funds May Be Used In The Administration Of This Program; To Amend Section 77-1-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Public Service Commission Regulation Fund Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 77-3-87, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Amount Of The Public Utilities Regulatory Assessment Shall Not Exceed The Total Legislative Appropriation And That The Proceeds Of Such Assessment Shall Be Deposited Into The State Treasury For The Credit Of The General Fund; To Amend Section 77-3-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Mississippi Telephone Solicitation Regulation Fund Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 93-21-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Domestic Violence Division Of The Office Of Attorney General Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 97-3-54.8, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Relief For Victims Of Human Trafficking Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 97-33-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Charitable Bingo Fund Shall Be Diverted Into The State General Fund And The Charitable Bingo Law Shall Be Administered By Appropriation From The State General Fund; To Amend Section 97-45-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Attorney General's Cyber Crime Central Special Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Section 99-41-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Expenses Of The Crime Victims Compensation Fund Program Shall Be Defrayed By Appropriation From The State General Fund And All Fees Authorized Under This Program Shall Be Deposited Into The State General Fund As Determined By The State Fiscal Officer; To Amend Chapter 25, Laws Of 2016 (senate Bill No. 2916), To Revise The Appropriation To The Office Of Secretary Of State For Fiscal Year 2017; And For Related Purposes.

2646.title: Surplus lines insurance; allow placement without determining availability from admitted insurers.
2646.description: An Act To Amend Sections 83-21-19 And 83-21-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Permit Placement Of Insurance With A Surplus Lines Insurer Without Regard To The Availability Of Authorized Insurance; To Require An Informational Notice Be Provided By The Surplus Lines Insurance Producer To The Insured Regarding Placement Of Personal Lines Policies With Surplus Lines Insurers; And For Related Purposes.

2647.title: Life insurance policies; require insurers to add to policy proceeds a refund of any unearned premium actually paid.
2647.description: An Act To Require All Life Insurance Policies Delivered Or Issued For Delivery In This State To Require An Insurer To Add To The Policy Proceeds A Refund Of Any Premium Actually Paid For Any Period Beyond The Date In Which The Death Of The Insured Occurs; And For Related Purposes.

2648.title: Court reporter; may be hired to record court proceeding.
2648.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-13-32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Authority To Cause A Proceeding To Be Recorded Where An Official Court Reporter Is Not Provided; And For Related Purposes.

2649.title: Nonpublic schools accredited by certain agencies; authorize students to transfer course credit and grades.
2649.description: An Act To Amend Sections 37-17-7 And 37-15-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Grades And Coursework Completed By Elementary And Secondary Students Attending Nonpublic Schools Accredited By Certain Recognized Accrediting Agencies Shall Be Accepted For Credit At Any Mississippi Public School, Mississippi Community Or Junior College Or Mississippi Public University; And For Related Purposes.

2650.title: Homeowners associations; regulate the formation and legal administration of.
2650.description: An Act To Provide For The Formation And Legal Administration Of Homeowners Associations; To Enact Definitions; To Provide For Membership And Organization Of Associations; To Provide Guidelines For Developers Retaining An Interest; To Specify The Association Formation And Powers; To Establish A Standard Of Care Of A Board Of Directors In The Performance Of Its Duties; To Invalidate Unconstitutional Restrictions In Governing Documents; To Provide For Bylaws; To Create Developer Liability For Misappropriation Of Association Funds; To Create A Lien For Unpaid Assessments; And For Related Purposes.

2651.title: IHL; must allocate funding for nonresident students to student financial aid programs.
2651.description: An Act To Provide That The Funding Allocation Model Employed By The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning Must Weight Nonresident Completed Credit Hours Based On The Percentage Of Nonresident Enrollment At Each Institution; To Establish Appropriate Weighting For Nonresident Credit Hour Completion; To Provide That The Difference In Funds Between The Board's 2013 Performance Allocation Funding Allocation Model And The Model With Appropriate Weighting Shall Be Set Aside To Fund Grant Awards Under The Higher Education Legislative Plan Grant Program; To Amend Sections 37-101-15 And 37-106-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2652.title: Lobbying; contract lobbyist not to be compensated with public funds.
2652.description: An Act To Create Section 5-8-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define Certain Terms And To Prohibit State Agencies From Expending Public Funds To Pay Contract Lobbyists; And For Related Purposes.

2653.title: Autopsies; Medical Examiner may enter into contracts with medical schools to perform.
2653.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-61-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State Medical Examiner May Enter Into Contracts With Accredited Medical Schools To Perform Certain Autopsies Under Certain Conditions; To Bring Forward Sections 41-61-55, 41-61-59, 41-61-61 And 41-61-65, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendments To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2654.title: BP Settlement Funds; transfer into Gulf Coast New Restoration Reserve Fund.
2654.description: An Act To Create The Gulf Coast Restoration Reserve Fund In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Funding Projects Primarily Benefiting The Mississippi Gulf Coast From Funds Paid To The State For Economic Damages In Connection With The 2010 Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill; To Provide For The Transfer Of Such Funds From The Budget Contingency Fund; To Amend Section 27-103-302, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2655.title: Public purchasing; require public entities to provide option to electronically submit bids for public works.
2655.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require State Agencies And Governing Authorities To Provide, As An Additional Bidding Option, A Uniform And Secure Electronic Interactive System For The Submittal Of Bids For Purchases Requiring Competitive Bidding; And For Related Purposes.

2656.title: Vaccination required for school attendance; authorize exemption upon objection of parent on parental or philosophical grounds.
2656.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-23-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Child Will Be Exempt From The Requirement To Have Any Specific Vaccination In Order To Attend A School If The Child's Parent Or Guardian Submits To The School A Letter Or Affidavit That Documents Which Required Vaccinations Have Been Given, And Which Vaccinations Have Not Been Given On The Basis That They Are Contrary To His Or Her Philosophical Or Religious Beliefs; To Prescribe The Content To Be Included In The Letter Or Affidavit Submitted To The School District Or School Of Enrollment; And For Related Purposes.

2657.title: Environmental Protection; restrict use of certain chemicals in food and food packaging.
2657.description: An Act To Regulate The Use Of Certain Chemicals In Food Products And Food Packaging; To Restrict The Use Of Bisphenol A (bpa) In Food Packaging; To Require Labeling Of Products With Bisphenol A; To Provide Appropriate Information To Consumers About Potentially Harmful Toxicants In Foods; To Provide A Civil Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2658.title: Transportation network companies; regulate taxis.
2658.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-8-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Municipalities To Impose Similar Taxes, Fees, Licenses And Insurance Requirements On Transportation Network Companies That Are Imposed On Taxi Companies; And For Related Purposes.

2659.title: Quitman County property; authorize transfer of certain parcel of to the Mayor and Board of Aldermen of the City of Marks.
2659.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Transportation Commission To Transfer And Convey A Certain Parcel Of Property Located In Quitman County, Mississippi, To The Mayor And The Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Marks; And For Related Purposes.

2661.title: Lobbying; contract lobbyist not to be compensated with state funds.
2661.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That State-appropriated Funds May Not Be Used To Compensate A Contract Lobbyist; And For Related Purposes.

2662.title: State agency budget information to be submitted to LBO & posted on website; include MOE/MOU agreements & fed. contract information.
2662.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-103-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Each State Agency To Include A Summary Of Any Maintenance Of Effort (moe) Or Memoranda Of Understanding (mou) Agreements Or Contracts Entered Into With Any Federal Agency With Its Annual Budget Request Presentation To The Legislative Budget Office; And For Related Purposes.

2663.title: Agency Accountability Review Act of 2017; create.
2663.description: An Act To Create The "agency Accountability Review Act Of 2017"; To Require The Peer Committee To Establish An Accountability Review Schedule Designating A Certain Number Of Agencies To Be Reviewed Every Year, Beginning In 2018, With Every State Agency To Be Reviewed Once Every 10 Years; To Require Peer Committee To Submit A Report With Recommendations; To Provide For The Scope Of Review And The Content Of The Report; To Require Agencies To Submit Certain Information To Peer Before The Review; To Provide Exemptions; And For Related Purposes.

2664.title: Mental illness; commitment for certain persons with pending felony charges.
2664.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-21-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Prohibition That A Chancellor May Not Commit A Person Who Has Unresolved Felony Charges Pending; And For Related Purposes.

2665.title: State vehicles; impose moratorium on the acquisition of.
2665.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-1-78, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose A Moratorium On The Purchase, Lease Or Acquisition Of Motor Vehicles By State Agencies; To Provide Exemptions; And For Related Purposes.

2666.title: Wildlife; revise requirements for deer depredation permits.
2666.description: An Act To Create New Section 49-7-31.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Recodify And Revise Requirements For Deer Depredation Permits; To Amend Section 49-7-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2667.title: Agriculture; revise membership of the Mississippi Board of Animal Health and meeting date requirements.
2667.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-15-2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership Of The Mississippi Board Of Animal Health; To Amend Section 69-15-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Meeting Date Requirements Of The Board; And For Related Purposes.

2668.title: Highways; person may cross a public road or highway on an all-terrain vehicle.
2668.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-31-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow Person On An All-terrain Vehicle To Cross Public Roads And Highways In This State; And For Related Purposes.

2669.title: State budget; provide for certain transfers.
2669.description: An Act To Amend Sections 27-103-125, 27-103-139, 27-103-203 And 27-103-211, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Relate To Various Aspects Of The Budget Process; To Amend Section 41-113-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Office Of Tobacco Control In The State Department Of Health To Fund Mississippi Quality Health Center Amounts; To Amend Section 41-113-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Any Funds Appropriated From The Tobacco Control Program Fund That Are Unexpended At The End Of Fiscal Year 2017 Shall Lapse Into The Health Care Expendable Fund; To Make Certain Transfers To The Capital Expense Fund; To Amend Section 1 Of Chapter 61, Laws Of 2016, To Change The General Fund Amount For The Department Of Insurance; To Amend Section 1 Of Chapter 62, Laws Of 2016, To Change The General Fund Amount For The State Fire Academy And To Reappropriate General Funds For Fiscal Year 2018; To Amend Section 3 Of Chapter 74, Laws Of 2016, To Transfer Certain Amounts In The Fiscal Year 2017 Appropriation To The Department Of Public Safety Among Various Categories; And For Related Purposes.

2670.title: Environmental Protection; bring forward section 19-5-21 for purpose of amending to clarify ad valorem taxes and fees on garbage.
2670.description: An Act To Bring Forward Section 19-5-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For The Purpose Of Amendment To Clarify The Use Of Ad Valorem Taxes And Fees For The Collection Of Garbage; And For Related Purposes.

2671.title: Wildlife; clarify that a conservation officer must have probable cause to conduct a search without warrant.
2671.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That A Conservation Officer Must Have Probable Cause To Conduct A Search Without Warrant; And For Related Purposes.

2672.title: Sentencing; court may consider mental health issues.
2672.description: An Act To Provide That Any Circuit Or County Court May Utilize The Mental Health Records Of A Defendant For A Sentencing Hearing; To Provide A Definition For Mental Health Records; And For Related Purposes.

2673.title: Highways; authorize MDOT law enforcement officers or contractors to enforce work zones prohibition.
2673.description: An Act To Create The "senator Kelvin Butler Act"; To Authorize Payment For The Enforcement Of Traffic Laws In Work Zones; To Authorize Mdot Officers To Enforce Traffic Laws; And For Related Purposes.

2674.title: Supporting and Strengthening Families Act; revise.
2674.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-31-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Amend The Supporting And Strengthening Families Act To Require Filing In Youth Court Of The Temporary Power Of Attorney; To Prohibit Certain Persons From Being Designated Attorney-in-fact Based On Criminal History; To Provide That No Filing Fee, Attorney Or Court Review Is Required; To Require Scanning Into Mycids; To Amend Section 93-31-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Revisions To The Statutory Form; To Create A Form For Revocation; And For Related Purposes.

2675.title: Health insurance policies; require coverage of infertility treatment and diagnosis.
2675.description: An Act To Require Health Insurance Policies Which Provide Pregnancy Related Benefits To Provide Coverage For Medically Necessary Expenses Of Diagnosis And Treatment Of Infertility; And For Related Purposes.

2676.title: Mississippi Minimum Wage Act; establish.
2676.description: An Act To Enact A Minimum Wage Law For The State Of Mississippi, With Annual Incremental Increases Over A Three-year Period; To Define Employers And Employees Subject To The Minimum Wage Law; To Empower The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security, Office Of The Governor, To Enforce And Administer The Provisions Of The Minimum Wage Law; To Provide Criminal Penalties And A Civil Cause Of Action Against Employers For Violations Of The Minimum Wage Law; To Amend Section 17-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Municipal And County Governing Authorities, In Their Discretion, To Mandate A Wage That Is More Than The State Minimum Wage; To Amend Section 25-3-40, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2677.title: Consigned motor fuel; unlawful to take, use, sell, divert, appropriate or dispose of without consent of the consignee.
2677.description: An Act To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Take, Use, Sell, Divert, Appropriate Or Dispose Of Consigned Motor Fuel Without The Consent Of The Consignor; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Take, Use, Sell, Divert, Appropriate Or Dispose Of The Proceeds Generated From The Sale Of Consigned Motor Fuels Without The Consent Of The Consignor; To Provide That Violations Shall Be Considered Grand Or Petit Larceny Depending On The Value Of The Property Taken, Used, Sold, Diverted, Appropriated Or Disposed Of; And For Related Purposes.

2678.title: City of Jackson; require payments in lieu of taxes on state-owned property located in the city.
2678.description: An Act To Require The State Of Mississippi To Provide Funds To The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, As Payment In Lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes For The Purpose Of Assisting The City To Defray The Ad Valorem Tax Loss The City Sustains As A Result Of State Ownership Of Property In The City And To Defray Certain Costs The City Incurs As A Result Of Being The Seat Of Government; To Provide That The Amount Of The Annual Payment Shall Be Equal To 50% Of The Ad Valorem Tax Revenue That Would Be Due Each Calendar Year On All State-owned Property Within The City Limits Of Jackson If The Property Were Not Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation; To Provide The Purposes For Which The Funds May Be Used; And For Related Purposes.

2679.title: Alcoholic beverages; authorize the sale of wine at retail food stores.
2679.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "retail Food Store"; To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Issue Retail Food Store Wine Only Retailer's Permit That Authorizes The Holder Thereof To Sell Wine At Retail At A Retail Food Store In Original Sealed And Unopened, Packages Not To Be Consumed On The Premises Where Sold; To Provide That The Holder Of A Package Retailer's Permit May Sell Other Products And Merchandise, Except Beer, But Must Derive At Least Fifty Percent Of The Revenue Of The Licensed Premises From The Retail Sale Of Alcoholic Beverages In Original Sealed And Unopened Packages Not To Be Consumed On The Licensed Premises; To Authorize A Person To Own Or Control Any Interest In More Than Six Package Retailer's Permits; To Amend Section 27-71-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The License Tax Required For Retail Food Store Wine Only Retailer's Permits; To Amend Sections 67-1-41, 67-1-75, 67-1-83 And 67-1-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2680.title: Motor vehicles; it is lawful to sell a motor vehicle not titled in the seller's name using the abandonment process.
2680.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-17-74, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Except From The Provision That Makes It Unlawful For A Person To Sell A Motor Vehicle That Is Not Licensed In Such Person's Name, A Person Selling An Abandoned Motor Vehicle Under Sections 63-21-1, Et Seq.; And For Related Purposes.

2681.title: Environmental justice; require meaningful involvement of all people in siting process.
2681.description: An Act To Require The Fair Treatment And Meaningful Involvement Of All People Regardless Of Race, Color, National Origin Or Income With Regard To The Development And Enforcement Of Environmental Laws And The Siting Of Certain Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

2683.title: Building Officials and Inspectors Registration Act; create.
2683.description: An Act To Create The "building Officials And Inspectors Registration Act"; To Define Terms Used In The Act; To Regulate And Register Building Officials, Plan Reviewers, Building Inspectors, Electrical Inspectors, Mechanical Inspectors And Plumbing Inspectors; To Prescribe The Powers And Duties Of The Commissioner Of Insurance; To Create A Building Officials Advisory Board; To Require The Approval Of Educational And Training Programs For Building Officials, Plan Reviewers And Inspectors; To Establish Fees; To Provide For The Promulgation Of Rules And Regulations; To Prescribe Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2684.title: Marine Resources; require a nonresident to meet licensing requirements before receiving a Mississippi commercial fishing license.
2684.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That If A Nonresident's Domicile State Has Mandatory Licensing Requirements Then The Nonresident Must Meet Those Requirements Before Receiving A Mississippi Nonresident Commercial Fishing License; And For Related Purposes.

2685.title: Wildlife; require the Department of Wildlife, Fisheries and Parks to identify existing and needed wildlife corridors.
2685.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, In Conjunction With The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, To Identify Existing And Needed Wildlife Corridors; To File A Report And Recommendations; And For Related Purposes.

2686.title: Mining; Local ordinances and regulations shall not supersede mining permits issued by Department of Environmental Quality.
2686.description: An Act To Amend Section 17-1-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Local Zoning Ordinances And Regulations Do Not Supersede Mining Permits Issued By The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; And For Related Purposes.

2687.title: Marine Resources; increase the oyster shell retention fee.
2687.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Oyster Shell Retention Fee; To Clarify Reciprocity Agreements; And For Related Purposes.

2688.title: Agriculture; revise country of origin labeling for certain ground meats.
2688.description: An Act To Amend Section 69-1-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Country Of Origin Labeling For Certain Ground Meats; And For Related Purposes.

2689.title: Outdoor advertisement signs; revise height requirement on those erected after April 15, 2008.
2689.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-23-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Height Requirements Allowable For Outdoor Advertising Signs Erected After April 15, 2008, To Provide That Such Signs Shall Not Exceed 40 Feet In Height; To Bring Forward Sections 49-23-5 And 49-23-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purpose Of Possible Amendments; And For Related Purposes.

2690.title: Public Trust Tidelands Transparency and Accountability Act; enact.
2690.description: An Act To Be Known As The "public Trust Tidelands Transparency And Accountability Act"; To Create Section 29-15-24, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Secretary Of State To Provide Transparency And Detailed Accountability In Administering And Accounting For The Public Trust Tidelands Fund And The Public Trust Tidelands Assessments Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2691.title: Agricultural leases on prison lands and wildlife management lands; revise leasing authority and advertising requirements.
2691.description: An Act To Amend Sections 47-5-64 And 47-5-66, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Department Of Corrections, Subject To The Concurrence Of The Department Of Finance And Administration, Is Authorized To Lease For Agricultural Purposes Prison Lands To Private Entities, And To Revise Advertising Requirements Therefor; To Amend Section 49-5-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, Subject To The Concurrence Of The Department Of Finance And Administration, Is Authorized To Lease For Agricultural Purposes Wildlife Management Lands To Private Entities, And To Revise Advertising Requirements Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2692.title: Secretary of State to donate certain submerged lands to National Park Service; authorize.
2692.description: An Act To Authorize The Secretary Of State To Donate Certain Submerged Lands Located In Jackson County, Mississippi, To The National Park Service; And For Related Purposes.

2693.title: Guardian ad litem fees; create panel to study.
2693.description: An Act To Create The Guardian Ad Litem Transparency And Oversight Panel; To Prescribe The Membership Of The Panel; To Require Reporting Of Information To The Administrative Office Of Courts By Chancery Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

2694.title: Hate crimes; include law enforcement officers, firefighters and emergency medical personnel.
2694.description: An Act To Amend Sections 99-19-301, 99-19-305 And 99-19-307, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Law Enforcement Officers, Firefighters And Emergency Medical Personnel In The Class Of Victims Where Offenses Are Subject To Hate Crime Penalties; And For Related Purposes.

2695.title: Mississippi Gulf Coast Economic Restoration Trust; create.
2695.description: An Act To Create A Public Body Corporate And Politic To Be Designated As The Mississippi Gulf Coast Economic Restoration Trust, Which Is Designed To Be A Pilot Project For Creation Of A Perpetual Trust; To Provide That $25,000,000.00 Of The Funds Received From The Bp Economic Damages Settlement Agreement Be Appropriated To The Mississippi Gulf Coast Economic Restoration Trust; To Provide For A Board Of Trustees To Serve As The Governing Body Of The Mississippi Gulf Coast Economic Restoration Trust; To Provide For The Composition And Powers Of The Board Of Trustees; To Require That The Board Of Trustees Establish Criteria And Rules For Application For And Investment Of Funds For Economic Development Projects Of Regional Significance To Create New Permanent Jobs And Expansion Of Sales And Income Tax Receipts For The State Treasury And Sales And Property Tax Receipts For Municipalities, Counties And School Districts; To Provide That The Board Of Trustees May Contract With The Mississippi Department Of Marine Resources For Certain Administrative Services; To Provide For An Economic Recovery Advisory Board; And For Other Purposes.

2696.title: Mississippi Higher Education Grant Program for Single Mothers; establish.
2696.description: An Act To Establish A Mississippi Higher Education Grant Program For Single Mothers To Provide Financial Aid To Complete Two- And Four-year Degrees At Public Colleges And Universities Administered By The Postsecondary Education Financial Assistance Bill; And For Related Purposes.

2697.title: Youth court; revise jurisdiction of for certain cases involving juveniles in possession of firearms.
2697.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-159, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Jurisdiction Of Youth Courts With Respect To Certain Cases Involving Possession Of A Firearm By A Juvenile; And For Related Purposes.

2698.title: Referendum; authorize to determine voter preferences regarding tax increase for infrastructure improvements.
2698.description: An Act To Provide That At The General Election In November, 2019, Voters May Express Their Preference Regarding The Continued Increase In Motor Fuel Excise Taxes And Sales Taxes To Fund Infrastructure Improvements; And For Related Purposes.

2700.title: Abused and neglected children; clarify alternative of relative care.
2700.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-15-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Relative Care Is A Legal Placement Option For Abused And Neglected Children; To Amend Section 43-15-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform References To Child Protection Services; To Amend Section 43-21-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions In The Youth Court Act Concerning Fictive Kin, Durable Legal Relative Guardianship, And Reasonable Efforts; To Amend Section 43-21-609, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Giving Custody To A Relative And Waiving Any Requirement For The Relative To Participate In Foster Parent Training Is Within The Discretion Of The Court And To Create A Durable Legal Relative Guardianship Alternative; To Amend Section 43-21-613, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 93-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Status Of Spousal Domestic Abuse As A Fault Ground For Divorce; To Amend Section 93-17-303, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Right Of Adoptive Parents, Under Certain Circumstances, To Proceed Pro Se In The Matter Of Registration Of A Foreign Adoption; And For Related Purposes.

2701.title: Elections; authorize procedures to promote full investigation and detection of election law violations.
2701.description: An Act To Amend Section 23-15-165, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Registrars To Designate Which Party Primary Election A Voter Participates In After Each Such Election; To Remove Date Of Birth And Age Information From The List Of Items Exempt From Disclosure Under The Mississippi Public Records Act Of 1983; To Amend Section 23-15-911, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Length Of Time Within Which A Candidate May Examine The Ballot Box; To Clarify That The Period Of Time Within Which The Ballot Boxes May Be Examined Commences Upon Certification By The State Executive Committee;
