To Provide That Notice Of A Candidate's Intent To Examine The Ballot Boxes Shall Be Served Upon The Circuit Clerk; To Provide That The Circuit Clerk Shall Post The Notice In A Public Place And Mail The Notice To Any Opposing Candidate; To Permit Persons Conducting The Examination To Copy The Contents Of The Ballot Box, Pollbooks And Any Other Election Records; To Require Circuit Clerks To Preserve Ballot Boxes And Their Contents For Certain Periods Of Time; To Amend Section 97-13-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Person Who Votes Or Attempts To Vote In The Run-off Primary Election Of One Party When He Has Voted In The Primary Election Of Another Party Within The Previous 21 Days Shall Be Guilty Of A Misdemeanor; To Amend Section 23-15-575, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That No Person Shall Vote In The Primary Or Run-off Primary Election Of One Party If He Has Voted In The Primary Or Run-off Primary Election Of Another Party Within The Previous 60 Days; To Amend Section 23-15-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Primary Election Pollbooks To Be Prepared Before Any Primary Or Run-off Primary Election; To Provide That These Pollbooks Designate Which Party Primary Election The Voter Has Participated In Within The Previous 60 Days; To Create Section 23-15-614, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Municipal And Circuit Clerks To Enter Into The Statewide Elections Management System A Voter's History Of Participating In Any Election Within 30 Days After The Election But Before Preparing Any Subsequent Pollbooks; To Amend Sections 23-15-597, 23-15-599 And 23-15-611, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Deadlines For The Certification Of Election Results; To Amend Sections 23-15-171, 23-15-191, 23-15-213, 23-15-833, 23-15-857, 23-15-981, 23-15-1031 And 23-15-1083, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Second Primary Election, If Any, Shall Occur Four Weeks After The First Primary Election; To Amend Section 23-15-921, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Deadline For Filing Certain Election Contests To 30 Days After Certification Of The Election; To Amend Section 23-15-923, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Petition To Contest Certain Other Elections Shall Be Filed Within 30 Days After Certification Of Those Elections; To Amend Sections 23-15-927 And 23-15-951, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Deadline For Requesting Judicial Review Of An Election Contest To 30 Days After The Certification Of The Election And To Provide That Certain Election Contests Shall Be Tried Without A Jury; To Amend Section 23-15-961, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Qualifications Of A Party Nominee May Be Challenged After His Nomination But Before A General Election; And For Related Purposes.

2702.title: Open container; prohibit.
2702.description: An Act To Create New Section 63-3-1217, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Consumption Of Alcohol And The Possession Of An Open Container Of Alcohol While Operating A Vehicle; And For Related Purposes.

2703.title: Marine Resources; revise waters closed to shrimping.
2703.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-64.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Waters Closed To Shrimping; And For Related Purposes.

2704.title: Divorce and alimony; require financial disclosure and equitable distribution.
2704.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Financial Disclosure And Equitable Distribution In Cases Of Divorce And Alimony Or Separate Maintenance; And For Related Purposes.

2705.title: DUI; technical correction bill.
2705.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Secure, Online Access To Nonadjudication Records For Judges, Clerks And Prosecutors; To Require Dui Defendants To Reveal Prior Dui History When Pleading Guilty; To Amend Section 63-11-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Duty Of The Trial Court Clerk To Submit Disposition Information In A Timely Fashion; To Amend Section 1, Chapter 457, Laws Of 2016, To Extend The Existence Of The Dui Information-exchange Improvement Advisory Committee For One Year, To Revise The Membership Thereof, And To Require An Additional Annual Report From The Committee; To Amend Section 2, Chapter 457, Laws Of 2016, To Extend The Due Date Of The Report To Be Made By The Mandatory Statewide Offense-reporting System Task Force And To Make Certain Technical Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

2706.title: Sixteenth Section School Land Principal Fund; authorize school districts to invest in Mississippi g.o. or municipal bonds.
2706.description: An Act To Amend Section 29-3-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize School Districts To Invest Sixteenth Section School Land Principal Funds In Mississippi General Obligation Or Municipal Bonds; And For Related Purposes.

2707.title: Absentee voting; may be conducted by voting machine if clerk and board of supervisors approve.
2707.description: An Act To Authorize Boards Of Supervisors And Circuit Clerks Or County Registrars To Approve The Use Of Direct Recording Electronic Voting Units And Optical Mark Reading Equipment For Absentee Voting; And For Related Purposes.

2708.title: Income tax; public hospitals & private nonprofit hospitals may collect certain debts by setoff against debtor's refund.
2708.description: An Act To Authorize A Procedure To Allow Public Hospitals And Private Nonprofit Hospitals To Collect Certain Debts Through A Setoff Against Income Tax Refunds Owed The Debtor; To Provide For Hearing And Appeals In Contested Cases; To Provide That Such Hearing And Appeals Shall Only Consider Mistakes Of Fact; To Authorize The Department Of Revenue To Transfer The Income Tax Refunds Of A Debtor To A Claimant Hospital For The Purpose Of Satisfying Such Debts; To Amend Section 27-7-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2710.title: Birth certificate; adoptee may obtain certified copy of original after 40 years.
2710.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-17-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That An Adoptee May Obtain A Copy Of The Adoptee's Original Birth Certificate Once 40 Years Has Passed Since The Issuance Of A Revised Birth Certificate Following The Adoption; And For Related Purposes.

2711.title: Supporting and Strengthening Families Act; technical correction.
2711.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-31-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Supporting And Strengthening Families Act Requires Supervision By A Nongovernmental Organization That Participates In The Safe Families For Children Model; And For Related Purposes.

2712.title: Venue; clarify when defendants properly sued in different counties.
2712.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-46-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Venue As Against Two Or More Governmental Entity Defendants For Whom Venue Is Proper In Different Counties; To Amend Section 11-11-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Venue As Against Two Or More Health Care Provider Defendants For Whom Venue Is Proper In Different Counties For Wrongful Death; And For Related Purposes.

2713.title: Stolen property; when cause of action to recover accrues.
2713.description: An Act To Create New Section 15-1-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define When A Cause Of Action To Recover Stolen Personal Property Accrues; And For Related Purposes.

2714.title: Emergency displacement of children; require criminal background check.
2714.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Department Of Child Protective Services To Request That A Criminal Justice Agency Perform A Federal Name-based Criminal History Records Check Of Each Adult Residing In The Home During An Emergency Placement Situation When A Child Must Be Placed In Home Care Due To The Absence Of Parents Or Custodians; To Provide That Name-based Check Results May Be Provided To The Mississippi Criminal Information Center (mcic) Of The Department Of Public Safety, Which Shall Then Provide A Complete Set Of Each Adult Resident's Fingerprints To The Mcic Central Repository For The Immediate Submission To The Fbi Within 14 Calendar Days From The Date The Name Search Was Conducted; To Provide That The Central Repository Shall Either Positively Identify The Fingerprint Subject Or Forward The Fingerprints To The Fbi Within 14 Calendar Days From The Date The Name Search Was Conducted; And For Related Purposes.

2715.title: Release after arrest; sheriff or police chief to notify parent or guardian of minor.
2715.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-5-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Sheriff Or Chief Of Police To Notify The Parent Or Guardian Of Any Minor Upon Release From Detention On Any Form Of Recognizance; And For Related Purposes.

2716.title: Driving under the influence; revise computation of subsequent offenses and eligibility for nonadjudication.
2716.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Computation Of Subsequent Offenses And Eligibility For Nonadjudication In Charges Of Driving Under The Influence; And For Related Purposes.

2719.title: Fourth Circuit Court District; clarify precinct composition of subdistricts.
2719.description: An Act To Amend Section 9-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Update Precincts In The Fourth Circuit Court District; To Bring Forward Section 9-7-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Clarity; To Provide That Revised Precincts Are From The 2010 Census, But That Subdistrict Boundaries Conform To The 1990 Precincts As Required By Law; To Require The Standing Joint Legislative Committee On Reapportionment To Assist The Counties In Identifying The Boundaries Of Subdistricts; And For Related Purposes.

2721.title: Federal Affordable Care Act; require state agencies to make report on regulations.
2721.description: An Act To Direct Mississippi Agencies To Prepare A Report On The Federal Affordable Care Act Related Rules And Regulations; And For Related Purposes.

2723.title: Divorce; domestic violence as a ground for.
2723.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-5-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create Domestic Violence As Additional Grounds For Fault Divorce; And For Related Purposes.

2724.title: Circuit clerks; increase marriage license fee.
2724.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Marriage License Fee Charged By Circuit Clerks; And For Related Purposes.

2725.title: Alcoholic beverages; revise the definition of "qualified resort area" under the Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law.
2725.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "qualified Resort Area" Under The Local Option Alcoholic Beverage Control Law; And For Related Purposes.

2726.title: Phantom damages; restrict admissibility of evidence of.
2726.description: An Act To Define The Admissibility Of Medical Or Health Care Expenses During Trial; To Bring Forward Section 41-9-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Evidence Of Reasonableness Of Medical Expenses; And For Related Purposes.

2727.title: Absentee voting by mail; change notarization requirements for ballots submitted by certain college students.
2727.description: An Act To Remove The Requirement That A Full-time Student Of Any College, University Or Community/junior College Who Is Qualified To Vote Absentee By Mail Have His Or Her Ballot Envelope Notarized; To Provide That The Student Must Have His Or Her Ballot Envelope Witnessed And Signed By An Employee Of The Office Of The Registrar Of The University Or College Wherein The Student Is Enrolled; To Amend Sections 23-15-631 And 23-15-721, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2728.title: Expunction; revise for penalty enhancement.
2728.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-19-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Expunction Of Certain Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

2729.title: Tort Claims Board; revise memberships.
2729.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-46-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Each Member Of The Tort Claims Board To Designate Another Person To Attend Board Meetings; To Provide That If Any Member Of The Board Appoints A Designee To Attend Meetings Of The Board, The Chairman Of The Board Must Be Informed In Writing Of The Name And Contact Information Of The Designee; To Provide That The Designee Of Any Member Of The Board Is Able To Take All Action To Which The Person Designating Is Authorized To Under The Chapter; And For Related Purposes.

2730.title: Sanctuary cities; prohibit adoption or enactment of.
2730.description: An Act To Prohibit A State Agency, Department, Political Subdivision Of This State, County, Municipality, University, College, Community College Or Junior College, Or Any Agent, Employee Or Officer Thereof From Creating, Planning, Implementing, Assisting, Participating In, Or Enabling A Sanctuary Policy; To Provide That Any Sanctuary Policy Adopted In Violation Of This Act Shall Be Invalid And Void From The Date Of Its Adoption Or Enactment; And For Related Purposes.

2731.title: Civil actions; property and casualty insurers have burden of proof for exclusions in "all perils" coverage policy.
2731.description: An Act To Provide That, In Any Action For Damages By The Policyholder Against A Property And Casualty Insurer Under An "all Perils" Coverage Policy, The Insurer Has The Burden Of Proof As To The Application Of Any Exclusion In The Policy; And For Related Purposes.

2732.title: Alcoholic beverage; place restrictions on number of package retailer's permits issued and restrict locations; applicant must be resident.
2732.description: An Act To Amend Section 67-1-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That From And After July 1, 2017, Not More Than One Package Retailer's Permit May Be Issued Within The Corporate Limits Of A Municipality For Every 6,500 Residents Of The Municipality According To The Latest Federal Decennial Census; To Provide That Package Retailer's Permits That Were Issued Prior To July 1, 2017, Shall Remain In Effect Regardless Of Such Limit And May Be Sold Or Transferred By The Permittee To Any Other Qualified Applicant As Authorized By Law; To Provide That From And After The Effective Date Of This Act, A Package Retailer's Permit Shall Not Be Issued For A Location That Is Within Two Miles Of The Property Boundary Of An Existing Package Store Or, If The Package Store Is Located In A Mall Or Shopping Center, Within Two Miles Of The Property Boundary Of The Mall Or Shopping Center; However, A Package Retailer Permit May Be Issued For A Location Within The Two-mile Limit If A Written Waiver Is Obtained From All Holders Of Package Retail Permits Who Operate Package Stores Within Two Miles Of The Proposed Location; To Amend Section 67-1-57, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Applicants For A Package Retailer's Permit Must Have Been A Bona Fide Resident Of The State For One Year Immediately Prior To Prior To The Date Of Application; And For Related Purposes.

2733.title: University of Mississippi Medical Center; authorize remains in the potter's field on its property to be cremated.
2733.description: An Act To Authorize The University Of Mississippi Medical Center To Disinter, Remove, Cremate And Reinter Human Remains Reposing In The Potter's Field On The Property Of The Medical Center To A Different Location On The Medical Center's Property; To Repeal Section 2, Chapter 846, Local And Private Laws Of 1973, As Amended By Chapter 854, Laws Of 1974, Which Authorizes The University Of Mississippi Medical Center To Take Certain Actions Regarding Human Remains In The Potter's Field On Its Property; And For Related Purposes.

2735.title: Elections; impose 2-year residency requirement to run for certain offices.
2735.description: An Act To Provide That A Candidate For Public Office Shall Be A Resident Of The Municipality, County, County District Or State District That He Or She Seeks To Serve In Such Public Office For A Certain Number Of Years Before The Day Of Election; To Amend Sections 65-1-3, 25-31-1 And 69-1-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2736.title: Postsecondary Education Financial Assistance; establish priority of funding for certain programs.
2736.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Funding Of The Higher Education Legislative Grant Program, Mississippi Resident Tuition Assistance Grant Program And Mississippi Eminent Scholars Grant Program Through One Appropriation For Fiscal Year 2018 And One Appropriation To The Postsecondary Education Financial Assistance Trust Fund For Fiscal Year 2019; To Provide That Award Offers On Student Financial Assistance Programs Shall Require A Commitment To Fund Such Offers For The Full Academic Year; To Amend Section 37-106-14, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Priority Funding For The Higher Education Legislative Grant Program; To Amend Section 37-106-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Use Of The Postsecondary Education Financial Assistance Trust Fund For Administrative Expenses; To Amend Section 27-104-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Mid-year Reduction Or Proration Of Awards Under The Higher Education Legislative Grant Program; And For Related Purposes.

2737.title: E-citation; authorize surcharge to fund statewide usage of system.
2737.description: An Act To Authorize The Board On Law Enforcement Officer Standards And Training To Issue A Request For Proposals For The Automating Of Citations Issued By County And Municipal Law Enforcement Officer And The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District Patrol; To Amend Section 63-9-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize County And Municipal Law Enforcement Officers And The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District Patrol To Assess An Additional Five Dollar Surcharge For The Purposes Of Defraying The Expenses Of Automating Their Citations; To Amend Section 45-6-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity With The Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2738.title: Economic Liberty and Occupational Licensing Act of 2017; create.
2738.description: An Act To Create The Economic Liberty And Occupational Licensing Act Of 2017; And For Related Purposes.

2739.title: Guardian ad litem fees; failure to pay enforced as any other civil debt.
2739.description: An Act To Amend Sections 9-5-89 And 43-21-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Failure To Pay Guardian Ad Litem Fees Is Not Contempt Of Court But Shall Be Enforced As For Any Other Civil Debt; To Amend Sections 93-11-65, 93-15-107, 93-17-8 And 97-5-42, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2740.title: Medical professionals; immunity from liability and continuing education credits for indigent care.
2740.description: An Act To Amend Sections 73-25-19 And 73-25-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Medical Professionals Civil Immunity For Voluntary Care Provided Without Compensation To Indigent Or Needy Persons; To Allow Medical Professionals Who Provide Voluntary Care Without Compensation To Indigent Or Needy Persons To Receive Continuing Education Credit For Each 60 Minutes Of Qualifying Care Provided; To Provide That Nonresident Medical Professionals Licensed By Any State, Territory, District, Or Possession Of The United States May Provide Temporary Voluntary Medical Services In This State Without Compensation Through A Sponsoring Nonprofit Organization Registered With The Department Of Health; To Provide Civil Immunity For Nonresident Medical Professionals Who Provide Temporary Volunteer Health Care Services Through A Sponsoring Nonprofit Organization Registered With The Department Of Health; To Provide Continuing Education Credits For Medical Professions Offering Charitable Care; To Include Dentists And Other Medical Professionals; And For Related Purposes.

2741.title: Sanctuary cities; prohibit, and require local cooperation with federal immigration control.
2741.description: An Act To Prohibit The Establishment Of Sanctuary Cities; To Authorize All Mississippi Law Enforcement Officers To Assist Federal Agencies By Legal Detention Of Illegal Aliens; To Indemnify Law Enforcement Officers For Implementation Of This Act; To Amend Section 27-65-75, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2742.title: DFA website; require state agencies to post minutes.
2742.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-41-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Posting Of Board Minutes By State Agencies On The Department Of Finance And Administration Website; And For Related Purposes.

2743.title: Insurance adjusters license; revise waiver of license requirements and examination exemptions.
2743.description: An Act To Amend Section 83-17-407, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Commissioner Of Insurance To Waive Any Requirement For An Insurance Adjuster License For An Applicant With A Certification From A Certain Nationally Recognized Insurance Claims Association; To Amend Section 83-17-417, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemptions From Examination Required For An Adjuster License; And For Related Purposes.

2744.title: Seat belts; mandate for all passengers not required to use a child-restraint system.
2744.description: And Act To Create Harlie's Law; To Amend Section 63-2-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require All Passengers Of A Motor Vehicle To Wear Seat Belts Except Those Required To Use A Child Passenger Restraint System; To Amend Section 63-2-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Penalties For Failure To Wear A Properly Fastened Seat Belt; And For Related Purposes.

2745.title: Concealed weapons; allow concealed carry of automatic knives.
2745.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Automatic Knives Do Not Fall Within The Concealed Carry Prohibitions; And For Related Purposes.

2746.title: Asbestos Bankruptcy Trust Claims Transparency Act; create.
2746.description: An Act To Create The Asbestos Bankruptcy Trust Claims Transparency Act; To Create New Section 11-67-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact A Short Title; To Create New Section 11-67-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Legislative Findings; To Create New Section 11-67-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Definitions; To Create New Section 11-67-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Plaintiff Disclosures; To Create New Section 11-67-9 Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Identification Of Additional Asbestos Trust Claims By A Defendant; To Create New Section 11-67-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Admissibility Of Evidence; To Create New Section 11-67-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Sanctions For Failure To Provide Information; To Create New Section 11-67-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Transition Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2747.title: Sanctuary cities and campuses; prohibit.
2747.description: An Act To Prohibit The Establishment Of Sanctuary Cities; To Authorize All Mississippi Law Enforcement Officers To Assist Federal Agencies By Legal Detention Of Illegal Aliens; To Indemnify Law Enforcement Officers For Implementation Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2748.title: Conflicts of interest for community hospital board members; define.
2748.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-13-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Conflicts Of Interest For Members Of Boards Of Trustees For Community Hospitals And To Prescribe The Membership Of The Board For A Certain Community Hospital System; And For Related Purposes.

2749.title: Paternity; expand grounds for disestablishment of.
2749.description: An Act To Amend Section 93-9-10, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Right To Sue For Disestablishment Of Paternity; And For Related Purposes.

2750.title: Highway traffic; felony to maliciously impede.
2750.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-15-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Felony Level Of Maliciously Impeding Traffic On A Public Road; And For Related Purposes.

2751.title: Multidisciplinary team records; youth court confidentiality law applies.
2751.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-15-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Confidentiality And Possible Disclosure Of Records Of Multidisciplinary Teams And Child Advocacy Centers Concerning Children Shall Be Governed By The Youth Court Act And The Uniform Rules Of Youth Court Practice; To Provide That The Disclosure Of Certain Information Obtained From A Team Meeting Or From A Center May Occur Only When Requested By Courts For Limited Purposes; To Amend Section 43-21-259, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Confidentiality Of Certain Other Records Shall Include Information And Forensic Interviews Developed Or Prepared By Multidisciplinary Teams And Child Advocacy Centers; And For Related Purposes.

2752.title: Landlord-tenant law; revise.
2752.description: An Act To Amend Section 89-8-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Enact Certain Sanctions On Landlords Who Violate Specific Duties Under The Residential Landlord-tenant Act; And For Related Purposes.

2753.title: Marine Resources; increase the oyster shell retention fee and allowable recreational catch.
2753.description: An Act To Amend Section 49-15-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Oyster Shell Retention Fee; To Increase Allowable Recreational Catch; To Clarify Reciprocity Agreements; And For Related Purposes.

2754.title: Title disputes; clarify jurisdiction of state courts in certain.
2754.description: An Act To Amend Sections 11-17-35 And 11-17-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Jurisdiction That May Be Exercised By The State Courts In Certain Title Disputes Pending The Settlement Of A Claim Of Title In The United States Of America And To Recognize The Function And Application Of Federal Law; And For Related Purposes.

2755.title: Mississippi Private Investigation Regulatory Act; create.
2755.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Private Investigation Regulatory Act; To Provide Definitions For Such Act; To Provide All Persons Acting As Private Investigators Be Licensed; To Create The Private Investigation Board; To Provide For Membership And Terms Of The Members Of Such Board; To Provide That The Board Is A Quasi-judicial Body; To Create The Mississippi Private Investigation Board Fund; To Prohibit Unlicensed Persons From Acting As Private Investigators; To Provide The Criteria For Obtaining A Private Investigator's License; To Grandfather-in Certain Persons Operating As Private Investigators As Of The Effective Date Of This Act; To Provide A Procedure For Accepting Applications Under This Act; To Require The Board To Create Private Investigator Licenses; To Require A Private Investigator To Have Such License While Working As An Investigator; To Provide Fees For Such License; To Provide Fines For Violations Of This Act; To Exclude Certain Persons From The Provisions Of This Act; To Create The Division Of Investigation As The Board's Official Investigative Agency; And For Related Purposes.

2756.title: Public entities; require rotation of public accounting firms for annual audits of.
2756.description: An Act To Require Public Entities To Rotate Accounting Firms For Annual Audits Beginning With The 2019 Fiscal Year; To Provide That The State Auditor May Waive This Requirement If Another Eligible Public Accounting Firm Is Not Available To Perform The Audit; And For Related Purposes.

2759.title: Protection against discrimination; expand for housing and state employment.
2759.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-33-723, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand Protections Against Discrimination In Housing; To Amend Section 25-9-149, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand Protections Against Discriminatory Practices In State Employment; And For Related Purposes.

2760.title: "Protecting Freedom of Conscience from Government Discrimination Act"; repeal.
2760.description: An Act To Repeal Sections 11-62-1, 11-62-3, 11-62-5, 11-62-7, 11-62-9, 11-62-11, 11-62-13, 11-62-15, 11-62-17 And 11-62-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Are The "protecting Freedom Of Conscience From Government Discrimination Act" And Which Define Certain Protected Beliefs And Governmental Discriminatory Action; And For Related Purposes.

2761.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to provide funds to assist Hinds County in construction of the Byram-Clinton Parkway Project.
2761.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Hinds County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Of Construction And Development Of The Byram-clinton Parkway Project; And For Related Purposes.

2763.title: MS Motion Picture Incentive Act; revise definition of "base amount" & extend authority of MDA to approve applications under.
2763.description: An Act To Amend Section 57-89-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Include Within The Term "base Investment" Under The Mississippi Motion Picture Incentive Act, Production Expenditures Made By An Employee Of The Motion Picture Production Company And Reimbursed By The Company; To Amend Section 57-89-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend Until July 1, 2020, The Authority Of The Department Of Revenue To Approve Applications For Certain Rebates Under The Mississippi Motion Picture Incentive Act; And For Related Purposes.

2765.title: Educational services for detainees in juvenile detention centers; only provided during regular school year.
2765.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-321, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Juvenile Detention Centers And Local School Districts To Provide Educational Services To Detainees During The Regular 180-day School Term When Local Schools Are In Session; And For Related Purposes.

2766.title: Student suspensions; provide for informal hearing for short-term suspensions and formal due process hearing for long-term suspensions.
2766.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-9-71, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That In The Case Of Short-term Student Suspensions From School The Student Is Entitled Only To An Informal Due Process Hearing And In The Case Of Long-term Suspensions The Student Is Entitled To A Formal Due Process Hearing And Provide Standard Of Proof; And For Related Purposes.

2767.title: Trusty and earned-time programs; change eligibility to participate in.
2767.description: An Act To Expand Offenders' Access To Administrative Reductions In Time Through The Trusty-time Program And The Earned-time Allowance Program; To Provide That Offenders Convicted Of Crimes That Prohibit Reductions In Sentence Shall Be Ineligible For Such Programs; To Amend Sections 47-5-138.1, 47-5-139 And 47-7-3.2, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2768.title: Court-Appointed Special Advocate (CASA); revise.
2768.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Youth Court To Utilize A Trained Court-appointed Special Advocate (casa) Volunteer In Abuse And Neglect Cases; To Provide The Process Of Appointment For A Casa Volunteer As Well As The Duties And Expectations Of The Volunteer; To Amend Section 43-21-261, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Youth Court To Disclose Certain Records To A Casa Volunteer; To Amend Sections 43-15-13 And 43-21-309, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

2770.title: MS Check Cashers Act; remove restrictions pertaining to the operation of other businesses at the same location.
2770.description: An Act To Amend Section 75-67-505, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Restrictions On Check Cashing Licensees With Regard To The Operation Of Other Businesses At The Same Location; To Amend Section 22, Chapter 500, Laws Of 2016, To Remove The Sections Of Law Subject To Repeal Under The Mississippi Credit Availability Act Which Pertain To The Check Cashers Act And The Title Pledge Loan Act; And For Related Purposes.

2771.title: Financial literacy curriculum for public schools; State Board of Education shall implement.
2771.description: An Act To Require The State Board Of Education To Implement A Financial Literacy Curriculum For Public Schools On Or Before The 2017-2018 Academic School Year; To Provide That The Course In Financial Literacy Shall Account For A One-half Carnegie Unit; To Require Successful Passage Of The Course As A Graduation Requirement; To Establish The "financial Literacy Trust Fund" As A Special Fund In Tue State Treasury; To Provide For The Funds Administration; To Amend Section 37-7-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity To The Preceding Provisions; And For Related Purposes.

2772.title: Bail to be posted by criminal defendants; make revisions to bail system.
2772.description: An Act To Amend Sections 21-23-8, 99-5-9 And 99-5-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Make Certain Revisions To The Bail System, To Provide That The Amount Of Bail Shall Be Presumed To Be Attainable By The Defendant, To Require The Court To Make A Determination Of Whether The Defendant Can Be Released On Recognizance In Cases Of Indigency, To Provide That No Misdemeanor Defendant Shall Be Incarcerated Or Released Solely Because He Cannot Afford To Post Bail, To Provide That The Court May Not Require Cash Bail From The Defendant; And For Related Purposes.

2773.title: Bonds; revise purposes of bonds authorized to be issued for the John C. Robinson Aviation Museum.
2773.description: An Act To Amend Section 8, Chapter 580, Laws Of 2007, To Revise The Purposes For Which Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The John C. Robinson Mississippi Aviation Museum Fund May Be Utilized; And For Related Purposes.

2774.title: Appropriation; field sobriety training.
2774.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Department Of Public Safety, For The Purpose Of Defraying The Costs Of Standardized Field Sobriety Testing (sfst), Advanced Roadside Impaired Driving Enforcement (aride), And Drug Recognition Expert (dre) Procedures To Assist Traffic Safety Officers In Detecting Impaired Drivers And In Presenting Accurate Testimony In Court; And For Related Purposes.

2775.title: DUI; prescribe parameters for court-ordered drug testing.
2775.description: An Act To Create New Section 63-11-31.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Standards To Be Met By Vendors Providing Drug-testing Services To Dui Offenders Who Participate In Court-ordered Drug Testing; To Amend Section 63-11-30, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; To Amend Section 63-11-31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 63-11-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Interlock Device Fund In Order That Costs Of Drug Testing Of Indigent Offenders May Be Covered; To Amend Section 63-1-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Dui/other-restricted License; To Amend Section 63-1-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide The Fee For A Dui/other-restricted License; To Amend Section 63-1-46, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For Reinstatement Of A Regular License Following Satisfactory Completion Of Court-ordered Drug Testing; And For Related Purposes.

2776.title: University public-private partnerships; revise.
2776.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 37-101-41, 37-101-42, 37-101-43, 37-101-44, 37-101-45 And 37-101-47, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Later Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2777.title: Campaign contributions; prohibit conversion to personal use and require itemization of certain expenditures.
2777.description: An Act To Prohibit The Use Of Campaign Contributions For Personal Use; To Amend Section 23-15-807, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Itemization Of Certain Campaign Expenditures; And For Related Purposes.

2778.title: Public works contracts; if contracts funded as result of declared disaster, acknowledgement of laws regarding must accompany bid.
2778.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-5-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Contractors Submitting Bids For Public Works That Utilized Funds Received By State Or Local Governmental Entities Resulting From A Federally Declared Disaster Or A Spill Of National Significance, To Submit With Their Bid A Signed Agreement Acknowledging Awareness Of The Requirements Of This Section; And For Related Purposes.

2779.title: Debtor-creditor; exempt annuities, IRAs & deferred compensation plans from all liability for debts of the participants or beneficiaries.
2779.description: An Act To Amend Section 85-3-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Proceeds Of Annuity Contracts And All Assets Held In, Or Monies Payable To The Participants Or Beneficiaries From, Individual Retirement Accounts Or Deferred Compensation Plans Shall Be Exempt From Liability For Debts Of Participants Or Beneficiaries Thereof; To Bring Forward Section 85-3-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purpose Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2780.title: Driving; careless if using handheld wireless device.
2780.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-3-1213, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Rebuttable Presumption That Using A Handheld Wireless Device While Driving Constitutes Careless Driving; And For Related Purposes.

2781.title: Environmental Quality; require the department to identify all coal ash dam sites.
2781.description: An Act To Require The Department Of Environmental Quality To Identify And Publish The Locations Of All Coal Ash Dam Sites In The State And To Develop Regulations To Monitor Such Sites; And For Related Purposes.

2783.title: Cockfighting; offense to conduct, train or attend.
2783.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-41-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Offense Of Cockfighting And The Punishment Therefor; And For Related Purposes.

2784.title: Drug offenders; clarify parole eligibility.
2784.description: An Act To Amend Section 47-7-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Parole Eligibility For Certain Drug Offenders; And For Related Purposes.

2785.title: Adult day care assisted living services; authorize Division of Medicaid to establish program.
2785.description: An Act To Provide That The Division Of Medicaid Shall Design And Implement A Temporary Program To Provide Adult Day Care Assisted Living Services For Certain Individuals; To Provide That The Division Shall Reimburse Those Entities And Individuals In Accordance With A Mutually Agreed Upon Reimbursement Schedule; To Provide That The Program Is Not Part Of Or Connected To The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

2786.title: Mississippi Adequate Education Program; increase funding for at-risk pupils.
2786.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Allotment Of Mississippi Adequate Education Program Funding For At-risk Students; And For Related Purposes.

2787.title: Prescription Monitoring Program; require dispensers and prescribers to check database.
2787.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-21-127, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Dispensers And Prescribers To Check The Prescription Monitoring Program Database Before Dispensing Or Prescribing Certain Drugs; To Delete The Sunset Provision; And For Related Purposes.

2788.title: Health insurance policies; require coverage for colorectal cancer examinations.
2788.description: An Act To Require That Certain Insurance Policies And Contracts Shall Provide Coverage For All Colorectal Cancer Examinations And Laboratory Tests Specified In Current American Cancer Society (acs) Guidelines For Colorectal Cancer Screening; To Amend Section 25-15-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The State And School Employees Health Insurance Plan Shall Include Coverage For All Colorectal Cancer Examinations And Laboratory Tests Specified In Current Guidelines; And For Related Purposes.

2789.title: Residential property foreclosures; prohibit unless 90-day written notice is given.
2789.description: An Act To Prohibit Foreclosure On Residential Property Unless The Mortgagee Or Holder Of The Mortgage Gives The Mortgagor 90 Days' Written Notice; To Prescribe The Contents Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Mortgagee To Notify The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance Of The Date Of The Foreclosure Sale, The Purchase Price Obtained At The Sale, And A Copy Of The Notice To Foreclose; To Require The Commissioner Of Banking And Consumer Finance To Maintain A Database Of Certain Foreclosure Activity Information; And For Related Purposes.

2790.title: Appointments to state agency boards and commissions; shall give due regard to race, gender and geographic distribution.
2790.description: An Act To Provide That The Governor, Lieutenant Governor And Any Other Appointing Authority Shall Give Due Regard To Race And Gender In Making Appointments To State Agency Boards And Commissions, And Shall Give Due Regard To The Geographical Distribution Of Appointments Across The State Of Mississippi And The Real Possibility Of Mississippi's Congressional Districts Being Reduced From Four To Three; To Provide That Members Of State Agency Boards And Commissions Shall Give Due Regard To Race And Gender In Sending Designees To Meetings; To Specify The State Agency Boards And Commissions To Which This Act Applies; And For Related Purposes.

2791.title: Marijuana; allow medical use by seriously ill patients under doctor's supervision.
2791.description: An Act To Authorize The Medical Use Of Marijuana By Seriously Ill Patients Under A Physician's Supervision; To Define Certain Terms; To Provide An Exemption From Criminal And Civil Penalties For The Medical Use Of Marijuana; To Provide Limitations On The Medical Use Of Marijuana; To Provide A Legal Defense For Patients And Primary Caregivers; To Amend Sections 41-29-113 And 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Transfer Marijuana From Schedule I To Schedule Ii Under The Controlled Substances Law; To Amend Section 41-29-139, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Medical Use Of Marijuana From Criminal Penalties Under The Controlled Substances Law; And For Related Purposes.

2792.title: Critical Needs Teacher Scholarship Program; earmark minimum number of awards for teachers of advanced placement courses.
2792.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-106-55, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Beginning With The 2017-2018 School Year At Least Two Critical Needs Teacher Scholarship Program Awards Shall Be Made In Each Mississippi Congressional District For Teacher Education Students Who Agree To Teach Advanced Placement Courses; And For Related Purposes.

2793.title: State Board of Medical Licensure; reconstitute membership of board on a phased-in basis.
2793.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-43-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reconstitute The Membership Of The State Board Of Medical Licensure On A Phased-in Basis; And For Related Purposes.

2794.title: State Land Mammal; designate American Black Bear as.
2794.description: An Act To Amend Section 3-3-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Designate The American Black Bear As One Of The State Land Mammals; And For Related Purposes.

2795.title: Appeal bond; set the maximum amount for appeals from decisions of local governments as to taxes.
2795.description: An Act To Amend Section 11-51-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Amount Of The Appeal Bond Required For An Appeal From A Decision By A Board Of Supervisors Or Municipal Authorities As To The Assessment Of Taxes Shall Be Not Less Than $100.00 Nor More Than $10,000.00; And For Related Purposes.

2796.title: Public lands; reestablish Office of State Land Commissioner and transfer authority of Secretary of State relative to supervision of.
2796.description: An Act To Codify Section 7-11-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Reestablish The Office Of State Land Commissioner And Provide For His Election At The Same Time And Manner As Other State Officials Are Elected; To Empower And Authorize The State Land Commissioner To Have General Supervision Over Public Lands, Sixteenth Section Or Lieu Lands, Chickasaw School Lands And Lands Forfeited To The State For Nonpayment Of Taxes To The Same Extent As Such Lands Are Supervised By The Secretary Of State; To Amend Sections 7-11-2, 7-11-3, 7-11-4, 7-11-6, 7-11-8, 7-11-11, 7-11-13, 7-11-15, 7-11-17, 7-11-19, 7-11-25 And 29-3-1.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2798.title: Insurance; prohibit use of credit information in underwriting and rating.
2798.description: An Act To Prohibit Insurers From Using Information Regarding A Consumer's Creditworthiness, Credit Standing Or Credit Capacity For The Purpose Of Determining Rates For Insurance Or Eligibility For Coverage; And For Related Purposes.

2799.title: Public utilities; charitable or civic contributions shall not be allowed as costs or expenses for rate-making purposes.
2799.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-3-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Charitable Or Civic Contributions Made By Public Utilities Shall Not Be Allowed In Any Amount As Costs Or Expenses For Rate-making Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2800.title: Appropriation FY18; University of Mississippi School of Education grant funds for AP teachers on the Mississippi Gulf Coast.
2800.description: An Act Making An Appropriation Of Grant Funds Available To The University Of Mississippi School Of Education To Defray The Expenses Of Enrolling And Educating Teachers For Advanced Placement Courses And Principals In School Districts Located In The Counties Bordering The Mississippi Gulf Coast, For Fiscal Year 2018; And For Related Purposes.

2801.title: Railroad grade crossings; prohibit obstruction of vehicular traffic for more than 20 consecutive minutes at grade crossings.
2801.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-9-235, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Any Train, Railroad Car Or Equipment, Or Engine From Obstructing Vehicular Traffic At A Railroad Grade Crossing Upon A Public Street, Road Or Highway For A Period In Excess Of 20 Consecutive Minutes; To Provide Exceptions To Such Prohibition; To Provide Fines For Violations Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2803.title: Environmental fees; authorize Commission on Environmental Quality to set to cover costs of permitting programs.
2803.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Environmental Quality To Establish Fees Necessary To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality; To Create The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Amend Sections 51-3-31, 51-5-1, 53-7-21, 53-7-25, 53-7-69 And 49-31-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow The Commission To Set Program Fees And To Direct Fees To The Department Of Environmental Quality Program Fund; To Bring Forward Section 53-7-43, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provides For Applications For The Modification, Transfer Or Reissuance Of Any Surface Mining Permit, For Purposes Of Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2804.title: Natural resources; recommend an assessment of the value of Mississippi's natural resources.
2804.description: An Act To Recommend The Assessment Of The Economic Value Of The Natural Resources Of The State; And For Related Purposes.

2805.title: Computer and electronic waste; require management plan for recycling and disposal.
2805.description: An Act To Provide A Program For The Recycling And Disposal Of Computer And Electronic Solid Waste; To Require Each State Agency To Implement Such Program; To Provide For The Sale Or Donation Of Such Equipment; To Create A Computer And Electronic Recycling Fund; To Provide For The Disbursement Of Fund Proceeds; And For Related Purposes.

2806.title: Marine Resources fees; authorize Commission on Marine Resources to adjust fees to cover costs of permitting programs.
2806.description: An Act To Authorize The Mississippi Commission On Marine Resources To Adjust Fees To Defray The Costs Of Operation Of The Commission And The Mississippi Department Of Marine Resources; To Create The Department Of Marine Resources Program Fund; And For Related Purposes.

2807.title: Environmental Quality; require commission to adopt rules on radon control.
2807.description: An Act Requiring The Commission On Environmental Quality To Adopt Rules For Radon Control; And For Related Purposes.

2808.title: Natural resources; recommend an assessment of the value of MS natural resources and wildlife corridors.
2808.description: An Act To Recommend The Assessment Of The Economic Value Of The Natural Resources Of The State; To Require The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, In Conjunction With The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality And The Mississippi Department Of Transportation, To Identify Existing And Needed Wildlife Corridors; To File A Report And Recommendations; And For Related Purposes.

2809.title: State Agency Accountability and Transparency website; include 5 oldest Public Records Act requests for each agency.
2809.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-104-155, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The Department Of Finance And Administration To Include On The State Agency Accountability And Transparency Website A Description Of The Five Oldest Public Records Act Or Freedom Of Information Act (foia) Requests; And For Related Purposes.

2814.title: Lower-level offenders; encourage diversion of certain.
2814.description: An Act To Amend Section 99-15-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Intent Of The Pretrial Intervention Act Is To Increase Alternatives To Imprisonment For Certain Nonviolent Offenders; To Amend Section 99-15-105, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Judge And The District Attorney To Recommend An Offender For Participation In The Pretrial Program; To Amend Sections 99-15-109, 99-15-113 And 99-15-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Preceding Sections; And For Related Purposes.

2816.title: School district accreditation rating model; direct MDE to implement differential ratings which emphasize local economy.
2816.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-17-6, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize And Direct The State Department Of Education To Develop And Implement A Differential K-12 School District Accreditation Rating Model Which Emphasizes Those Graduate Skills Needed By The Local Economy And Local Business Community; And For Related Purposes.

2817.title: Justice courts; revise fees.
2817.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-7-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Justice Court Fee Allowable For Certain Traffic Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2818.title: Mental Health Summit; establish.
2818.description: An Act To Create The Mental Health Summit To Study Certain Issues Relating To The State's Mental Health System For The Elderly And Children; To Provide For The Membership Of The Summit; To Prescribe The Duties Of The Summit Members; To Direct The State Department Of Mental Health And The State Department Of Health To Administer And Facilitate The Responsibilities Of The Summit; And For Related Purposes.

2819.title: Prekindergarten programs; commit funding for.
2819.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-21-51, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Legislature Shall Fund The Early Childhood Education Program; And For Related Purposes.

2820.title: Payday lending; prohibit activities of/declare public nuisance.
2820.description: An Act To Declare Legislative Intent To Prohibit Activities Commonly Referred To As Payday Lending, Deferred Presentment Services, Advance Cash Services And Other Similar Activities; To Provide That It Shall Be Unlawful To Engage In The Business Of Making Certain Small Loans; To Provide Criminal Penalties Therefor; To Provide For Collection Of Civil Penalties In Actions By The State Or By Private Parties On Behalf Of The State; To Declare The Site Or Location Of A Place Of Business Where Payday Lending Takes Place In The State Of Mississippi As A Public Nuisance; To Repeal Sections 75-67-401 Through 75-67-449, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Title Pledge Act; To Repeal Sections 75-67-501 Through 75-67-539, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Check Cashers Act; And For Related Purposes.

2821.title: Transportation; require MDOT to develop a complete streets program.
2821.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Complete Streets Legislation; And For Related Purposes.

2822.title: Driver's education; require for drivers under age 17.
2822.description: An Act To Amend Section 63-1-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Drivers Under The Age Of 17 To Have Completed A Driver's Education Course In Order To Hold An Intermediate License; And For Related Purposes.

2827.title: TANF and Medicaid; require teenage recipients to participate in programs about birth control.
2827.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require The Department Of Human Services To Provide Teenage Tanf Recipients With Information And Referral To Programs That Provide Information About Birth Control, Prenatal Health Care, Abstinence Education, Marriage Education, Parenting Skills, Family Preservation And Fatherhood, And Require Those Tanf Recipients To Participate In Certain Educational Activities Emphasizing Abstinence Described In This Act; To Provide That After The Identity Of The Father Of A Child Of Any Of Those Tanf Recipients Has Been Legally Determined, The Father Shall Be Required To Participate In Those Programs; To Provide That Any Unspent Tanf Funds Remaining From The Prior Fiscal Year First Shall Be Expended To Pay For The Education-related Expenses Of Persons Who Are Enrolled In Nursing Education Courses As Part Of Workforce Training And Pay For The Child Care Expenses Of Those Persons While They Are Taking The Nursing Education Courses; To Require The Division Of Medicaid To Provide Teenage Medicaid Recipients With Information And Referral To Programs That Provide Information About Birth Control, Prenatal Health Care, Abstinence Education, Marriage Education, Parenting Skills, Family Preservation And Fatherhood, And Require Those Medicaid Recipients To Participate In Those Programs; To Provide That After The Identity Of The Father Of A Child Of Any Of Those Medicaid Recipients Has Been Legally Determined, The Father Shall Be Required To Participate In Those Programs; To Establish The Criteria Required For The Educational Activity Emphasizing Abstinence To Teenage Tanf Benefits; To Require The Educational Activity To Be Taught In A Manner That Is Age And Developmentally Appropriate; And For Related Purposes.

2828.title: Determination of cost of adequate education program; define student "average daily membership" (ADM) for purpose of formula.
2828.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-151-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Term "average Daily Membership (adm)" For Purposes Of The Mississippi Adequate Education Program; To Amend Section 37-151-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Determination Of The Basic Adequate Education Program Cost For Each School District Based On Student Average Daily Membership With Certain Exceptions; To Provide For Student Counts By The State Auditor; To Amend Sections 37-151-85, 37-151-97 And 37-151-103, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2830.title: Tuition and cost responsibility for dual credit programs; local school district may expend funds.
2830.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-15-38, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Local School Districts Are Authorized To Expend Funds From Any Available Source To Pay For Tuition And Costs For Dual Enrollment University And Community College-level Courses For Any Eligible Student Residing In The School District; And For Related Purposes.

2832.title: Elections; authorize early voting.
2832.description: An Act To Authorize A Qualified Elector To Vote Not More Than 20 Days Nor Less Than Two Days Before The Date Of An Election; To Provide That Early Voting May Be Conducted In The Registrar's Office; To Require A Person Who Desires To Vote Early To Appear At The Registrar's Office And To Provide That After Signing The Receipt Book Such Person Shall Be Entitled To Vote At The Registrar's Office In The Same Manner As He Would At His Voting Precinct On The Day Of The Election; To Provide That The Election Laws That Govern Procedures For A Person Who Appears To Vote On The Day Of Election Shall Apply When A Person Appears To Vote During The Early Voting Period; To Provide That All Votes Cast During The Early Voting Period Shall Be Final; To Provide That The Votes Cast During Early Voting Shall Be Announced Simultaneously With The Vote Cast On Election Day; To Provide That Each Candidate Shall Have The Right To Be Present At The Registrar's Office And To Challenge The Qualifications Of Any Person Offering To Early Vote In The Same Manner As Provided By Law At The Polling Place On The Day Of The Election; To Require The Secretary Of State To Promulgate Rules And Regulations Necessary To Effectuate Early Voting; To Amend Section 23-15-195, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Amend Section 23-15-627, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Categories Of Voters Who May Cast An Absentee Ballot; To Amend Section 23-15-637, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That All Absentee Ballots Must Be Received By The Registrar By A Certain Time On The Day Before The Election; And For Related Purposes.

2833.title: Eleventh Grade students; require to take adult basic education High School Equivalency Diploma test.
2833.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-16-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Local School Boards To Assess The Student Performance Of All Eleventh Grade Students Using The General Educational Development Or High School Equivalency Diploma Test Program; To Prohibit Students Determined By The Assessment Not Performing At Grade Level From The Senior Privilege Of Early Release From School Upon Completion Of All Academic Classes Required For The Day; And For Related Purposes.

2834.title: General Education Development (GED) instruction program; student may request additional time to complete.
2834.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-13-92, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize A Student To Petition The Local School District Or Local Community College For Additional Time To Complete The General Educational Development (ged) Instruction Program Without Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

2835.title: MS Credit Availability Act; authorize licensees to charge for repossession and sale of collateral, extend repealer on.
2835.description: An Act To Reenact Sections 75-67-601 Through 75-67-637, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Create The Mississippi Credit Availability Act; To Amend Reenacted Section 75-67-619, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Licensees To Charge Fees And Costs Relating To The Repossession And Sale Of Collateral; To Amend Section 22, Chapter 500, Laws Of 2016, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove The Sections Of Law Subject To Repeal Which Pertain To The Check Cashers Act And The Title Pledge Loan Act, And To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Mississippi Credit Availability Act; And For Related Purposes.

2836.title: Flame-retardant chemicals; prohibit children's products or upholstered residential furniture containing certain amounts of.
2836.description: An Act To Prohibit Manufacturers Or Wholesalers From Manufacturing, Selling, Offering For Sale, Distributing For Sale Or Distributing For Use In This State A Children's Product Or Upholstered Residential Furniture Containing Certain Amounts Of Flame-retardant Chemicals; To Prohibit Certain Replacement Flame-retardant Chemicals; To Require A Report From The State Health Officer, In Consultation With The State Fire Marshal; And For Related Purposes.

2837.title: State Board of Cosmetology; make technical revisions to practice act and extend repealer.
2837.description: An Act To Bring Forward Sections 73-7-1 Through 73-7-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Is The Cosmetology Practice Act; To Amend Section 73-7-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Qualifications For The Membership Of The State Board Of Cosmetology; To Amend Section 73-7-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Requirements For The Photograph Of The Licensee; To Amend Section 73-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Qualifications For Taking The Cosmetology Examination; To Amend Section 73-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Qualifications For Licensing Of Cosmetology Instructors; To Amend Section 73-7-16, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Certain Requirements For Licensing Of Cosmetology Schools; To Amend Section 73-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Qualifications For Licensing Of Estheticians; To Amend Section 73-7-21, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Qualifications For Licensing Of Manicurists; To Amend Section 73-7-29, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prescribe Fees To Be Charged By The State Board Of Cosmetology; To Amend Section 73-7-63, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend The Automatic Repealer On The Sections Which Create The State Board Of Cosmetology And Prescribe Its Duties And Powers; And For Related Purposes.

2838.title: Anti-Bullying Law; revise provisions for required establishment of policies for by school districts.
2838.description: An Act To Amend Section 37-11-67, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Conduct That Is Considered Being Bullying Behavior; To Amend Section 37-11-69, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Provisions To Be Included In A School Districts' Anti-bullying Policies; To Require School Districts To Post The Proper Procedure For Reporting Bullying On Their Internet Website; And For Related Purposes.

2839.title: Lotteries; repeal advertising prohibitions.
2839.description: An Act To Repeal Section 97-33-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits The Advertising Of Lotteries; To Repeal Section 97-33-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits Publication Or Circulation Of Newspapers Advertising A Lottery; To Repeal Section 97-33-37, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Prohibits The Sale Of Newspapers Containing A Lottery Advertisement; And For Related Purposes.

2840.title: Mississippi Paid Family Leave Act; establish.
2840.description: An Act To Establish The Mississippi Paid Family Leave Act To Be Administered By The Mississippi Department Of Employment Security; To Provide Definitions; To Provide Entitlement Requirements And Conditions For Paid Leave; To Authorize Intermittent Or Reduced Leave; To Provide That This Act Is To Be Construed With Similar Provisions In The Federal Family And Medical Leave Act; And For Related Purposes.

2841.title: Youth court referees; appointed to a 4-year term.
2841.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-21-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Youth Court Referees Shall Be Appointed To A 4-year Term; To Enact Transition Provisions For Youth Court Referees Appointed Before The Next Trial Court Judge Election; To Allow For County Court Youth Referees; To Amend Section 43-21-801, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2844.title: Criminal history background checks; "Ban the Box".
2844.description: An Act To Ban Criminal History Checks As Part Of The Preliminary Job Application Process Except As Required By Law; And For Related Purposes.

2845.title: Mississippi Department of Human Services; change appropriate references to Mississippi Department of Child Protection Services.

2846.title: Wildlife; require feasibility study on alligator ranch farming in Mississippi.
2846.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks And The Mississippi Development Authority To Conduct A Study On The Feasibility Of Alligator Farming In The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

2847.title: Highways; require MDOT to clearly mark right-of-way boundary markers.
2847.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Clearly Mark Right-of-way Boundary Markers; And For Related Purposes.

2848.title: EMS Personnel Licensure Interstate Compact; enact.
2848.description: An Act To Enact The Ems Personnel Licensure Interstate Compact To Facilitate The Movement Of Ems Personnel Across State Boundaries In The Performance Of Their Ems Duties; To Provide That The Provisions Of The Compact Shall Be Implemented By The State Department Of Health As Licensing Entity; To Amend Sections 41-59-3, 41-59-29, 41-59-33 And 41-59-35, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity; And For Related Purposes.

2849.title: Tishomingo County; authorize the imposition of a tax on restaurants to fund tourism and parks and recreation.
2849.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tishomingo County, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

2850.title: Sex offender registration; define.
2850.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-33-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of Registrable Offense; And For Related Purposes.

2851.title: Lobbying; enact State Agency Lobbying Reform Act of 2017.
2851.description: An Act To Create The State Agency Lobbying Reform Act Of 2017; To Amend Section 5-8-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Definitions; To Amend Section 5-8-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Expand The Exclusions From Lobbying; To Amend Section 5-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Prohibited Acts; To Amend Section 5-8-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Penalties; To Require State Agency Disclosures; And For Related Purposes.

2852.title: Mandatory Statewide Offense-Reporting System Task Force; revise report due date.
2852.description: An Act To Amend Section 2, Chapter 457, Laws Of 2016, To Extend The Due Date Of The Report To Be Made By The Mandatory Statewide Offense-reporting System Task Force; To Make Certain Technical Corrections; And For Related Purposes.

2853.title: Blowout prevention; require training course for rig workers.
2853.description: An Act To Amend Section 53-1-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Require Blowout-prevention Training Courses For Rig Workers; And For Related Purposes.

2854.title: Wildlife Trafficking Prevention Act; enact.
2854.description: An Act To Enact The "wildlife Trafficking Prevention Act"; To Prohibit The Purchase, Sell Or Exchange Of Certain Wildlife Species; To Provide A Civil Penalty For Violations; And For Related Purposes.

2856.title: County purchases; increase the minimum acquisition costs of items and services.
2856.description: An Act To Amend Sections 31-7-103 And 31-7-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Minimum Acquisition Cost Of An Item Or Service Purchased By A County That Requires A Requisition To Purchase, Purchase Order And Receiving Report; And For Related Purposes.

2857.title: Political subdivisions; authorize to provide multiple deferred compensation plans to employees.
2857.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-14-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Allow A County, Municipality Or Other Political Subdivision To Provide Multiple Deferred Compensation Plans To Its Employees; And For Related Purposes.

2858.title: Eligibility for Temporary Assistance for Needy Families (TANF) and (SNAP) Programs; childless adults must work to get food stamps.
2858.description: An Act To Amend Section 43-17-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Impose Certain Restrictions Affecting A Person's Eligibility For Tanf Assistance; To Impose Certain Work Requirements On Tanf Recipients Who Are Able-bodied Adults Without Dependents (abawds); To Impose Certain Restrictions Affecting A Person's Eligibility And Expenditures Under The Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (snap); And For Related Purposes.

2860.title: County supervisors; create education and certification program for.
2860.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Supervisors Education And Certification Program For County Supervisors; To Provide An Annual Salary Supplement Upon Attaining Certification; To Authorize Reimbursement For Certain Expenses Associated With Attendance At The Education And Certification Program; And For Related Purposes.

2861.title: County supervisors; create education and certification program, increase salaries of.
2861.description: An Act To Amend Section 19-3-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Create A Supervisors Education And Certification Program For County Supervisors; To Provide An Annual Salary Supplement Upon Attaining Certification; To Authorize Reimbursement For Certain Expenses Associated With Attendance At The Education And Certification Program; To Amend Section 25-3-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Salaries Of The Members Of The Boards Of Supervisors; And For Related Purposes.

2862.title: Mental health diversion pilot programs; authorize.
2862.description: An Act To Authorize Mental Health Diversion Pilot Programs; To Specify The Purpose And Goals Of Mental Health Diversion Pilot Programs; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Specify Minimum Standards For Mental Health Intervention Services; To Provide Certain Mental Health Intervention Services; To Set Forth Alternative Sentencing Eligibility Criteria And Conditions; To Designate The Powers Of The Administrative Office Of Courts Regarding Mental Health Diversion Pilot Programs; To Authorize Mental Health Diversion Pilot Programs To Receive Funds And Assess Reasonable Fees; To Provide Immunity To Persons Who Perform Their Mental Health Duties In Good Faith; To Provide That Persons Who Complete All Requirements Imposed By The Mental Health Diversion Pilot Programs Will Have Their Records Expunged; And For Related Purposes.

2863.title: Lobbying; ban for state agencies.
2863.description: An Act To Amend Section 5-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Lobbying By State Employees And Others; To Create New Section 25-1-119, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit Expenditure Of State Funds On Lobbying The Electorate; To Bring Forward Sections 5-8-1, 5-8-3, 5-8-5, 5-8-7, 5-8-9, 5-8-11, 5-8-15, 5-8-17, 5-8-19, 5-8-21 And 5-8-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2867.title: Code-Charter Municipalities; governing authorities may delegate duties related to personnel actions.
2867.description: An Act To Amend Section 21-3-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That The Governing Authorities Of Code-charter Municipalities May Delegate The Power And Authority To Handle Personnel Actions To The Mayor, Chief Administrative Officer Or Department Heads; To Bring Forward Sections 21-3-15 And 21-3-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, For Purposes Of Possible Amendment; And For Related Purposes.

2869.title: Optional retirement program; authorize participant to join PERS under certain circumstances.
2869.description: An Act To Amend Section 25-11-401, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Teaching Or Administrative Faculty Positions That Are Eligible For The Optional Retirement Program Shall Be As Defined In The Plan Document; To Amend Section 25-11-409, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That A Participant In The Optional Retirement Program May Irrevocably Elect To Change His Or Her Election And Join The Public Employees' Retirement System Before The Fifth Annual Anniversary Of The Person's Initial Enrollment In The Optional Retirement Program; To Provide That Any Employee Who Before July 1, 2017, Elected To Participate In The Optional Retirement Program Shall Have A One-time Opportunity To Irrevocably Change His Or Her Election And Prospectively Participate In The Public Employees' Retirement System If The Election Is Filed With The System On Or Before December 31, 2018; To Authorize Persons Making Such Election To Purchase Service Credit For Their Prior Years Of Service During Which They Participated In The Optional Retirement Program; To Amend Section 25-11-411, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Remove Certain Unnecessary Language; To Amend Section 25-11-413, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That, Except As Otherwise Provided In This Act, An Employee Who Participates In The Optional Retirement Program For 90 Days Or More And Is Subsequently Employed In A Position That Is Not Otherwise Eligible For The Program Shall Not Be Eligible For Participation In The Public Employees' Retirement System And Shall Continue To Be Eligible For Participation In The Program So Long As The Employee Meets The Other Eligibility Requirement For The Program, Except As Otherwise Provided In This Act; And For Related Purposes.

2870.title: Minimum Standards Board; revise membership.
2870.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-6-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Membership And Appointing Authorities Of The Board On Law Enforcement Officer Standards And Training; And For Related Purposes.

2872.title: Chickasawhay natural Gas District; provide board members per diem for continuing education training.
2872.description: An Act To Amend Section 77-15-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide Board Members Of The Chickasawhay Natural Gas District With Per Diem Compensation For Each Day Occupied With Continuing Education Training; And For Related Purposes.

2873.title: Fee in lieu; certain counties may not enter into for project in portion of city school district that is located outside the city.
2873.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide If A Project Is Located Outside The Limits Of A Municipality But Within The Boundaries Of The Municipal School District, The County Board Of Supervisors Of Certain Counties May Not Enter Into A Fee-in-lieu Agreement On Behalf Of The School District Granting A Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes For School District Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

2874.title: Women in High-Wage, High-Demand, Nontraditional Jobs Grant Program; authorize in Mississippi Department of Employment Security.
2874.description: An Act To Establish A Women In High-wage/high-demand/

2875.title: Residential builders/remodelers; revise licensing law.
2875.description: An Act To Amend Section 73-59-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Define The Terms "construction Manager" And "residential Solar Contractor" As Used In The Residential Builders And Remodelers Licensing Law; To Amend Section 73-59-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The List Of Persons Required To Be Licensed By The State Board Of Contractors Under This Chapter; To Amend Section 73-59-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Violations In Connection With Licensing; To Amend Section 73-59-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Persons Exempt From The Chapter; To Amend Section 73-59-19, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Exemption For Licensees To Work On Certain Commercial Structures Without An Additional License; To Amend Sections 73-59-5, 73-59-7, 73-59-11, 73-59-13 And 73-59-17, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2876.title: Mississippi Medicaid Program; bring forward sections for technical amendments.
2876.description: An Act Relating To The Mississippi Medicaid Program; To Bring Forward Sections 43-13-117, 43-13-121, And 43-13-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide The Types Of Services And Provider Reimbursement Under The Medicaid Program, Provide The Powers And Responsibilities Of The Division Of Medicaid And Provide For Assessments Levied Upon Health Care Facilities Participating In The Medicaid Program; And For Related Purposes.

2877.title: Memorial highways; designate certain segments of highways as.
2877.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Mississippi Highway 35 Within The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Batesville, Mississippi, As The Leonard Morris Memorial Highway; To Designate The Portion Of Mississippi Highway 513 Situated Between The City Of Quitman And The City Of Stonewall As The Corporal Dustin Lee Memorial Highway; To Designate A Portion Of United States Highway 82 In Leflore County As The "b.b. King Memorial Highway"; To Designate A Portion Of Highway 8 West Of The Town Of Pace As The Juniper Yates "jy" Trice Memorial Highway; To Designate A Certain Segment Of U.s. Interstate Highway 55 In Pike County, Mississippi, As The "bo Diddley Memorial Highway"; And For Related Purposes.

2879.title: Memorial highways; designate various segments of highways as memorial highways.
2879.description: An Act To Designate A Certain Segment Of Interstate 220 In Hinds County As The Senator Alice Varnado Harden Memorial Highway; To Designate A Portion Of Interstate 220 In Hinds County As The Senator Henry J. Kirksey Memorial Highway; And For Related Purposes.

2880.title: Highways; require MDOT to erect signs along certain highways to inform motorists that texting while driving is illegal.
2880.description: An Act To Require The Mississippi Department Of Transportation To Erect Signs Along U.s. Interstates And Mississippi State Highways To Inform Motorists That Texting While Driving Is Illegal; And For Related Purposes.

2881.title: Mississippi Emergency Telephone Service Charges Study Committee; create.
2881.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Emergency Telephone Service Charges Study Committee" For The Purpose Of Studying All Emergency Telephone Service Charges Levied In The State Of Mississippi, Including, But Not Limited To, The Collection, Distribution, Use And Oversight Of Such Charges; And For Related Purposes.

2882.title: Gulf Coast Restoration Reserve Fund; create.
2882.description: An Act To Create The Gulf Coast Restoration Reserve Fund In The State Treasury For The Purpose Of Funding Projects Primarily Benefiting The Mississippi Gulf Coast From Funds Paid To The State For Economic Damages In Connection With The 2010 Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill; To Provide For The Transfer Of Such Funds From The Budget Contingency Fund; To Amend Section 27-103-302, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform; And For Related Purposes.

2883.title: Elections; establish procedure for automatic registration of voters.
2883.description: An Act To Establish A Procedure For The Automatic Registration Of Eligible Voters; To Provide That The Department Of Public Safety Shall Make Voter Registration Applications Available To Persons Seventeen Years Of Age And Older Upon Their Application For The Issuance Or Renewal Of A Drivers License Or State Identification Card; To Require The Department Of Public Safety To Provide An Electronic Record Of Such Voter Registration Applications To The Secretary Of State; To Require The Secretary Of State To Provide Registration Applications To County Registrars; To Amend Section 23-15-33, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize County Registrars To Register Eligible Persons Upon Receiving An Electronic Voter Registration Application From The Secretary Of State; And For Related Purposes.

2884.title: Open meetings; require executive session and called special session reporting.
