3022.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Personnel Board For Fiscal Year 2018.

3023.title: Appropriation; Secretary of State.
3023.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Office Of The Secretary Of State For Fiscal Year 2018.

3024.title: Appropriation; Treasurer's Office.
3024.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The State Treasurer's Office For Fiscal Year 2018.

3025.title: Appropriation; Debt Service-Gen. Obli.
3025.description: An Act Making An Appropriation For The Payment Of Service Charges To Banks For Acting As Agents Of The State In Paying Full Faith And Credit Bonds And Interest Of The State Of Mississippi, From The Effective Date Of This Act Until Such Bonds Shall Be Paid Or Until June 30, 2018, Whichever Shall First Occur; And For The Payment Of Maturing Bonds And Interest On The Full Faith And Credit Bonds Of The State Of Mississippi Falling Due During Fiscal Year 2018.

3026.title: Appropriation; Development Authority, Mississippi.
3026.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To Defray The Expenses Of The Mississippi Development Authority For Fiscal Year 2018.

3027.title: Appropriation FY2018; Alcorn State University for support of horticulture programs.
3027.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Support Of Horticulture Research And Extension Programs At Alcorn State University For Fiscal Year 2018.

3029.title: Local System Bridge Replacement and Rehabilitation Fund; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds to provide funds for.
3029.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $50,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Local System Bridge Replacement And Rehabilitation Program; To Amend Section 65-37-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

3030.title: Internet Protection and Tax Relief Act; exempt from use tax sales of items purchased through the use of the Internet.
3030.description: An Act To Create The "internet Protection And Tax Relief Act"; To Amend Section 27-67-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt The Use, Storage Or Consumption Of Items Purchased Through The Use Of The Internet From Sales Taxation; To Amend Section 27-67-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Department Of Revenue From Auditing Taxpayers For Nonpayment Of Use Taxes; To Provide That Certain Rules Regarding The Collection Of Use Tax By Out-of-state Sellers Proposed By The Department Of Revenue Shall Not Take Effect; To Create A Committee To Study Phasing Out Income Taxation Of Corporations; And For Related Purposes.

3031.title: Bonds; authorize the issuance of to construct faculty and Socially Disadvantaged Farmers & Ranchers Policy Research Center.
3031.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Building And Related Facilities To House The Socially Disadvantaged Farmers And Ranchers Policy Center On The Campus Of Alcorn State University; And For Related Purposes.

3032.title: City of McComb; extend repeal date on tourism tax.
3032.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 916, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Chapter 910, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, To Impose A Tourism Tax Within The City, And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Promote Tourism, Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

3033.title: City of McComb; authorize the imposition of a sales tax to fund infrastructure projects.
3033.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The City Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 60% Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The City Solely To Fund The Establishing Of Storm Drainage Or Sewerage Systems, Construction, Repair, Rehabilitation And Reconstruction Of Roadways, Sidewalks, Driveways, Parkways, Walkways Or Public Parking Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

3034.title: Taxation; revise definition of "hotel" or "motel" under local and private law that tax hotels and motels.
3034.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-23.1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Definition Of The Term "hotel" Or "motel" For Any Tax Levied And Collected Under The Authority Of A Local And Private Law Of The State Of Mississippi To Include Short-term Lodging In Residential Properties Listed By, Or Rented Through The Use Of, An Online Marketplace Company And Homestay Network Where The Cost Of The Accommodations Are Set By The Property Owner; And For Related Purposes.

3035.title: Appropriation; additional appropriations for various state agencies for FY 2017.
3035.description: An Act Making An Additional Appropriation Of General Funds, Capital Expense Funds, Budget Contingency Funds And Special Funds To Defray The Expenses Of Various Agencies For Fiscal Years 2017 And 2018 And Related Purposes.

3036.title: City of Greenwood; extend the repeal date on the Greenwood Tourism Commission.
3036.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 813, Local And Private Laws Of 1989, As Last Amended By Chapter 936, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Date Of Repeal On The Provision Of Law That Establishes The Greenwood Tourism Commission And Authorizes The City Of Greenwood To Impose A Tax On Hotels, Motels And Restaurants; To Remove The Provisions That Require The Greenwood Tourism Commission To Make Donations To Certain Organizations; And For Related Purposes.

3038.title: Washington County; extend the tourism tax levied on hotels and motels.
3038.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 951, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Chapter 925, Local And Private Laws Of 2015 To Extend Until July 1, 2022, The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Board Of Supervisors Of Washington County, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Of Up To Two Percent On The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel And Motel Room Rentals Within The County, And To Expend The Proceeds Of The Tax To Establish A Sports Complex For Youth Within The County; And For Related Purposes.

3039.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt certain personal property that produce tax revenue of $100.00 or less.
3039.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation All Personal Property Owned Or Leased By An Individual Or Entity If All Such Property Produces Tax Revenue Of $100.00 Or Less; And For Related Purposes.

3041.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt certain vessels used in oil exploration or production while in possession of builder.
3041.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Vessels While In The Possession Of The Manufacturer, Builder Or Converter That Are Used For The Exploration For, Or Production Of, Oil, Gas And Other Minerals Offshore Outside The Boundaries Of This State And Vessels That Were Used For The Exploration For, Or Production Of, Oil, Gas And Other Minerals That Are Converted To A New Service For Use Outside The Boundaries Of This State; To Provide That A Vessel Exempt From Taxation Under This Provision May Not Be Exempt For A Period Of More Than Three Years Unless Certain Action Is Taken By Local Governing Authorities; To Amend Section 27-65-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Sales Of Component Materials Used In The Construction Of A Building, Or Any Addition Or Improvement Thereon, Sales Of Machinery And/or Equipment To Be Used Therein, And Sales Of Processing Machinery And Equipment Which Is Permanently Attached To The Ground Or To A Permanent Foundation Which Is Not By Its Nature Intended To Be Housed In A Building Structure, No Later Than Three Months After Initial Startup Or Expansion Of A Certain Permanent Enterprise Engaged In The Conversion Of Natural Sand Into Proppants Used In Oil And Gas Exploration And Development With At Least 95% Of Such Proppants Used In The Production Of Oil And/or Gas From Horizontally Drilled Wells And/or Horizontally Drilled Recompletion Wells; To Amend Section 27-65-107, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Electricity, Current, Power, Steam, Coal, Natural Gas, Liquefied Petroleum Gas Or Other Fuel To A Permanent Enterprise That Is Eligible For Such Exemption Upon Completion Of The Expansion Upon Which Such Exemption Is Based If Certain Requirements Are Met; And For Related Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

3043.title: Income taxation; increase credits authorized for providers of broadband services at institutions of higher learning.
3043.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-111-1, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Extend Until July 1, 2028, The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law That Authorizes The Governor To Issue To A Telecommunication Enterprise That Has Contracted With The State To Provide Broadband Telecommunications Service To Institutions Of Higher Learning A Payment Credit Voucher In Lieu Of Cash Payment And Provides That The Payment Credit Voucher Entitles The Telecommunications Enterprise To A Credit Against The Income Tax Liability Of Such Telecommunications Enterprise; To Increase The Aggregate Amount Of Such Credits That May Be Issued In Any One Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

3045.title: Bonds; authorize g.o. bonds to assist in repair, renovation, restoration & expansion of the Houlka Community Center.
3045.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Houlka Community Center In Chickasaw County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3049.title: Bonds; issue for the construction of career tech buildings at the Greenville Higher Education Center.
3049.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of Two Career Technical Buildings At The Greenville Higher Education Center; And For Related Purposes.

3050.title: Bonds; authorize for extension of the Tanglefoot Trailhead Extension in Houston, MS.
3050.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Houston, Mississippi, In Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping An Extension Of The Tanglefoot Trailhead Pavilion In The City; And For Related Purposes.

3051.title: Ad valorem taxation; exempt intangibles of banks from.
3051.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-35-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt Intangibles Of A Bank Or Banking Association From Ad Valorem Taxation; To Repeal Sections 27-35-35, 27-35-37 And 27-35-39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Provide For The Ad Valorem Taxation Of The Intangibles Of A Bank Or Of The Capital To The Owner Thereof In Case The Bank Is Not A Corporation Or Joint-stock Company, Are Repealed; And For Related Purposes.

3053.title: Bonds; create Mississippi Site Development Grant program and authorize bonds for it and various MDA programs and state shipyard.
3053.description: An Act To Create The Mississippi Site Development Grant Program To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority For The Purpose Of Providing Grants To Municipalities, Counties And Local Economic Development Organizations To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Improving The Marketability Of Publicly Owned Industrial Property For Industrial Economic Development Purposes; To Create The Mississippi Site Development Grant Fund To Be Administered By The Mississippi Development Authority; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $2,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Site Development Grant Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The State-owned Shipyard Located In Jackson County, Mississippi; To Provide That The Issuance Of Such Bonds Shall Be Conditioned On The Lessee Incurring A Certain Amount Of Debt And/or Dedicating A Certain Amount Of Funds For Capital Improvements, Capital Investments Or Capital Upgrades To Shipyards In Mississippi Owned Or Leased By Such Lessee; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $10,000,000.00 For The Ace Fund; To Amend Section 57-61-25, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $7,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act; To Amend Section 57-61-36, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase The Amount Of Bond Proceeds That The Mississippi Development Authority May Utilize Under The Mississippi Business Investment Act To Make Grants Or Loans To Counties And Municipalities Through An Equipment And Public Facilities Grant And Loan Fund To Aid In Infrastructure-related Improvements, The Purchase Of Equipment And In The Purchase, Construction Or Repair And Renovation Of Facilities; To Amend Section 57-75-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase From $67,000,000.00 To $68,000,000.00 The Amount Of General Obligation Bonds That May Be Issued Under The Mississippi Major Economic Impact Act For Projects Designed To Enhance Facilities That Are At Risk For Closure Pursuant To The Base Closure And Realignment Act Of 1991 Or Other Applicable Federal Law; And For Related Purposes.

3055.title: City of Greenville; authorize the issuance of general obligation bonds for improvements to certain city streets.
3055.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Greenville, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To Portions Of Broadway Street And Reed Road Located In The City Of Greenville; And For Related Purposes.

3056.title: Appropriation from BP Settlement funds FY 2018; MDOT fund I-10 Connector Road Phases 2 and 3.
3056.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Transportation From Bp Settlement Funds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Interstate 10 Connector Road Phases 2 And 3; And For Related Purposes.

3059.title: Coahoma County; clarify to whom economic development authority may sell, lease, exchange, etc., certain industrial sites.
3059.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 862, Local And Private Laws Of 1981, As Last Amended By Chapter 906, Local And Private Laws Of 2008, To Make It Clear That The Economic Development Authority Of Coahoma County May Sell, Lease, Trade, Exchange Or Otherwise Dispose Of Certain Industrial Sites To Governmental Entities And Political Subdivisions; And For Related Purposes.

3060.title: Bolivar County; authorize contribution to Fannie Lou Hamer Breast Cancer Foundation.
3060.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Bolivar County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Fannie Lou Hamer Cancer Foundation; And For Related Purposes.

3061.title: City of Brookhaven; extend repeal date on the tax upon room rentals of hotels, motels and bed-and-breakfast establishments.
3061.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 925, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Brookhaven, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals From Hotels, Motels And Bed-and-breakfast Establishments Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

3062.title: Bolivar County; increase the amount that may be contributed to the Bolivar County Community Action Agency, Inc.
3062.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 930, Local And Private Laws Of 2016, To Increase The Amount Of Funds That The Board Of Supervisors Of Bolivar County, Mississippi, May Contribute To The Bolivar County Community Action Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3063.title: Town of Tishomingo; authorize expansion of its gas distribution system into certain areas outside the town.
3063.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Tishomingo In Tishomingo County, Mississippi, To Expand Its Gas Distribution System Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The Town Of Tishomingo; And For Related Purposes.

3065.title: City of Amory; extend the repeal date on the tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
3065.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 905, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Amory, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

3066.title: Rankin County; authorize to regulate the sale of alcoholic beverages in a certain qualified resort area.
3066.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Rankin County, Mississippi, To Specify The Hours Of Operation Of Facilities That Sell Alcoholic Beverages In A Certain Qualified Resort Area Located In The Reservoir Community District, Specify The Percentage Of Revenue That Facilities That Offer Alcoholic Beverages For Sale Must Derive From The Preparation, Cooking And Serving Of Meals And Not From The Sale Of Beverages In Such Qualified Resort Area, And Designate The Areas In Which Facilities That Offer Alcoholic Beverages For Sale May Be Located In Such Qualified Resort Area; And For Related Purposes.

3067.title: Rankin County; authorize to erect and display certain signs on MS 25 near Sandhill.
3067.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Rankin County, Mississippi, To Erect And Display Specially Designed Street Signs Near The Intersection Of Mississippi Highways 25 And 43 Welcoming Individuals To Sandhill, Mississippi, And Acknowledging Tori Bowie As The Winner Of An Olympic Gold Medal At The 2016 Summer Olympics Games Held In Rio De Janeiro, Brazil; And For Related Purposes.

3068.title: City of Madison; authorize the use of golf carts on certain streets within.
3068.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Madison, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within Certain Subdivided Residential Neighborhoods In The City; And For Related Purposes.

3071.title: City of Biloxi; authorize to establish "Biloxi Biometrics and Cybersecurity Center, Inc., a nonprofit corporation.
3071.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Biloxi, Mississippi, To Establish A Nonprofit, Community-based Corporation To Be Known As "biloxi Biometrics And Cybersecurity Center, Inc."; To Authorize Such Authorities To Acquire, Purchase And/or Construct A Biometrics And Nanotechnology Research And Development Center; To Create A Public-private Partnership With Private For-profit And Nonprofit Research And Development Firms And Institutions; And For Related Purposes.

3073.title: DeSoto County; authorize donations to the DeSoto County Economic Development Council, Inc.
3073.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Donate Funds And In-kind Donations And Support To The Desoto County Economic Development Council, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3074.title: Clarke County; authorize donations to Multi-County Community Service Agency, Inc.
3074.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Clarke County, Mississippi, To Donate Funds To Multi-county Community Service Agency, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3075.title: City of Bay St. Louis; may authorize operation of low-speed vehicles and golf carts on certain city streets.
3075.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City Of Bay St. Louis; To Require Individuals Operating A Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License; To Require Certain Registration Of Such Low-speed Vehicle Or Golf Cart; And For Related Purposes.

3076.title: City of Jackson; authorize to create special local improvement taxing districts.
3076.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Create Special Local Improvement Assessment Districts; To Authorize The Levy Of An Assessment Of Up To Six Mills On Taxable Real Property Located Within Such Assessment Districts; To Provide For The Duties And Powers Of Such Assessment Districts; To Require The Dissolution Of Such Assessment Districts Under Certain Circumstances; To Specify The Use For The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment; To Allow Such Districts To Levy Less Than The Maximum Allowable Assessment Levy; To Authorize The Issuance Of Bonds By The Municipality That Has Created A Special Local Improvement Assessment District Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Payable Out Of The Proceeds Of The Special Assessment Authorized Under This Act; To Authorize The Delegation Of Certain Authority Under This Act; To Provide That Bonds Issued Under This Act Shall Be Legal Investments; To Provide That Bonds Issued By The Municipality Under This Act Shall Be Excluded From The Municipality's Debt Limitation; And For Related Purposes.

3078.title: Coahoma County; authorize annual contributions to Spring Initiative, Inc.
3078.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Coahoma County, Mississippi, To Contribute Annually To Spring Initiative, Inc., A Mississippi Nonprofit Corporation; And For Related Purposes.

3080.title: Lauderdale County; authorize contributions to the Multi-County Community Service Agency.
3080.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Multi-county Community Service Agency; And For Related Purposes.

3081.title: Scott County; authorize contributions to the Multi-County Community Service Agency.
3081.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Scott County, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Multi-county Community Service Agency; And For Related Purposes.

3082.title: Newton County; authorize contributions to the Multi-County Community Service Agency.
3082.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Newton County, Mississippi, To Contribute To The Multi-county Community Service Agency; And For Related Purposes.

3083.title: Indianola Tourism Commission and hotel, motel and restaurant tax; extend repeal date.
3083.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 931, Local And Private Laws Of 2003, As Last Amended By Chapter 940, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend Until July 1, 2021, The Repeal Date On The Law That Creates The Indianola Tourism Commission, Provides For The Composition Of The Commission, Prescribes The Powers And Duties Of The Commission And Authorizes The Governing Authorities To Levy A Tax To Fund The Commission; To Require An Election On The Continuation Of The Tax If A Certain Number Of Electors File A Written Protest Against The Continuation Of The Tax; And For Related Purposes.

3084.title: Southaven; extend repeal date on restaurant tax.
3084.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 955, Local And Private Laws Of 2011, As Amended By Chapter 918, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The City Of Southaven, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Beverages And Prepared Food At Restaurants Within The City; To Require That An Election Shall Be Held On June 6, 2017, On The Question Of Continuing The Tax; To Provide That If Sixty Percent Of The Qualified Electors Voting At The Election Do Not Vote In Favor Of Continuing The Tax, The Tax Shall Be Discontinued; And For Related Purposes.

3085.title: City of Louisville; reenact the hotel and motel tax and extend the repeal date on the tax until July 1, 2021.
3085.description: An Act To Reenact And Amend Chapter 907, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Louisville, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals For Hotels Or Motels In The City And To Establish A Tourism And Economic Advisory Board; And For Related Purposes.

3086.title: Bonds; authorize for construction of Phases 1 and 2 of the Interstate 10 Connector Road in Jackson County.
3086.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Additional Funds For Use By The Mississippi Department Of Transportation For The Construction Of Phases 1 And 2 Of The Interstate 10 Connector Road In Jackson County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3088.title: City of Byram; extend repeal date on hotel and motel tax.
3088.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 942, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Byram, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Room Rentals For Hotels Or Motels Within The City; And For Related Purposes.

3089.title: Restrictions on education spending.
3089.description: A Resolution To Place Restrictions On Education Spending.

3090.title: Congratulate Board of Directors of The Mississippi Arts and Entertainment Experience (THE MAX) on its inaugural Hall of Fame.
3090.description: A Resolution Congratulating The Board Of Directors Of The Mississippi Arts And Entertainment Experience (the Max) In Meridian, Mississippi, Upon The Announcement Of The Inaugural Class Of Its Hall Of Fame Artists And Entertainers.

3091.title: Congratulate Kristy D'Anna Johnson for being named Miss Black Mississippi USA 2017.
3091.description: A Resolution Congratulating Kristy D'anna Johnson Upon Being Named Miss Black Mississippi Usa 2017, And Extending Best Wishes For Success In The National Pageant.

3092.title: Recognize successful application for designating the Mississippi State Capitol Building as a National Historic Landmark.
3092.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Congratulating The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History And Legislative Staff For Their Successful Application To The United States Department Of Interior For Naming The Mississippi State Capitol Building As A National Historic Landmark Which Is A Rare Designation Marking The Building's Architectural Significance.

3093.title: Commend Mississippi Commissioner of Agriculture and Commerce for appointment to President's Agriculture Advisory Committee.
3093.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mississippi's Commissioner Of Agriculture And Commerce Cindy Hyde-smith Upon Her Appointment As Co-chairman Of The Agriculture Advisory Committee To President-elect Donald Trump And Her Selection By Governing Magazine As A National Top 25 Female Leader.

3094.title: Commend Brigadier General J. Roy Robinson (retired) of Meridian as new President of the National Guard Association of United States.
3094.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Brigadier General J. Roy Robinson (retired) Of Meridian, Mississippi, As The New President Of The National Guard Association Of The United States (ngaus).

3095.title: Commend the life and honor the military, civic and charitable service of Eugene S. Clarke, III, of Hollandale, Mississippi.
3095.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Military, Civic And Charitable Service Of Hollandale, Mississippi, Businessman Eugene S. Clarke, Iii, And Extending The Condolences Of The Legislature On His Passing.

3096.title: Commend life of Vicksburg Business and Civic Leader Larry Lambiotte and extend the condolences of the Legislature.
3096.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Life Of Vicksburg Business And Community Leader Larry Louis Lambiotte, Sr., And Extending The Condolences Of The Legislature To His Bereaved Family.

3097.title: Commend Lafayette High School "Commodores" Football Team for winning 2016 Class 4A State Championship.
3097.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Lafayette High School "commodores" Football Team And Head Coach Michael Fair For Winning The 2016 Mhsaa Class 4a State Championship.

3098.title: Recognize Pole Vault Star Sam Kendricks for winning the Bronze Medal at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro.
3098.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute And Congratulating Oxford High School And University Of Mississippi Pole Vault Standout Sam Kendricks For Winning The Bronze Medal At The 2016 Summer Olympics In Rio De Janeiro, Brazil.

3099.title: Pay tribute to life and legacy of Mississippi Delta Music Legend Mose Allison of Tippo, Mississippi.
3099.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Life And Legacy Of Mississippi Delta Music Legend Mose Allison Of Tippo, Mississippi.

3100.title: Recognize the service of retiring Mississippi Supreme Court Justice Ann Lamar of Senatobia, Mississippi.
3100.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Professional And Public Service Of Mississippi Supreme Court Justice Ann H. Lamar Of Senatobia As The Recipient Of The 2016 Chief Justice Award And On The Occasion Of Her Retirement From The Court.

3101.title: Recognize 150th Anniversary Celebration of Incorporation of Town of Terry, Mississippi.
3101.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating And Extending The Greetings Of The Legislature On The Occasion Of The Sesquicentennial (150th) Anniversary Celebration Of The Incorporation Of The Town Of Terry, Mississippi.

3102.title: Designate March 3, 2017, as "National Speech and Debate Education Day in Mississippi."
3102.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating March 3, 2017, As "national Speech And Debate Education Day" In Mississippi.

3103.title: Mourn the loss and commend the life and public service of former Senator and President Pro Tempore Bob Perry.
3103.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Former Senator And President Pro Tempore Bobby Gerald "bob" Perry Of Southaven, Mississippi, And Expressing The Condolences Of The Mississippi Legislature To His Family.

3104.title: Commend ECCC "Diamond Warriors" Baseball Team and Coach Neal Holliman for State Championship.
3104.description: A Concurrent Resolution Congratulating The East Central Community College "diamond Warriors" Baseball Team And Head Coach Neal Holliman For Their Outstanding 2016 Season And For Winning The Mississippi Association Of Community And Junior Colleges State Baseball Championship.

3105.title: Mourn the passing of Civil Rights Advocate and retired Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Mississippi Duncan Gray, Jr.
3105.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Civil Rights Advocate And Retired Bishop Of The Episcopal Diocese Of Mississippi Right Reverend Duncan Montgomery Gray, Jr., And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3106.title: Honoring the Gospel music excellence of Lee Williams & The Spiritual QC's of Tupelo, Mississippi.
3106.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Gospel Music Excellence Of Lee Williams & The Spiritual Qc's Of Tupelo, Mississippi, And Congratulating Dr. Lee Williams Upon His Receipt Of An Honorary Doctorate Of Sacred Music.

3107.title: Commend higher education advocacy of Dr. L. Stacy Davidson, Jr., of Oxford, Mississippi, and extend the sympathy of the Legislature.
3107.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Higher Education Advocacy Of Dr. L. Stacy Davidson, Jr., Of Oxford, Mississippi, And Extending The Condolences Of The Legislature On His Passing.

3108.title: Mourn the passing and recognize the legacy of Dr. Norman C. Nelson as transformative leader of UMMC.
3108.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing Of Dr. Norman C. Nelson And Recognizing His Outstanding Leadership Of The University Of Mississippi Medical Center Into A Nationally Respected Health Sciences Campus And Teaching Hospital, And Extending The Sympathy Of The Legislature.

3109.title: Commend Tupelo High School Boys Swim Team for 10th straight State Title.
3109.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Tupelo High School "golden Wave" Boys Swim Team And Coach Lucas Smith For Winning Their 10th Consecutive Mhsaa State Title.

3110.title: Recognize Warrant Officer Jessi McCormick of Olive Branch as first female Apache Helicopter Pilot in the MS. National Guard.
3110.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Warrant Officer Jessi Mccormick Of Olive Branch, Mississippi, As The First Female Apache Helicopter Pilot In The Mississippi National Guard And Commending Her As A Powerful Role Model For Young Women In Our State.

3111.title: Honor military service of Mississippi National Guard Adjutant General Augustus L. (Leon)Collins.
3111.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Military Service Of Mississippi National Guard Adjutant General Augustus L. (leon) Collins Of Booneville, Mississippi, The First African-american General In The History Of The State, On The Occasion Of His Retirement.

3112.title: Mourn the passing and salute the WWII Fighter Pilot service of former Biloxi Mayor and State Representative Jerry O'Keefe.
3112.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Passing And Saluting The Service Of Heroic World War Ii Fighter Pilot And Former Biloxi Mayor, Businessman And State Representative Jeremiah Joseph "jerry" O'keefe, Iii.

3113.title: Commend St. Martin High School Lady "Yellow Jackets" Girls Golf Team for first-ever State Championship.
3113.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The St. Martin High School Lady "yellow Jackets" Girls Golf Team And Head Coach Brandon Laird For Winning Their First-ever State Class Iii Golf Championship, Which Is The Second Team State Championship In School History.

3114.title: Commend Delta State University "Statesmen" Baseball Team and Coach Mike Kinnison for 13th Gulf South Conference Championship.
3114.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Delta State University "statesmen" Baseball Team And Head Coach Mike Kinnison For Winning Their 13th Gulf South Conference Tournament Championship.

3115.title: Recognize Oxford High School and Oxford School District as First in Class in Statewide Accountability Results.
3115.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Oxford High School For Its "a" Accountability Rating And Recognizing The Oxford School District (osd) For Its First-place State Ranking In The 2015-2016 Accountability Results Which Is The First Year Of New State Tests.

3116.title: Commend 2016 Clinton High School "Arrows" Football Team for winning their first Class 6A State Championship.
3116.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2016 Clinton High School "arrows" Football Team Led By Outstanding Senior Cam Akers And Head Coach Judd Boswell For Winning Their First Mhsaa Class 6a State Championship.

3117.title: Recognize Southern Mississippi Alum Tori Bowie for spectacular win of Bronze, Silver and Gold Medals in the 2016 Rio Olympics.
3117.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To Former University Of Southern Mississippi Track And Field Standout And Sandhill Native Tori Bowie For Winning Three Medals In The 2016 Rio Olympics.

3118.title: Commend civil and spiritual leadership of Presbyterian Christian School founding Board Member Jere Gunn.
3118.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Civic Leadership And Charitable Services Of Presbyterian Christian School Founding Board Member Mr. Jere Gunn.

3119.title: Commend the Lewisburg High School "Marching Patriots" Band and staff for winning three consecutive Class 5A State Championships.
3119.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Lewisburg High School "marching Patriots" Band And Director Kim Hallmark For Winning Three Consecutive Class 5a State Marching Band Championships.

3120.title: Commend the law enforcement career of former Sheriff Malcolm (Mac) McMillin and extend the condolences of the Legislature.
3120.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Law Enforcement Career Of Longtime Hinds County Sheriff Malcolm E. "mac" Mcmillin And Extending The Condolences Of The Legislature To His Bereaved Family On His Passing.

3121.title: Congratulate Indiana State Representative Cherrish Pryor from Holly Springs upon her election as Chair of Indiana Black Caucus.
3121.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Recognize And Congratulate Indiana State Representative Cherrish Pryor From Holly Springs, Mississippi, Upon Her Election As Chair Of The Indiana Black Legislative Caucus.

3122.title: Recognize Reverend George Willis Tyler on the occasion of his retirement of 46 years of Christian Leadership.
3122.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Recognition Of The Mississippi Legislature On The Occasion Of The Retirement Celebration Of 49 Years Of Christian Leadership By Reverend George Willis Tyler On January 14, 2017, At The Pearl Street African Methodist Episcopal Church In Jackson, Mississippi.

3123.title: Recognize Janice Mitchell longtime Congressional Constituent Aide, on the occasion of her retirement.
3123.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Longtime Congressional Constituent Aide Janice Mitchell Of Madison, Mississippi, The Only African-american Woman To Have Worked For Two Mississippi Senators, On The Occasion Of Her Retirement.

3124.title: Commend Miss Black Mississippi 2016 Robin Y. Jackson who placed at the National Miss Black America Pageant Second Runner-Up.
3124.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Miss Black Mississippi 2016 Robin Y. Jackson From Jackson, Mississippi, Who Placed Second Runner-up At The 48th Annual National Miss Black America Pageant.

3126.title: Constitution; remove the electoral vote requirement for Governor.
3126.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 140 And Repealing Sections 141 And 142 To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Electoral Vote Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives And To Provide That The Person Receiving The Highest Popular Vote At The General Election Shall Be Governor.

3127.title: Constitution; authorize legislative oversight and veto power over executive administrative regulations.
3127.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Authorize Legislative Oversight And Veto Power Over Executive Administrative Regulations; And For Related Purposes.

3128.title: Extend sympathy to the bereaved family of Colonel William Eugene Berry, U.S. Army (Retired) who passed away on October 18, 2016.
3128.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Deepest Sympathy Of The Mississippi Legislature To The Bereaved Family Of Vietnam War Veteran, Officer And Braxton Civic Leader Colonel William Eugene Berry, United States Army (retired).

3129.title: Joint Study on Growth in State Spending for the Mississippi Medicaid Program; direct Medicaid Committees to conduct.
3129.description: A Concurrent Resolution Directing The Senate Medicaid Committee And The House Medicaid Committee To Conduct A Joint Study And Evaluation To Develop And Make Recommendations Concerning The Growth In State Spending For The Mississippi Medicaid Program; To Direct The Joint Committee To Make A Written Report Of Its Findings And Recommendations Before December 1, 2017; And For Related Purposes.

3130.title: Recognize February 23, 2017, as "Rotary Day in Mississippi."
3130.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Rotary International As Mississippi's Largest Service Club And Designating February 23, 2017, As "rotary Day In Mississippi."

3131.title: Joint Rules of Mississippi Legislature; amend to provide that Legislature shall not convene on Easter Sunday.
3131.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend Joint Rule No. 40 To Provide That The Legislature Shall Not Convene On Easter Sunday.

3132.title: Pay tribute to the memory and illustrious career of Mississippi Sports Legend Dave Meadow "Boo" Ferriss.
3132.description: A Concurrent Resolution Paying Tribute To The Memory And Illustrious Career Of Mississippi Sports Legend Dave Meadow "boo" Ferriss.

3133.title: Recognize Dr. William C. Bell as President and CEO of Casey Family Foster Care Programs.
3133.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Recognition Of The Mississippi Legislature To The Public Service And Professional Honors Of Delta State University Graduate Dr. William C. Bell, President And Ceo Of The Casey Family Foster Care Programs.

3134.title: Commend life and legacy of public service of Mr. Charles Noel Hughes.
3134.description: A Concurrent Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commending The Life And Public Service Of Mr. Charles Noel Hughes, Respected Employee Of The Mississippi Department Of Wildlife, Fisheries And Parks, And Expressing The Sympathy Of The Legislature To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

3135.title: Recognize outstanding athletic excellence of Clinton High School Quarterback Cam Akers "Mississippi Player of the Year."
3135.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing The Outstanding Athletic Excellence Of Clinton High School Star Quarterback Cam Akers And Congratulating Him For His Record-setting 2016 Season And As "2016 Gatorade Mississippi Player Of The Year."

3136.title: Constitution; place term limits on legislators.
3136.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Limit The Number Of Terms A Person May Serve In The Mississippi House Of Representatives And The Mississippi Senate; And For Related Purposes.

3137.title: United States Constitutional Convention under Article V; apply for federal debt consideration.
3137.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying To The Congress Of The United States To Call An Amendment Convention Of The States Pursuant To Article V Of The United States Constitution Limited To Proposing Amendments That Impose Fiscal Restraints On The Federal Government, Limit The Power And Jurisdiction Of The Federal Government, And Limit The Terms Of Office For Its Officials And For Members Of Congress.

3138.title: Urge Congress to call Constitutional Convention to limit campaign spending.
3138.description: A Concurrent Resolution Petitioning The United States Congress To Convene A Limited Convention For The Exclusive Purpose Of Proposing A Free And Fair Elections Amendment To The United States Constitution.

3139.title: Constitution; change terms of office of members of State Board of Education from nine to four years.
3139.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 203 Of The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Change The Terms Of Office Of The Members Of The State Board Of Education From 9 To 4 Years; And For Related Purposes.

3140.title: United States Constitutional Convention under Article V; apply for federal balanced budget consideration.
3140.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A United States Constitution Article V Amendments Convention Specifically Relating To A Federal Balanced Budget Requirement.

3141.title: Constitution; amend Section 241 to allow felons to vote and restore civil rights upon meeting certain conditions.
3141.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Persons Convicted Of A Felony Shall Be Eligible To Vote And For Restoration Of Civil Rights Upon Meeting Certain Conditions; And For Related Purposes.

3142.title: United States Constitutional Convention under Article V; apply for federal debt limitation and congressional term limits.
3142.description: A Concurrent Resolution Applying For A United States Constitution Article V Amendments Convention Specifically Relating To The Federal Debt And To Congressional Term Limits.

3143.title: Honoring President Barack Obama as he leaves office and his historic legacy as the first African-American President of the US.
3143.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring President Barack Hussein Obama As He Leaves Office And The Historic Significance Of His Becoming The First African-american President Of The United States.

3144.title: Designate "National Wear Red Day" in Mississippi to bring awareness to cardiovascular disease in women.
3144.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Designate February 3, 2017, As American Heart Association "national Wear Red Day" In Mississippi To Bring Awareness To The Effects Of Cardiovascular Disease In Women.

3145.title: Commend and congratulate Laura Lee Lewis upon being crowned Miss Mississippi 2016 and as Fourth Runner-Up in the Miss America Pageant.
3145.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Laura Lee Lewis Of Brookhaven, Mississippi, Upon Being Crowned Miss Mississippi 2016 And As The Fourth Runner-up In The Miss America Pageant On September 11, 2016.

3146.title: Remembering the historic service of P.O. First Class Jim Johnston who was lost on the USS Oklahoma during the bombing of Pearl Harbor.
3146.description: A Concurrent Resolution Remembering The Historic Service Of Petty Officer First Class Jim H. Johnston Who Was Lost 75 Years Ago On The Battleship Uss Oklahoma During The Bombing Of Pearl Harbor And Extending The Condolences Of The Mississippi Legislature On The Occasion Of His Interment In Wesson Cemetery On December 7, 2016.

3147.title: Recognize Mississippi Songwriter and Recording Artist, Steve Azar, as Music and Culture Ambassador for 2017.
3147.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing Mississippi Songwriter-recording Artist Steve Azar, As Unofficial Music And Culture Ambassador For The State Of Mississippi And Welcoming Him On The Occasion Of The Mississippi Tourism Association Legislative Reception On January 25, 2017.

3148.title: Honor the legacy of Dr. Robert Smith as hero of health care in Mississippi during the Civil Rights Era.
3148.description: A Concurrent Resolution Honoring The Lifetime Achievements Of Dr. Robert Smith, M.d., As The Champion And Hero Of Health Care In Mississippi During The Civil Rights Era.

3149.title: Recognize AARP Mississippi on the occasion of "AARP Day at the Capitol."
3149.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Honoring The Advocacy And Services Provided By Aarp Mississippi On The Occasion Of "aarp Day At The Capitol" On February 9, 2017.

3150.title: Recognize Dr. William R. (Bill) Ferris as recipient of the 2017 Governor's Arts Award for Lifetime Achievement.
3150.description: A Concurrent Resolution Extending The Recognition Of The Mississippi Legislature To Dr. William R. (bill) Ferris As Recipient Of The 2017 Governor's Arts Award For Lifetime Achievement.

3151.title: Commend Calhoun City High School "Wildcats" Football Team for State Championship in honor of departed team member Tripp Macon.
3151.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Calhoun City High School "wildcats" Football Team And Coach Perry Liles For Winning Their First State Title Since 1989 In Honor Of Departed Team Member Tripp Macon.

3152.title: Constitution; prohibit pardon of certain violent crimes and revise notice requirements for other crimes.
3152.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 124, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Governor Cannot Grant Pardons For Certain Violent Crimes And To Require Publication Of Notice Before The Governor Pardons Certain Other Felony Crimes; And For Related Purposes.

3153.title: Designate May 2017 as "Mental Health Awareness Month in Mississippi."
3153.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Designate May 2017 As "mental Health Awareness Month In Mississippi" To Focus On Habits And Behaviors That Increase The Risk Of Developing Or Exacerbating Mental Illnesses.

3154.title: Commission on Judicial Performance subject to Open Meetings; require transcripts under Open Records.
3154.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 177a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That The Records And Proceedings Of The Commission On Judicial Performance Shall Be Open To The Public; And For Related Purposes.

3155.title: Designate April 11, 2017, as "Equal Pay Day in Mississippi."
3155.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Designate April 11, 2017, As "equal Pay Day In Mississippi".

3156.title: Urge the U.S. Dept. of the Treasury to place a woman's face on our paper currency in honor of 100th Anniversary of Women's Suffrage.

3258.description: A Concurrent Resolution Suspending The Deadlines For The Purpose Of Requesting The Drafting, Introduction, Consideration And Passage Of A Bill Entitled "an Act To Amend Sections 27-7-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delay Until Calendar Year 2019, The Beginning Of The Phase Out Of Income Taxation On The First $5,000.00 Of Taxable Income; To Amend Section 27-7-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delay Until Calendar Year 2018, The Implementation Of The Provision That Allows A Portion Of The Federal Self-employment Tax Imposed Against Self-employed Individuals To Be Allowed As An Adjustment To Gross Income Under The State Income Tax Law; To Amend Sections 27-13-5 And 27-13-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Delay Until Calendar Year 2019, The Beginning Of The Phase Out Of The Corporation Franchise Tax; To Amend Section 5, Chapter 499, Laws Of 2016, To Delay The Repeal Of The Corporation Franchise Tax Law Until January 1, 2029; And For Related Purposes".
